describe: When someone is afraid, they feel fear.
sample: → The woman was afraid of what she saw.

describe: To agree is to say “yes” or to think the same way.
sample: → A: The food is very good in that restaurant. B: I agree with you.

describe: When someone is angry, they may want to speak loudly or fight.
sample: → She didn’t do her homework, so her father is angry.

describe: To arrive is to get to or reach some place.
sample: → The bus always arrives at the corner of my street at 4:00.

describe: To attack is to try to fight or to hurt.
sample: → The man with the sword attacked the other man first.

describe: The bottom is the lowest part.
sample: → The bottom of my shoe has a hole in it.

describe: When someone is clever, they can solve a hard puzzle or problem.
sample: → The clever boy thought of a good idea.

describe: When someone is cruel, they do bad things to hurt others.
sample: → The cruel man yelled at his sister.

describe: If something happens finally, it happens after a longtime or at the end.
sample: → He finally crossed the finish line after five hours of running.

describe: To hide is to try not to let others see you.
sample: → The other children will hide while you count to 100.

describe: To hunt is to look for or search for an animal to kill.
sample: → Long ago, people hunted with bows and arrows.

describe: A lot means a large number or amount of people, animals, things, etc.
sample: → There are a lot of apples in the basket.

describe: The middle of something is the center or halfway point.
sample: → The Canadian flag has a maple leaf in the middle of it.

describe: A moment is a second or a very short time.
sample: → I was only a few moments late for the meeting.

describe: When someone is pleased, they are happy.
sample: → She was pleased with the phone call she received.

describe: To promise is to say you will do something for sure.
sample: → He promised to return my key by tomorrow.

describe: To reply is to give an answer or say back to someone.
sample: → She asked him what time his meeting was. He replied, “at three.”

describe: When a person is safe, they are not in danger.
sample: → Put on your seat belt in the car to be safe.

describe: A trick is something you do to fool another person.
sample: → His card trick really surprised us.

describe: You use well to say that something was done in a good way.
sample: → The couple can dance quite well.

describe: An adventure is a fun or exciting thing that you do.
sample: → Riding in the rough water was an adventure.

describe: To approach something means to move close to it.
sample: → The boy approached his school.

describe: Carefully means with great attention, especially to detail or safety.
sample: → The baby carefully climbed down the stairs.

describe: A chemical is something that scientists use in chemistry.
sample: → The scientist mixed the chemicals.

describe: To create means to make something new.
sample: → She created an igloo from blocks of snow.

describe: Evil describes something or someone bad or cruel, not good.
sample: → The evil figure scared us all.

describe: An experiment is a test that you do to see what will happen.
sample: → The student did an experiment in science class.

describe: To kill someone or something is to make them die.
sample: → I killed the fly with a fly swatter.

describe: A laboratory is a room where a scientist works.
sample: → My mother works in a laboratory.

describe: Laugh is the sound made when someone is happy or a funny thing occurs.
sample: → The sound of their laugh filled the room.

describe: If a sound is loud, it is strong and very easy to hear.
sample: → The man’s voice was so loud that we all could hear him.

describe: When a person is nervous, they think something bad will happen.
sample: → The boy became nervous when he heard the news.

describe: A noise is an unpleasant sound.
sample: → The crying baby made a loud noise.

describe: A project is a type of work that you do for school ora job.
sample: → His afternoon work project was to paint the room green.

describe: To scare someone is to make them feel afraid.
sample: → My uncle was scared by what he saw in the room.

describe: A secret is something that you do not tell other people.
sample: → The two boys were sharing a secret.

describe: To shout is to say something loudly.
sample: → My boss shouted at me because I was late for work.

describe: To smell something means to use your nose to sense it.
sample: → The two friends smelled the flower.

describe: If something is terrible, it is very bad.
sample: → The way he treated his classmate was terrible.

describe: If something is worse, it is of poorer quality than another thing.
sample: → Business was worse this month than last month.

describe: An alien is a creature from a different world.
sample: → The alien came in peace.

describe: If you are among certain things, they are all around you.
sample: → There was a red apple among the green ones.

describe: A chart is a list of information.
sample: → We used a chart to see how we had improved.

describe: A cloud is a group of water drops in the sky.
sample: → The sky was filled with white clouds.

describe: To comprehend something is to understand it.
sample: → Henry could not comprehend the message.

describe: To describe is to say or write what someone or something is like.
sample: → They described their tree as colorful with gold ribbon and a star.

describe: Ever means at any time.
sample: → Going skiing last winter was the most fun I’ve ever had.

describe: To fail means you do not succeed in what you try to do.
sample: → Since he failed to get the job, he was sad.

describe: Friendly is behaving in a pleasant, kind way toward someone.
sample: → The friendly animals came up to the girl.

describe: A grade is a score or mark given to someone’s work.
sample: → I managed to get good grades on my report card.

describe: Instead means in place of.
sample: → He ate the carrot instead of the ice cream.

describe: A library is a place where you go to read books.
sample: → The library at school is full of books.

describe: A planet is a large round thing in space.
sample: → Saturn is the planet with the ring around it.

describe: A report is something students write for school.
sample: → Karen had trouble writing her report.

describe: Several is more than two but not many.
sample: → He had to read several books for class.

describe: To solve something is to find an answer to it.
sample: → All the students could easily solve the math problem.

describe: If something happens suddenly, it happens quickly and unexpectedly.
sample: → I was suddenly surprised by the cake my friends brought me.

describe: To suppose is to guess.
sample: → I suppose I should go home now.

describe: The universe is the known or supposed objects in space.
sample: → The universe is so large that it cannot be measured.

describe: To view is to look at something.
sample: → Michael likes to view himself in the mirror.

describe: When a thing is appropriate, it is right or normal.
sample: → It’s appropriate to wear a suit when you go to the office.

describe: To avoid something is to stay away from it.
sample: → Avoid the broken bottle on the floor.

describe: To behave is to act in a particular way, especially to be good.
sample: → She always behaves well when her father is around.

describe: When someone is calm, they do not get excited or upset.
sample: → A nice warm bath makes me feel so calm.

describe: Concern is a feeling of worry.
sample: → I was filled with concern after reading the newspaper.

describe: To be content is to be happy and not want more.
sample: → The baby looked very content sitting on the floor.

describe: If you expect something to happen, you believe it will happen.
sample: → I expect the bus to be here very soon.

describe: When something happens frequently, it happens often.
sample: → We meet frequently, either at the beginning or ending of the week.

describe: A habit is a thing that you do often.
sample: → Smoking is a bad habit that can kill you.

describe: To instruct is to teach.
sample: → My teacher instructs us in several subjects.

describe: An issue is an important topic.
sample: → The men spoke about issues that were important to the people.

describe: None means not any of someone or something.
sample: → He spent all his money. There is none left.

describe: If a person is patient, they don’t become angry or upset easily.
sample: → I had to be patient and wait until 5 o’clock to leave.

describe: If something is positive, it is good.
sample: → She has a positive future ahead of her after finishing college.

describe: To punish means to make someone suffer for breaking the rules or laws.
sample: → To punish me, my teacher had me stand in the corner.

describe: To represent is to speak or act for a person or group.
sample: → My lawyer will represent me in court.

describe: To shake is to move back and forth or up and down quickly.

describe: To spread is to move quickly to more places.
sample: → I like to spread butter on my toast.

describe: To stroll means to walk slowly and calmly.

describe: A village is a very small town.

describe: If you are aware of something, you know about it.
sample: → I was not aware of the ringing phone.

describe: Badly means in a severe or harmful way.
sample: → He hurt his arm badly playing with friends.

describe: If something belongs to you, you own it.
sample: → The blue suit belongs to Paul.

describe: To continue something is to keep doing it.

describe: An error is something you do wrong.
sample: → I made an error on my report, so my boss was angry.

describe: An experience is something you have seen or done.
sample: → Rock climbing was a fun experience.

describe: A field is a big area of land.
sample: → The field of flowers looked so pretty.

describe: To hurt is to do something that makes you feel pain.
sample: → She hurt her leg falling down the stairs.

describe: Judgment is the ability to form opinions or decisions.
sample: → It’s good judgment to recycle your aluminum cans.

describe: If something likely happens, it will probably happen.
sample: → I will likely stay at home and watch TV tonight.

describe: If something is normal, it is not strange nor surprising to you.
sample: → It is normal for me to bathe every night.

describe: If something is rare, you do not see it very often.

describe: To relax is to rest.
sample: → The frog relaxed in the warm sun.

describe: To request something is to ask for it.
sample: → The little girl requested a special gift from Santa Claus.

describe: To reside means to live somewhere permanently or for a long time.

describe: A result is something that happens because of something else.

describe: To roll is to move by turning over and over.

describe: Since is used to talk about a past event still happening now.

describe: If something is visible, it can be seen.

describe: If something is wild, it is found in nature.
sample: → You should be careful around a fox, because it is a wild animal.

describe: An advantage is something that helps you.

describe: To cause is to make something happen.

describe: A choice is the act or possibility of picking something.

describe: A community is a group of people who live together.
sample: → The kids from my community usually play together.

describe: To be dead is to not be alive.
sample: → A dead person is usually buried in the ground.

describe: The distance between two things is how far it is between them.
sample: → The distance between the Earth and the Moon is 384,400 kilometers.

describe: To escape is to run away from something bad.
sample: → The butterfly could not escape from the cage.

describe: If you face a problem, you deal with it.

describe: To follow means to go behind someone and go where they go.
sample: → The little boy followed his mother home.

describe: Fright is the feeling of being scared.
sample: → She was filled with fright.

describe: A ghost is the spirit of a dead person.

describe: An individual is one person.
sample: → Only one individual could win the bicycle race.

describe: A pet is an animal that lives with people.
sample: → Out of all my pets, the dog is my favorite.

describe: To reach means to arrive at a place.
sample: → I was happy to finally reach my destination.

describe: To return is to go back to a place.
sample: → I was happy to return home to my mom after school.

describe: To survive is to stay alive.
sample: → My dog survived her fall into the water.

describe: To be upset is to be unhappy about something.
sample: → She was upset because she broke her toy.

describe: A voice is the sound a person makes when they talk or sing.
sample: → He used a microphone, so everyone could hear his voice.

describe: The weather is the condition of the air: hot, rainy, windy, etc.
sample: → The weather can be sunny, rainy, or cold.

describe: To be wise is to use experience and intelligence to make good choices.
sample: → Many people believe that owls are very wise animals.

describe: To allow something to happen means to let it happen.

describe: To announce something is to make it known.
sample: → He announced to everyone his new idea for the company.

describe: When someone or something is beside you, they are next to you.
sample: → The two brothers stood beside each other.

describe: A challenge is something difficult to complete.

describe: To claim means to say that something is true.

describe: To contribute to something means to do something to make it successful.

describe: A difference is a way that something is not like other things.

describe: To divide something is to make it into smaller parts.
sample: → We divided the pizza.

describe: An expert is someone who is very good at doing something.

describe: If someone or something is famous, they are known to many people.

describe: Force is a person’s strength or power.

describe: Peace is a time without war.
sample: → A white dove is a symbol for peace.

describe: A prince is the son of a king.

describe: To protect someone is to stop them from getting hurt.

describe: To sense something is to know about it without being told.
sample: → I could sense that he was watching me.

describe: When something is sudden, it happens very quickly.
sample: → He felt a sudden pain in his chest.

describe: Therefore means for this reason.

describe: To accept something that is offered is to take it.

describe: To arrange things is to put them in the right place.

describe: To attend something is to go to it.

describe: To balance something is to keep it from falling.

describe: A contrast is the sharp difference between two things.

describe: To encourage someone is to make them want to do something.

describe: If someone or something is familiar to you, you know them well.

describe: A purpose is the reason that you do something.

describe: If something is single, then there is only one.

describe: Success is doing something well that you choose to do.

describe: To tear something means to pull it apart.

describe: A theory is an idea about how something works.

describe: To discover something is to find it for the first time.

describe: An emotion is how you feel.

describe: To fix something is to make it work.

describe: To identify something is to be able to name it.

describe: To save something is to keep it from being hurt.

describe: A taste is the flavor something makes in your mouth.

describe: The image of something is a picture of it.

describe: Trouble is a problem or a difficulty.

describe: When a person is asleep, they are not awake.

describe: A berry is a small round fruit that grows on certain plants and trees.

describe: A decision is a choice.

describe: A forest is a place with lots of trees and animals.

describe: To prepare is to get ready for something.

describe: To spend is to use time doing something or being somewhere.

describe: The truth is a fact or something that is right.

describe: To wake is to not be sleeping anymore.

describe: If someone is alone, they are not with another person.

describe: An article is a story in a newspaper or magazine.

describe: An artist is a person who paints, draws, or makes sculptures.

describe: Someone’s attitude is the way they feel and think.

describe: To compare means to say how two things are the same and different.

describe: To judge something is to say if it is good or bad.

describe: A material is what is used to make something.

describe: A method is the way to do something.

describe: A space is an empty area.

describe: A symbol is a thing that stands for something else.

describe: A cell is a small room where a person is locked in.

describe: To contain something is to have it inside.

describe: To be correct is to be right.

describe: A crop is food that a farmer grows.

describe: To demand something is to say strongly that you want it.

describe: To be equal is to be the same.

describe: To feed is to give food.

describe: A hole is an opening in something.

describe: To increase something is to make it larger or more.

describe: To owe is to have to pay or give back something received from another.

describe: A position is the way something is placed.

describe: To raise something is to lift it up.

describe: If a person is responsible, they do the right things.

describe: A sight is something interesting to see.

describe: A spot is a place where something happens.

describe: A structure is a building.

describe: Whole means all of something.

describe: A coach is a person who teaches sports.

describe: To control something is to make it do what you want.

describe: A description of someone or something says what they are like.

describe: If something is direct, it goes straight between two places.

describe: Mail is letters and other things sent to people.
sample: → I get a lot of mail because I have friends all over the world.

describe: A novel is a book that tells a story.
sample: → He wrote a great novel about ancient China.

describe: An outline is the plan for a story or essay.
sample: → Before I wrote my essay, I made an outline.

describe: A poet is a person who writes poems.
sample: → William Shakespeare was one of the greatest poets.

describe: To print something is to put it onto paper.
sample: → Make sure that you print your name clearly.

describe: A scene is one part of a book or movie.
sample: → A movie is made up of many short pieces or scenes.

describe: A sheet is a thin flat piece of paper.
sample: → I only needed a single sheet of paper to do my homework.

describe: If someone or something is silly, they show a lack of thought.
sample: → I made a silly mistake of dropping mom’s vase.

describe: A store is a place where you can buy things.
sample: → I picked up a few things at the grocery store.

describe: To suffer is to feel pain.
sample: → Her headache made her suffer all day.

describe: Technology is new things made by using science.
sample: → He loves technology such as laptop computers.

describe: To go across something is to go to the other side of it.
sample: → He walked across the board to the other side.

describe: To breathe means to let air go in and out of your body.
sample: → We need strong healthy lungs to help us breathe well.

describe: A characteristic is something that shows what a person or a thing is like.
sample: → One characteristic of tigers is their black stripes.

describe: To consume something means to eat or drink it.
sample: → Jack consumed a whole plate of spaghetti.

describe: To excite someone means to make them happy and interested.
sample: → I heard about the school dance on Friday. This excited me.

describe: If something is extreme, it is in a large amount or degree.
sample: → His workout was so extreme that he was sweating heavily.

describe: Fear is the feeling of being afraid.
sample: → I have a great fear of skateboarding.

describe: If you are fortunate, you are lucky.
sample: → I was fortunate to get a seat.

describe: If someone happens to do something, they do it by chance.
sample: → I happened to meet some new friends at school today.

describe: The length of something is how long it is from one end to the other.
sample: → The length of the floor is three meters.

describe: A mistake is something you do wrong.
sample: → My boss always yells at me when I make a mistake.

describe: To observe something is to watch it.
sample: → Brian observed the sun rising over the mountains.

describe: An opportunity is a chance to do something.
sample: → I had an opportunity to take pictures in the jungle.

describe: A prize is something of value that is given to the winner.
sample: → I won a prize for getting the best grade on my science test.

describe: A race is a contest to see who is the fastest.
sample: → Paul is a fast runner, so he easily won the race.

describe: To realize is to suddenly understand.
sample: → After I left my house, I realized that I left the light on.

describe: To respond is to give an answer to what someone else said.
sample: → When the teacher asked the question, we all responded.

describe: A risk is a chance of something bad happening.
sample: → I took a risk and climbed the snowy mountain.

describe: To wonder is to ask yourself questions or have a need to know.
sample: → The young mother wondered if she’d have a boy or a girl.

describe: Yet is used to say something has not happened up to now.
sample: → We can’t go out yet; we’re still eating.

describe: An academy is a special type of school.
sample: → There are many courses taught at the academy that I go to.

describe: If something is ancient, it is very old.
sample: → I want to see the ancient buildings in Rome.

describe: A board is a flat piece of wood.
sample: → The sign was made of a few wooden boards.

describe: A century is one hundred years.
sample: → Our company is celebrating a century of business in London.

describe: A clue is a fact or object that helps solve a mystery or crime.
sample: → The detective found some clues on the sidewalk.

describe: A concert is an event where you listen to people play music.
sample: → I enjoyed the concert last night. The band was very good.

describe: A county is the largest political division of a state in the US.
sample: → He wanted to represent the citizens of his county.

describe: A dictionary is a book that tells you what words mean.
sample: → I use the dictionary to learn new words.

describe: To exist is to be real.
sample: → Do you really think that unicorns ever existed?

describe: Flat describes something that is level and smooth with no curved parts.
sample: → My parents bought a new flat screen TV over the weekend.

describe: A gentleman is a nice man.
sample: → My grandfather is a kind and helpful gentleman.

describe: Hidden means to be not easily noticed or too hard to find.
sample: → The hidden camera recorded everything in the parking lot.

describe: Maybe is used to show that something is possible or may be true.
sample: → If I focus hard enough, maybe I can come up with the right answer.

describe: An officer is a leader in the army.
sample: → The soldiers followed the orders of the officer.

describe: If something is original, it is the first one of that thing.
sample: → This is the original painting of the Mona Lisa.

describe: To pound something is to hit it many times with a lot of force.
sample: → He pounded the nail with the hammer.

describe: A process is the steps to take to do something.
sample: → Making a cake is a long process.

describe: To publish a book is to get it printed and ready to sell.
sample: → That company publishes daily newspapers.

describe: A theater is a building where you watch plays, shows, and movies.
sample: → We went to the theater to see a play.

describe: Wealth is a large amount of money.
sample: → One of the most important things to some people is wealth.

describe: To appreciate something is to understand its good qualities.
sample: → I can appreciate the lovely scenery.

describe: If something is available, it means you can get it.
sample: → There were many seats available in the room.

describe: To beat someone means to do better than they do.
sample: → I managed to beat everyone in the race.

describe: If something is bright, it shows a lot of light.
sample: → The bright light from the explosion hurt my eyes.

describe: To celebrate is to do something to show that an event is special.
sample: → We all celebrated when we heard the great news.

describe: To determine means to choose or make a decision.
sample: → He tried to determine which one to eat first.

describe: To disappear means to go away or not be seen.
sample: → The top of the building is disappearing in the clouds.

describe: If you talk about something else, you talk about something different.
sample: → I wanted a bike for my birthday, but I got something else.

describe: Fair describes treating someone in a way that is reasonable or right.
sample: → He sold me his car for a fair price.

describe: To flow is to move easily and continuously in one direction.
sample: → The water flowed over the rocks and into the lake.

describe: If you move forward, you move in the direction in front of you.
sample: → When he saw his mother, the baby crawled forward to her.

describe: A hill is a round area of land. It is higher than the land around it.
sample: → The sun was rising above the green hills.

describe: A level is a point on a scale that measures something.
sample: → Please check the level of the temperature.

describe: If someone or something is lone, they are the only one of that kind.
sample: → A lone man walked along the street.

describe: A puddle is a pool of liquid on the ground.
sample: → When the ice melted, it formed a puddle.

describe: A response is the answer to a question.
sample: → He asked if I was sad. My response was “No.”

describe: A season is a time of the year: spring, summer, fall or winter.
sample: → Fall is a warm season, while winter is very cold.

describe: A solution is a way to solve a problem.
sample: → There are many problems. We need solutions!

describe: To waste means to carelessly use something all up.
sample: → Turn off the water so you don’t waste it.

describe: You use whether when you must choose between two things.
sample: → I could not decide whether to go left or right.

describe: To argue is to angrily speak to someone because you do not agree.
sample: → We argued about where to go for dinner.

describe: To communicate is to give information by talking, writing, etc.
sample: → I communicated with Paul about his new ideas.

describe: A crowd is a large group of people.
sample: → A large crowd had gathered on the street to see the accident.

describe: To depend on someone or something is to need them.
sample: → Children depend on their parents for many things.

describe: A dish is a plate.
sample: → She put a clean white dish on the table.

describe: If something is empty, it does not have anything in it.
sample: → My gas tank was almost empty, so I couldn’t drive my car very long.

describe: If something is exact, it is just the right amount.
sample: → Please use the exact amount of sugar for the cake.

describe: If something is fresh, it is new.
sample: → I just bought these oranges. They are very fresh.

describe: To gather is to collect several things usually from different places.
sample: → Sam gathered some flowers for his mother.

describe: To indicate means to show, point or make something clear.
sample: → He pointed to his eyes to indicate where he had hurt himself.

describe: An item is a thing that you buy or sell.
sample: → I have many items for school in my bag.

describe: To offer is to present someone with something.
sample: → He offered me the keys to his car.

describe: The price of something is how much it costs.
sample: → What is the price of this item?

describe: A product is something that is made.
sample: → My sister has many beauty products in her room.

describe: Property is something that someone owns.
sample: → The house is now my property.

describe: To purchase something is to buy it.
sample: → I recently purchased a new car.

describe: To recommend something is to say that someone should do it.
sample: → My doctor recommended that I get some exercise.

describe: To select something is to choose it.
sample: → I hope that I selected the right answers on the test.

describe: A tool is something that helps you do a task.
sample: → We used a tool to fix the window.

describe: To treat is to act in a certain way toward someone.
sample: → The cats treated the mouse very nicely.

describe: If someone or something is alive, they are not dead.
sample: → My grandparents are still alive even though they are over 90.

describe: A bone is a hard part of the body.
sample: → I brought home a nice bone for my dog.

describe: To bother is to make the effort to do something.
sample: → No one bothered to wash the dishes today.

describe: A captain is the person who leads a ship or airplane.
sample: → The captain sailed his ship to Australia.

describe: The conclusion of something is the final part of it.
sample: → At the conclusion of the race, the spectators cheered for the winner.

describe: Doubt is a feeling of not being sure.
sample: → I have doubt that the story is true.

describe: To explore is to look for new places.
sample: → He wants to explore the world and see new things.

describe: If something is foreign, it is from a different country.
sample: → Mexican food is a popular foreign food.

describe: If you are glad, you are happy.
sample: → I am glad you came to my party.

describe: However means despite or not being influenced by something.
sample: → She is a great cook. However, she never had professional lessons.

describe: Injustice is a lack of fairness or justice.
sample: → Putting an innocent person in jail is an act of injustice.

describe: If something is international, it involves more than one country.
sample: → The United Nations is a powerful international organization.

describe: A lawyer works with the law and represents people in court.
sample: → The lawyer left the courthouse after the judge made her decision.

describe: To mention something is to talk about it.
sample: → The doctors mentioned the problems that the patient was having.

describe: A policy is a rule.
sample: → He told us that his policy was to put customers first.

describe: If something is social, it is about many people in a community.
sample: → People should come together and fix the world’s social problems.

describe: A speech is something said to a group of people.
sample: → She gave a speech to the class.

describe: A staff is a group of people working together in a company.
sample: → My dad has a staff of four people to help him at the office.

describe: If you go toward something, you go closer to it.
sample: → Santa walked toward my house with a special tree.

describe: Wood is the thing that trees are made of.
sample: → I put the pieces of wood in a pile.

describe: To achieve something is to successfully do it after trying hard.
sample: → I was happy that I could achieve my goal.

describe: To advise someone is to tell them what to do.
sample: → My mother often advises people about their money.

describe: If something happens already, it happens before a certain time.
sample: → It is already time for the movie to start. Let’s go in.

describe: If something is basic, it is very simple or easy.
sample: → I learned some basic English skills in school today.

describe: A bit is a small amount of something.
sample: → I ate a bit of chocolate before I went to bed.

describe: To consider something means to think about it.
sample: → Pete didn’t like his job. He considered getting a new one.

describe: To destroy means to damage something so badly that it cannot be used.
sample: → The glass was destroyed.

describe: To entertain someone is to do something that they enjoy.
sample: → The clown entertained the kids at the party.

describe: If something is extra, it is more than what is needed.
sample: → The squirrel had extra nuts for the winter.

describe: A goal is something you work toward.
sample: → Her goal was to become a doctor.

describe: To lie is to say or write something untrue to deceive someone.
sample: → Whenever Pinocchio lied to his father, his nose grew.

describe: Meat is food made of animals.
sample: → This piece of meat I’m eating tastes very good.

describe: An opinion is a thought about a person or a thing.
sample: → Meg told me her opinion of my story. She said it was not funny.

describe: If something is real, it actually exists.
sample: → The handbag has a stamp on it, so it’s real.

describe: To reflect is when a surface sends back light, heat, sound or an image.
sample: → Her face was reflected on the smooth glass.

describe: To regard someone or something is to think of them in a certain way.
sample: → The boy regarded the girl as a good friend.

describe: To serve someone is to give them food or drinks.
sample: → He served us our drinks quickly.

describe: A vegetable is a plant used as food.
sample: → Carrots are my favorite vegetable.

describe: A war is a big fight between two groups of people.
sample: → Many young men died in the war.

describe: If something is worth an amount of money, it costs that amount.
sample: → Our house is worth a lot of money.

describe: To appear is to seem.
sample: → She appeared to be sad. She was crying.

describe: The base is the bottom of something.
sample: → The base of the table has three legs.

describe: The brain is the organ in your head that lets you think.
sample: → You must use your brain to solve the problem.

describe: A career is a job that you do for a large part of your life.
sample: → He was in the hospitality business for most of his career.

describe: A clerk is a type of worker. Clerks in a store help customers.
sample: → The clerk added up her bill for the groceries.

describe: Effort is hard work or an attempt to do something.
sample: → He always puts a lot of effort into his studies.

describe: To enter a place is to go into it.
sample: → Two guards greeted me as I entered the front door.

describe: When something is excellent, it is very good.
sample: → I got an excellent score on my school test.

describe: A hero is a brave person who does things to help others.
sample: → To children, the man in the blue and red costume was a real hero.

describe: To hurry is to do something quickly.
sample: → I hurried home on my bike.

describe: To inform someone is to tell them about something.
sample: → I called and informed her about my idea.

describe: Later means after the present, expected, or usual time.
sample: → She missed the train, so she’ll arrive a little later than expected.

describe: To leave means to go away from someone or something.
sample: → He packed his bag and was ready to leave for home.

describe: To locate something is to find it.
sample: → I could not locate my keys in the house.

describe: A nurse is a person who helps sick people in the hospital.
sample: → A nurse helped me get better.

describe: An operation is when a doctor replaces or removes something in the body.
sample: → The operation on my arm was a success.

describe: Pain is the feeling that you have when you are hurt.
sample: → His head was full of pain.

describe: To refuse something is to say “no” to it.
sample: → The dog refused to play with the cat.

describe: Though is used when the second idea makes the first seem surprising.
sample: → Though he was overweight, he liked to be active.

describe: If something is various, there are many types of it.
sample: → She owned shoes of various styles.

describe: Actual means that something is real or true.
sample: → This is the actual sword that the King owned, not a fake one.

describe: To amaze someone is to surprise them very much.
sample: → The news in the paper amazed Jack.

describe: A charge is the price to pay for something.
sample: → The charge for the shirts was $15.00.

describe: To comfort someone means to make them feel better.
sample: → I wanted to comfort my friend after I heard the bad news.

describe: To contact someone is to speak or write to them.
sample: → I contacted Sue about my party.

describe: A customer is a person who buys something at a store.
sample: → The customer put a few items in a bag.

describe: To deliver something is to take it from one place to another.
sample: → The man delivered Chinese food to my house.

describe: To earn means to get money for the work you do.
sample: → He earns his living as a chef in a great restaurant.

describe: A gate is a type of door. Gates are usually made of metal or wood.
sample: → We want to put up a wooden gate around our house.

describe: To include something means to have it as part of a group.
sample: → Does this meal include a soft drink?

describe: To manage something means to control or be in charge of it.
sample: → I had to manage the meeting myself.

describe: A mystery is something that is difficult to understand or explain.
sample: → The path on the map was a complete mystery to me.

describe: To occur means to happen.
sample: → When did the thunderstorm occur?

describe: If A is the opposite of B, A is completely different from B.
sample: → The opposite of black is white.

describe: A plate is a flat round thing that you put food on.
sample: → I put my plate down so I could put some food on it.

describe: To receive something is to get it.
sample: → I received a present on my birthday.

describe: A reward is something given in exchange for good behavior or work.
sample: → He was given a reward for his excellent performance.

describe: To set something is to put it somewhere.
sample: → Please set the dice down on the table.

describe: To steal is to take something that is not yours.
sample: → The men tried to steal money from the bank.

describe: A thief is someone who quietly takes things that do not belong to them.
sample: → A thief broke into our home and took my mother's jewelry.

describe: To advance is to go forward.
sample: → He advanced up the ladder slowly.

describe: An athlete is a person who plays sports.
sample: → Some athletes can play many sports very well.

describe: If something is average, it is at a normal level.
sample: → I’m not rich or poor; I’m average.

describe: Your behavior is the way you act.
sample: → Their behavior was good this semester. They didn’t cause trouble.

describe: Behind means to be at the back of something.
sample: → The little girl was hiding behind a tree.

describe: A course is a class in school.
sample: → I took a P.E. course in school this year.

describe: To lower something is to make it go down.
sample: → The chart shows how his production has lowered over the year.

describe: To match is to be the same or similar.
sample: → The two shoes matched. They looked the same.

describe: A member is a person who is part of a group.
sample: → Julie is the newest member of our team.

describe: If something is mental, it has to do with your mind.
sample: → I made a mental picture of the room.

describe: A passenger is a person who rides in a car, train, or airplane.
sample: → One passenger was standing in the subway train.

describe: Your personality is what you are like and how you behave.
sample: → John has a bad personality.

describe: A poem is a short kind of writing.
sample: → William Shakespeare wrote many poems.

describe: A pole is a long thin stick made of wood or metal that supports things.
sample: → The flag was hanging from the flag pole.

describe: To remove something is to take it away.
sample: → I removed the nail from the board.

describe: Safety means to be the condition of being safe and free from danger.
sample: → For his own safety, he was placed in a car seat.

describe: To shoot is to fire something like a bullet at someone or something.
sample: → The hunter raised his gun to shoot at the target.

describe: To sound means to make a noise.
sample: → The alarm clock sounded and woke us all up.

describe: To swim is to move through water.
sample: → I love to swim in the ocean.

describe: A web is a home made by a spider.
sample: → Mom cleaned the spider webs out of the garage.

describe: A block is a solid piece of wood, stone or ice.
sample: → I saw a block of ice on the floor.

describe: To cheer is to give a loud shout of approval or encouragement.
sample: → The crowd all cheered when the home team won.

describe: If something is complex, it has many small parts. It is hard to understand.
sample: → A jig-saw puzzle can be complex because it has so many pieces.

describe: A critic is someone who give their opinions about movies, books, plays.
sample: → The wine critic tasted the wine so he could give his opinion.

describe: An event is something that happens, especially something important.
sample: → Finishing high school was a major event in his life.

describe: To exercise is to run or play sports so that you can be healthy.
sample: → You should exercise every day.

describe: If something fits, it is small enough or the right size to go there.
sample: → The colorful eggs fit into the box.

describe: Friendship is the relationship between people who are friends.
sample: → Michael and Lisa have a very strong friendship with each other.

describe: A guide is someone who shows you where to go.
sample: → We followed a guide at the park.

describe: If there is a lack of something, there is not enough of it.
sample: → His only problem is a lack of money.

describe: A passage is a long area with walls that goes from one place to another.
sample: → The long passage led us to the other side of the field.

describe: To perform is to do something in front of people who watch.
sample: → He will perform a song for the class.

describe: Pressure is what you apply to make someone do something.
sample: → They put pressure on him to change his mind.

describe: If something is probable, it is likely to happen.
sample: → It is probable that you will get a good grade if you study for the test.

describe: If something is public, it is meant for everyone to use.
sample: → I went to the public park to play with my friends.

describe: To strike someone or something is to hit them.
sample: → She struck the other girl in the face.

describe: To support something is to like it and help it be successful.
sample: → Everyone at work supports the new plan.

describe: A task is work that someone has to do.
sample: → Who has the task of building the brick wall?

describe: A term is a word for something.
sample: → I often use the term “oops” when I make a mistake.

describe: To unite is to get together to do something.
sample: → If we unite, we can finish our project faster.

describe: To associate means to connect something with a person or thing.
sample: → Most people associate birthday parties with having fun.

describe: The environment is the place where people work or live.
sample: → Keeping our environment clean is important to our health.

describe: A factory is a building where things are made or put together.
sample: → We have only one factory in our town.

describe: A feature is an important part of something.
sample: → The cell phone has many features.

describe: An instance is an example of something.
sample: → I have never experienced an instance of hate. Have you?

describe: To involve means to be actively taking part in something.
sample: → The whole family was involved in playing the game.

describe: Medicine is something you take to feel better or treat an illness.
sample: → The doctor gave me medicine for my cold.

describe: A mix is different things put together.
sample: → The green mix we made in science class spilled onto the table.

describe: To organize is to plan or get ready for an event.
sample: → Make a list to help you organize the things you need.

describe: A period is an amount of time when something happens.
sample: → In one period in Europe, there were many knights.

describe: If people populate an area, they live there.
sample: → Billions of people populate the Earth.

describe: To produce something is to make or grow it.
sample: → This tree produces apples every year.

describe: A range is a number or a set of similar things.
sample: → I saw a range of cars to choose from.

describe: To recognize something is to know it because you have seen it before.
sample: → I recognized an old friend from many years ago.

describe: If something is regular, it happens often and in equal amounts of time.
sample: → Our regular lunch time is around noon.

describe: A sign is a notice giving information, directions, a warning, etc.
sample: → The sign indicated that today would be a bad day.

describe: A tip is a pointed end of something.
sample: → The tip of his pen was very sharp.

describe: A tradition is something people have been doing for a long time.
sample: → Marriage is a tradition all over the world.

describe: Trash is waste material or unwanted or worthless things.
sample: → Please take out the trash; it smells bad.

describe: If something is wide, it is large from side to side.
sample: → The door was as wide as my arms.

describe: Advice is an opinion about what to do.
sample: → I don’t know how to study for my exams. Can you give me some advice?

describe: Along means to move from one part of a road, river, etc. to another.
sample: → Walk along this tunnel for ten minutes, and you’ll see a door on the left.

describe: Attention is the notice, thought, or consideration of someone.
sample: → His work got the attention of two of his co-workers.

describe: To attract means to make a person or thing come closer or be interested.
sample: → The magnet attracted the metal.

describe: To climb means to use your hands and feet to go up on something.
sample: → The girls climbed to the top of the mountain.

describe: To drop is to fall or allow something to fall.
sample: → A small amount of water dropped from the bottle.

describe: If something is final, it is the last part.
sample: → In the final part of the film, the man and the woman got married.

describe: Further is used to say something is from a distance or time.
sample: → The escalator is further along than I thought.

describe: To imply something is to suggest it without saying it.
sample: → The man implied that he wanted the job, but he didn’t say so.

describe: To maintain means to make something stay the same.
sample: → The balls maintain constant movement.

describe: You use neither to connect two negative statements.
sample: → Neither the pass on the left nor the pass on the right will lead us home.

describe: Otherwise means different or in another way.
sample: → It’s good to stay active; otherwise, you’ll gain weight.

describe: If something is physical, it is related to your body and not your mind.
sample: → Biking is good for your physical health.

describe: To prove something is to show that it is true.
sample: → My teacher proved the answer on the board.

describe: To react is to act in a certain way because of something that happened.
sample: → James reacted badly to the news.

describe: To ride something is to travel on it. You can ride an animal, a bike, etc.
sample: → I will ride a roller-coaster for the first time today.

describe: If something is situated somewhere, it is in that place.
sample: → The white board is situated between the two men.

describe: Society is people and the way that they live.
sample: → Society expects people to be good and honest.

describe: A standard is what people consider normal or good.
sample: → This older model TV is below our store’s standards.

describe: To suggest something means to give an idea or plan about it.
sample: → He suggested that we go to see his boss.

describe: Actually means in fact or really.
sample: → My dad looks a little mean, but actually he’s very kind.

describe: Bite is the act of using your teeth to cut and tear into something.
sample: → The boy took a big bite out of his hamburger.

describe: The coast is the land by an ocean.
sample: → I stayed on the southern coast of Australia.

describe: A deal is an agreement that you have with another person.
sample: → I made a deal with the other company to give us some money.

describe: The desert is an area of land without many plants or water.
sample: → Not many plants grow in the desert.

describe: An earthquake is a shaking movement of the ground.
sample: → The building shook during the earthquake.

describe: If something is effective, it works well.
sample: → Swimming is an effective way to stay healthy.

describe: To examine something is to look at it carefully.
sample: → The doctor examined my eyes today.

describe: If something is false, it is not correct.
sample: → If you think the answer is false, press the red button.

describe: A gift is something you give someone.
sample: → Dave received many gifts for Christmas.

describe: Hunger is the feeling that you get when you need to eat.
sample: → After playing all day long, he was filled with hunger.

describe: To imagine something is to think of it in your mind.
sample: → Sally imagined herself winning lots of money.

describe: A journey is a long trip.
sample: → I went on a journey across the country with my parents.

describe: A puzzle is something that is hard to understand.
sample: → The question was a puzzle to him.

describe: Quite is used to say that something is complete or very much.
sample: → I think typing on a keyboard is quite easy.

describe: Rather is used when you want to do one thing but not the other.
sample: → I would rather have the red one than the blue one.

describe: If something is specific, it is precise or exact.
sample: → Please choose a specific place on the map.

describe: A tour is a short trip in which you see many sights.
sample: → I took a tour of Asia and Europe.

describe: A trip is a journey to a certain place.
sample: → Ken took a trip to the city yesterday.

describe: If something has value, it is worth a lot of money.
sample: → Matthew found a treasure of very high value.

describe: A band is a group of people who play music.
sample: → My brother is in a rock band.

describe: Barely means by the smallest amount, almost not.
sample: → I barely had enough money to pay for my bus ticket.

describe: If something is boring, it is not fun.
sample: → I think the Internet is boring.

describe: To cancel means to decide that an event or a request will not happen.
sample: → She cancelled the rest of her plans because of the rain.

describe: A driveway is a short private road that leads to a person’s home.
sample: → The long driveway led us to their new house.

describe: Garbage is waste material like unwanted or spoiled food, bottles, paper, etc.
sample: → The boy cleaned up the garbage around his house.

describe: An instrument is something designed to do a certain task like music.
sample: → My favorite musical instrument is the piano.

describe: A list is a record of information printed with an item on each line.
sample: → My mom makes a list of groceries to buy.

describe: Magic is the power to do impossible things.
sample: → The magician used magic to pull a rabbit out of his hat.

describe: A message is a set of words that you send to someone.
sample: → I left a message for you in the envelope.

describe: To notice something is to see it for the first time.
sample: → Did you notice the view?

describe: To own something means to have it. That thing belongs to you.
sample: → My grandfather owns that house.

describe: To predict something is to say that it will happen.
sample: → She predicted that I would get married next year.

describe: A professor is a person who teaches in college.
sample: → Mike’s science professor knows a lot about physics.

describe: To rush is to go somewhere or do something very quickly.
sample: → Nancy rushed to finish her homework.

describe: A schedule is a plan that tells you when to do things.
sample: → What is your class schedule for today?

describe: To share something is to give some of it to another person.
sample: → Jimmy shared his apple with me.

describe: A stage is a place where actors or musicians act or sing.
sample: → A large screen was on the stage.

describe: A storm is very bad weather. There is a lot of rain or snow.
sample: → Did that storm wake you up last night?

describe: You use within to say that something is inside another thing.
sample: → Within the box, there was a pizza.

describe: To advertise is to tell people about something on TV, radio, etc.
sample: → They used a rabbit to help them advertise their product.

describe: To assign something to someone is to tell them to do it.
sample: → I assigned the worker an important task.

describe: An audience is a group of people who watch something together.
sample: → There was a large audience at the game.

describe: Breakfast is the first meal of the day.
sample: → I eat breakfast at 8:00 every morning.

describe: A competition is a contest to see who is the best at something.
sample: → He won the running competition over the weekend.

describe: If the weather is cool, it is a little bit cold.
sample: → The weather is cool in the fall.

describe: If you gain something, you get more of it.
sample: → I gained some weight over the summer.

describe: Importance means the quality or condition of being needed or valued.
sample: → VIPs are people of great importance.

describe: Knowledge is information that you have about something.
sample: → A music teacher should have good knowledge of music.

describe: If something is major, it is big or important.
sample: → I have a major problem. My boss wants me to redo my project!

describe: Mean describes someone who is unkind or cruel.
sample: → My co-worker is a very mean person. He gets angry very quickly.

describe: If you prefer something, you want it more than something else.
sample: → I prefer to take the path that will lead me to a bright future.

describe: A president is the leader of a country.
sample: → The president of our country made an important announcement.

describe: Progress is the act of getting closer to doing or finishing something.
sample: → Our company made financial progress this year.

describe: Respect is a good opinion of someone because they are good.
sample: → I have great respect for firemen.

describe: Ifyou are rich, you have a lot of money.
sample: → He’s rich. He can buy anything he wants.

describe: A skill is the knowledge and ability that allows you to do something well.
sample: → A snowboarder must have the right skills to do well.

describe: Somehow means in a way or by some means which is not known.
sample: → He somehow had to find a way to reach the life preserver.

describe: Strength is the physical power that you have.
sample: → Exercising will increase your strength and give you more power.

describe: To vote is to officially choose between two or more things.
sample: → I voted for Billy to be our class president.

describe: If something is above, it is at a higher level than something else.
sample: → He straightened the sign that was above the crowd.

describe: If something is ahead of something else, it is in front of it.
sample: → The blue car drove on ahead of us.

describe: An amount is how much there is of something.
sample: → Can I use my card to pay for the entire amount?

describe: A belief is a strong feeling that something is correct or true.
sample: → A preacher or priest should have a strong belief in God.

describe: The center of something is the middle of it.
sample: → The center of a dart board is the most important spot.

describe: If something is common, it happens often or there is much of it.
sample: → It is common for snow to fall in the winter.

describe: To cost is to require expenditure or payment.
sample: → These designer shoes cost more than the regular ones.

describe: To demonstrate something is to show how it is done.
sample: → She demonstrated her plan to her co-workers.

describe: Different describes someone or something that is not the same as others.
sample: → Each of my sisters has a different hair style from one another.

describe: Evidence is a fact or thing that you use to prove something.
sample: → He used the pictures as evidence that UFOs are real.

describe: Honesty means the quality of being truthful or honest.
sample: → A courtroom should be a place of honesty.

describe: An idiom is a phrase with a meaning different from its words.
sample: → The idiom “when pigs fly” means that something will never happen.

describe: If something is independent, it is not controlled by something else.
sample: → She chose to live an independent life in the country.

describe: Inside means the inner part, space or side of something.
sample: → The inside of the box was empty.

describe: A master is a person who is very good at something.
sample: → My brother is a master of taekwondo.

describe: A memory is something you remember.
sample: → The memory of my first time in the city will always be the best.

describe: If something is proper, it is right.
sample: → It is not proper to throw your garbage on the road.

describe: To scan something is to look at it very carefully.
sample: → You must scan each person closely.

describe: A section is a part of something larger.
sample: → The green section of the graph is the most important part.

describe: The surface of something is the top part or outside of it.
sample: → The surface of the moon is very rough.

describe: When a person is anxious, they worry that something bad will happen.
sample: → She was anxious about not making her appointment on time.

describe: When something is awful, it is very bad.
sample: → Her performance last night was awful.

describe: To consist of is to be made of parts or things.
sample: → Today’s choices for lunch consisted of pizza, hamburgers, and hot dogs.

describe: To desire is to want something.
sample: → My sister desires a big house and lots of money.

describe: When a person is eager about something, they are excited about it.
sample: → The man was eager to talk about the good news.

describe: A household is all the people who live in one house.
sample: → Our household is made up of my father, my mother and me.

describe: An intent is a plan to do something.
sample: → Her intent is to visit Italy next summer.

describe: A landscape is how an area of land looks.
sample: → The landscape of the country is very green.

describe: To lift something is to move it higher.
sample: → The man tried to lift the box.

describe: To load is to put objects into something.
sample: → The man loaded the boxes into a truck.

describe: A lung is the organ in the body that fills with air when breathing.
sample: → Having strong lungs is necessary for a healthy life.

describe: A motion is a movement that someone makes.
sample: → The police officer made a motion with his hand.

describe: The pace of something is the speed at which it happens.
sample: → I ran the race at a slower pace than my friend.

describe: When someone is polite, they are acting in a thoughtful way.
sample: → The boy was very polite: he behaved very thoughtfully.

describe: To possess something is to have it or own it.
sample: → My uncle possesses three sheep, a chicken, a cow and a dog.

describe: When something happens rapidly, it happens very fast.
sample: → The train moved rapidly on the tracks.

describe: To remark is to say something.
sample: → The teacher remarked on how quickly the students were learning.

describe: To seek is to look for something.
sample: → If I have a problem, I seek my sister’s advice.

describe: To shine is to make a bright light.
sample: → The candles are shining in the dark room.

describe: To spill is to have something fall out of its container.
sample: → I spilled the coffee on the table.

describe: To bring means to take someone or something to a person or place.
sample: → Oscar will bring in all the boxes.

describe: A castle is a building with strong walls where royalty usually lives.
sample: → The castle was built many years ago.

describe: To command someone is to tell them to do something.
sample: → The general commanded his army to attack.

describe: To counsel someone is to listen and give advice about a problem.
sample: → The teacher counseled the girl about her troubles.

describe: To ensure is to make certain that something happens.
sample: → Eating good food ensures that we stay healthy.

describe: An explosion is a violent burst, usually with a loud sound.
sample: → A nuclear explosion can cause great damage.

describe: Jewelry is something that people wear like earrings or necklaces.
sample: → The woman looked beautiful with her nice dress and jewelry.

describe: To land means to come to the ground usually from a ship or aircraft.
sample: → The parachutist landed safely on the ground.

describe: A meteor is a rock from outer space that falls to Earth.
sample: → We saw a meteor in the sky last night.

describe: A monster is any imaginary frightening creature that looks strange.
sample: → The monster scared everyone in the village.

describe: If something is northern, it is in the direction of north.
sample: → It is much colder in northern countries than it is here.

describe: If something is remote, it is very far away and difficult to get to.
sample: → It took many days to get to the remote island.

describe: If something is southern, it is in the direction of south.
sample: → Taegu is located in the southern part of the Korean peninsula.

describe: A statue is an image of a person or animal made of stone or metal.
sample: → I saw a beautiful statue of a lion today.

describe: Steam is water that has become hot and has turned into a misty gas.
sample: → We could see the steam rise from the boiling water.

describe: To submit to someone is to agree to do what they tell you to do.
sample: → She submitted to her mother’s wishes and did her homework.

describe: A temple is a building that is used for religious purposes.
sample: → The people visited the temple to pray.

describe: Upper means higher in position or place.
sample: → A home’s attic is at the upper part of the structure.

describe: A weed is a plant, especially one that is not useful or wanted.
sample: → The yard of the house was full of ugly weeds.

describe: A wing is the part of an animal that lets it fly.
sample: → The bird used its wings to fly across the water.

describe: An arrow is a thin, straight stick shot from a bow.
sample: → The arrow flew through the air and hit the target.

describe: A battle is a fight between two armies during a war.
sample: → The battle lasted for many days.

describe: A bow is a weapon made of curved wood and string that shoots arrows.
sample: → He went hunting with a bow and arrow.

describe: When people are brave, they are not afraid to face pain or danger.
sample: → The brave firefighter saved the girl from the burning building.

describe: A chief is the leader of a group of people.
sample: → The chief led the people through the mountains.

describe: A disadvantage is a situation where someone is likely to lose.
sample: → Mike had a disadvantage in the race since he hurt his knee.

describe: An enemy is a country that is fighting another country during a war.
sample: → The enemy prepared to attack the kingdom.

describe: An entrance is a place where someone can enter an area.
sample: → The gate was locked, so Bill had to find a different entrance.

describe: If something hardly happens, it almost does not happen at all.
sample: → I hardly saw the concert since I had to leave early.

describe: To intend to do something means to plan to do it.
sample: → I intend to finish college in three years.

describe: Laughter is the sound produced by laughing about something funny.
sample: → Susan’s joke made her classmates burst into laughter.

describe: A log is a thick piece of wood that is cut from a tree.
sample: → The fire was too small, so we added another log to it.

describe: The military is the armed forces of a country.
sample: →  I joined the military after I finished high school.

describe: To obey means to follow what a law or a person says you must do.
sample: → My little sister did not obey my mother. Now she is in trouble.

describe: To secure something means to get it after a lot of effort.
sample: →  I was able to secure a good grade on my test after weeks of studying.

describe: When someone or something is steady, they are under control.
sample: → The problem was hard but she remained steady and solved it.

describe: To trust is to believe that someone is honest and will do what is right.
sample: → I trust my friends; they don’t tell my secrets to other people.

describe: To twist something is to wrap it around itself or another thing.
sample: → She twisted the spaghetti around her fork.

describe: Unless means if not or except when.
sample: → Unless you clean your room, you cannot play with your friends.

describe: A weapon is an object that can be used to hurt people.
sample: → Swords have been used as weapons for thousands of years.

describe: The chest is the front part of a person’s body under the neck.
sample: → The water in the lake was as high as my chest.

describe: If you have confidence about something, you are sure of it.
sample: → I have confidence that I did well on the test.

describe: A consequence is a result of a choice or action.
sample: → Asa consequence of missing my bus, I had to find another way to work.

describe: A disaster is a really bad thing that happens.
sample: → When the car crashed, it was a disaster.

describe: To disturb someone means to upset them.
sample: → The loud noise disturbed me while I was working.

describe: To estimate something means to make a guess about it.
sample: → The boy estimated that he was one meter tall.

describe: When you honor people or things, you show respect for them.
sample: → I honor my science teacher by working hard in class.

describe: To impress someone means to make that person proud.
sample: → He was able to impress the girls with his new dance.

describe: A marathon is a very long foot race just over 42 kilometers.
sample: → I ran a marathon, and now my legs are tired.

describe: When something is narrow, it is very thin.
sample: → The bridge is too narrow for a car to drive over.

describe: When something is pale, it does not have a bright color.
sample: → The girl’s skin was very pale.

describe: When something is rough, it is not even or smooth.
sample: → The rough ground hurt my feet.

describe: To satisfy someone means to make them happy.
sample: → It will satisfy my teacher if I finish all my homework.

describe: To scream means to make a loud noise with your mouth.
sample: → The girl saw a spider and screamed.

describe: When someone or something is sensitive, they are easily hurt.
sample: → My teeth are sensitive to cold things.

describe: The shade is a dark area that something makes when it blocks the sun.
sample: → It was hot outside, so the boy sat in the shade of a tree.

describe: To supplement something is to add something else to it in a good way.
sample: → He supplements his diet with fresh fruits.

describe: When someone feels terror, they are scared.
sample: → I felt a sense of terror when the tiger chased me.

describe: A threat is something bad that might happen.
sample: → Due to the dark clouds, there was a threat of a bad storm.

describe: A victim is a person that had something bad happen to them.
sample: → I was a victim of a robbery.

describe: An ancestor is a family member from the past.
sample: → My ancestors came from Germany.

describe: An angle is the direction from which you look at something.
sample: → The giraffe turned its head to see from another angle.

describe: A boot is a heavy shoe that goes over your ankle.
sample: → He wore boots so that his feet wouldn’t get wet.

describe: A border is the edge of an area.
sample: → The postcard had a pretty green border of pine needles.

describe: To congratulate someone is to tell them that you are happy for them.
sample: → Bill and Angela congratulated each other on a job well done.

describe: A frame is a border for a picture or mirror.
sample: → I have to get a frame for my friend’s picture.

describe: Heaven is the place that some people believe people go when they die.
sample: → When I die, I hope that I go to heaven.

describe: If someone or something is incredible, it is hard to believe they are true.
sample: → I have an incredible story to tell you about my vacation.

describe: A legend is a story from the past.
sample: → There is a well-known legend about a king and his queen.

describe: To praise is to show that you like someone or something.
sample: → The coach praised both athletes after a good practice.

describe: To proceed is to go in a certain direction.
sample: → My son and I proceeded to the beach so we could go fishing.

describe: If something is pure, it is very clear and beautiful.
sample: → The rose was pure. It had no dirt or imperfections.

describe: A relative is a family member.
sample: → My relatives came by to see the new baby.

describe: If one is senior, they are the oldest or have been there the longest.
sample: → Because he got his job first, Bob is the senior chef.

describe: If someone or something is silent, they make no sound.
sample: → Since no one was home, the house was silent.

describe: To sink into something is to slowly fall into it.
sample: → The boat had a hole in it, and it sank into the ocean.

describe: If someone or something is superior, they are better than another.
sample: → I think cooking outdoors is superior to cooking indoors.

describe: To surround something is to close in on it from all sides.
sample: → We surrounded the suspect on all four sides.

describe: If something is thick, it is wide and solid.
sample: → The fog was so thick that I couldn’t see through it.

describe: To wrap is to cover something on all sides.
sample: → I wrapped his gift and put a bow on it.

describe: If someone goes or travels abroad, they go to another country.
sample: → My brother wants to go abroad next year.

describe: To anger someone is to make them mad.
sample: → It angers me when people are rude.

describe: A bride is a woman who is getting married or has just gotten married.
sample: → The bride looked beautiful in her wedding dress.

describe: If something is brief, it only lasts fora short time.
sample: → The meeting this afternoon was very brief.

describe: To chase someone or something is to follow them in order to catch them.
sample: → I was chased by an angry native.

describe: To disappoint is to make one feel sad or unsatisfied.
sample: → I do not want to disappoint my family, so I try to do well at school.

describe: To dive is to jump into water.
sample: → I will dive into the lake once we get there.

describe: To exchange means to give something for another thing in return.
sample: → I exchanged my foreign money for American dollars.

describe: A favor is something you do for someone to help them.
sample: → Can you do me a favor and turn off the lights?

describe: A fee is an amount of money that a person or company asks for a service.
sample: → I had to pay an hourly fee to speak with my lawyer.

describe: If something lasts forever, it means it lasts for all time.
sample: → The young couple promised that they would love each other forever.

describe: A guy is an informal way to call a man.
sample: → The guy at the flower shop was really helpful today.

describe: If people or things are lovely, they are good-looking or beautiful.
sample: → The trees look lovely in the fall.

describe: A mood is the way someone is feeling.
sample: → I am in a good mood because I did well on my math test.

describe: A palace is a very large building. It is often the home of a royal family.
sample: → The king and queen live in a beautiful palace.

describe: To permit something is to let someone do it.
sample: → I was sick, so my mother permitted me to stay home from school.

describe: To protest something is to argue about it with someone.
sample: → The people protested the decision of the president.

describe: A sculpture is a piece of art that is made from wood, clay, or stone.
sample: → We saw an old sculpture of Buddha at the museum.

describe: A tribe is a group of people who live in the same culture.
sample: → There’s a small tribe of people who live in the mountains of Spain.

describe: Youth is a time in people’s lives when they are young.
sample: → My mother wanted to be a nurse in her youth.

describe: To do something on time’s basis is how often you do it.
sample: → My grandfather gets his hearing checked on a yearly basis.

describe: Biology is the study of living things.
sample: → We learned about the human heart in biology class.

describe: A cage is something that holds an animal so it cannot leave.
sample: → We put the parrots in their cage at night.

describe: A colleague is somebody you work with.
sample: → My colleague helped me finish the job.

describe: A colony is a country controlled by another country.
sample: → The USA was at one time a colony of Great Britain.

describe: To debate is to seriously discuss something with someone.
sample: → The husband and wife debated over which TV to buy.

describe: To depart is to leave some place so you can go to another place.
sample: → The plane departed for Italy at 3:00 this afternoon.

describe: To depress someone is to make them sad.
sample: → The bad news from work depressed the man.

describe: When something is factual, it is true.
sample: → John learns about history from factual books.

describe: To fascinate someone is to make them really like something.
sample: → The kitten was fascinated by the ball of yarn.

describe: A mission is an important job that is sometimes far away.
sample: → The woman’s mission was to help sick people.

describe: You use nevertheless to show that something goes against a fact.
sample: → He is usually friendly. Nevertheless, he wasn’t this afternoon.

describe: An occupation is a person’s job.
sample: → My father’s occupation is a dentist.

describe: If you go overseas, you go to a country on the other side of an ocean.
sample: → John often goes overseas for vacations.

describe: To persuade someone is to make them agree to do something.
sample: → The children persuaded their parents to buy them gifts.

describe: A route is the way you go from one place to another.
sample: → I saw many new houses along the route to the city.

describe: Ruins are old buildings that are not used anymore.
sample: → I visited some interesting ruins in Greece.

describe: A scholar is a person who studies something and knows much about it.
sample: → The scholar knew much about art history.

describe: When someone or something is significant, they are important.
sample: → I read many significant novels as a literature major in university.

describe: A volcano is a mountain with a hole on top where hot liquid comes out.
sample: → When the volcano erupted, smoke and heat filled the air.

describe: If something is broad, it is wide.
sample: → The river is very long and broad.

describe: A bush is a plant with many thin branches. It is smaller than a tree.
sample: → My dad and I planted some small bushes around the house.

describe: If someone or something is capable of something, they can do it.
sample: → The Olympic athlete is capable of lifting a lot of weight.

describe: To cheat is to be dishonest so that you can win or do well.
sample: → They cheated on the test by sharing answers.

describe: To concentrate on someone or something is to give your full attention.
sample: → I could not concentrate on my homework because the room was so loud.

describe: To conclude is to arrive at a logical end by looking at evidence.
sample: → I saw crumbs on my dog’s face, so I concluded that he ate my cookie.

describe: Confident means that one believes they can do something without failing.
sample: → She was confident she could climb the mountain due to her training.

describe: If something is considerable, it is large in size, amount or extent.
sample: → They paid a considerable amount of money for that car.

describe: To convey is to communicate or make ideas known.
sample: → That picture of a crying child conveys a feeling of sadness.

describe: If something is definite, it is certain or sure to be true.
sample: → There is a definite connection between hard work and success.

describe: Delight is a feeling of being very happy with something.
sample: → He felt such delight after getting a promotion at work.

describe: A destination is the place where someone or something is going to.
sample: → The destination of this plane is Munich, Germany.

describe: To dictate something is to read it aloud so it can be written down.
sample: → He dictated his speech so his secretary could write it down.

describe: The edge of something is the part of it that is farthest from the center.
sample: → He ran to the edge of the cliff.

describe: A path is a way from one place to another that people can walk along.
sample: → We followed a path through the woods.

describe: To resort to something is to depend on it in order to solve a problem.
sample: → I hope they don’t resort to violence to end the argument.

describe: A shadow is the dark area that is made when something blocks light.
sample: → The man’s shadow was taller than he was.

describe: To succeed is to complete something that you planned or tried to do.
sample: → He will continue to work on the robot until he succeeds.

describe: To suspect something is to believe that it is true.
sample: → I suspect that those kids stole the money.

describe: A valley is a low area of land between two mountains or hills.
sample: → We looked at the valley below from the top of the mountain.

describe: To admire someone is to like them for what they do.
sample: → I admire my brother for his hard work.

describe: To aid someone is to help them when they need something.
sample: → The doctor aided the boy after his accident.

describe: To attempt something is to try to do that thing.
sample: → I am attempting to learn English.

describe: Authority is the power that someone has because of their position.
sample: → The policeman has authority on the streets.

describe: A capital is an important city where a country’s leaders live and work.
sample: →  We will visit the capital to learn about our government.

describe: To cooperate is to work together to do something.
sample: → The students cooperated to clean up the classroom.

describe: To defend someone or something is to protect them from attack.
sample: → The soldiers defended the town from the invaders.

describe: Destruction is damage to something so bad that it can’t be fixed.
sample: → After the big fire, there was much destruction in the city.

describe: Disorder is a lack of order, or a complete mess.
sample: → The teacher’s desk had many papers in disorder.

describe: A division is the act of making smaller groups out of a larger one.
sample: → The chart had six divisions which all had different colors.

describe: To enable a person is to make it possible for them to do something.
sample: → Having the key enabled us to open the door.

describe: To frustrate is to prevent someone from fulfilling their desire.
sample: → The machine frustrated me because I could not fix it.

describe: To govern is to control the public business of a country, state, or city.
sample: → The United States is governed from the White House.

describe: To have plenty of something is to have more than you need.
sample: → The school had plenty of books for the students to read.

describe: To relieve someone is to make them feel less pain.
sample: → The medicine relieved the sick boy.

describe: Reputation is the opinion that people have about someone.
sample: → The doctor had a reputation for helping people.
