describe: Royal describes something that belongs to a king or queen.
sample: → The king sat upon the royal throne.

describe: A slave is a person who is not free and must work for someone else.
sample: → The slave worked very hard all day long.

describe: To struggle is to fight against someone or something.
sample: → The kids struggled with each other for the toy.

describe: When someone is stupid, they lack intelligence.
sample: → He said something stupid that made everyone angry at him.

describe: A citizen is someone who lives in a certain town or city.
sample: → Carlos was born in Spain. He is a Spanish citizen.

describe: A council is a group of people who run a city or town.
sample: → The council met to discuss the new laws for the city.

describe: To declare is to say something officially.
sample: → I declared my love for him.

describe: When people or things are enormous, they are very large.
sample: → My dog looks enormous next to yours.

describe: When someone or something are extraordinary, they are amazing.
sample: → The fireman who rescued the girl was extraordinary.

describe: Fog is a thick cloud that is near the ground or water.
sample: → I did not want to drive in the thick fog.

describe: A funeral is a ceremony that takes place after a person dies.
sample: → They had a funeral for the soldier who died during the war.

describe: When people or things are giant, they are very big.
sample: → The giant truck got in my way.

describe: An impression is the way of thinking about someone or something.
sample: → Most people’s first impression of Dr. Giani is that he is mean.

describe: Income is how much money a person or business makes.
sample: → Her company pays her a fairly good income.

describe: When someone is mad, they are angry.
sample: → Mother got mad when I didn’t listen to her.

describe: If someone ought to do something, then it is the right thing to do.
sample: → I ought to take my library books back.

describe: To resist something is to fight against it.
sample: → He resisted the treatment at the hospital.

describe: To reveal is to show something.
sample: → I will reveal where I hid the candy bar.

describe: To rid is to make a place free from something or someone.
sample: → We rid our home of mice by using traps.

describe: A sword is a long sharp weapon.
sample: → They used to use swords in battles in ancient times.

describe: A tale is a story.
sample: → She told her two friends about the wild tale of her day.

describe: To trap people or animals is to capture them so they cannot get away.
sample: → We trapped butterflies in a net.

describe: A trial is the way a court discovers if a person is guilty or innocent.
sample: → He went on trial for robbing the bank.

describe: When people are violent, they want to hurt someone.
sample: → The man was put into jail because he was violent.

describe: Admission is the act of allowing to enter a place.
sample: → The admission ticket to the movie was $5.

describe: Astronomy is the study of the stars and planets.
sample: → Harold loved watching the stars, so he decided to study astronomy.

describe: To blame someone for something bad is to say they did it.
sample: → My mom blamed me for something I didn’t do.

describe: Chemistry the study of and reaction to substances.
sample: → In chemistry class, the professor taught us about chemical reactions.

describe: If something happens despite what you do, it happens anyway.
sample: → We still played the game despite the cold weather.

describe: A dinosaur is a very big animal that lived millions of years ago.
sample: → I like to see the dinosaur bones at the museum.

describe: An exhibit is a display of interesting things.
sample: → There was an animal exhibit at the fair.

describe: Fame is reputation one has gained among the public.
sample: → He had fame and fortune, but he was not happy.

describe: A forecast is an idea about what the weather will be like in the future.
sample: → The forecast says that it will rain all week.

describe: A genius is a very smart person.
sample: → Since she was a genius, she easily passed all of her school exams.

describe: Someone who is gentle is kind and calm.
sample: → He is very gentle with the baby.

describe: Geography is the study of where things are.
sample: → I had to draw a map for geography class.

describe: To interfere is to cause problems and keep something from happening.
sample: → My little sister always interferes when I’m trying to study.

describe: To do something lightly is to not push very hard.
sample: → Draw lightly so you do not tear your paper.

describe: A principal is a person in charge of a school.
sample: → My school’s principal can be very strict with the rules.

describe: A row is a line of things.
sample: → James put all of his toy soldiers into neat rows.

describe: A shelf is a place on a wall where you put things.
sample: → I keep my clothes on a shelf in my closet.

describe: If you do something out of spite, you want to be mean.
sample: → He snuck into his sister’s room and stole her bag out of spite.

describe: Super means really good.
sample: → My dad said I did a super Job cleaning the house.

describe: If something is wet, it has water on it.
sample: → Since my dog was wet, he tried to shake all the water off his body.

describe: To abuse someone or something means to hurt them on purpose.
sample: → The mean man abused his dog when it barked too loudly.

describe: To afford something means you have enough money to pay for it.
sample: → I’ve been saving my money, so I can afford to buy a new bike.

describe: To bake means to cook food with heat.
sample: → My sister is a good cook. She bakes delicious cakes.

describe: A bean is a plant seed that is good to eat.
sample: → There are many different kinds of beans to eat.

describe: A candle is a stick of wax that is lit on fire for light or heat.
sample: → When the lights went out, we lit some candles.

describe: To convert something means to change it into something else.
sample: → The man converted his messy field into a garden of flowers.

describe: A debt is an amount of money that a person owes.
sample: → I have not paid my gas bill. I owe a debt to the gas company.

describe: To decrease something is to make it less than it was before.
sample: → Hiring more police officers has decreased crime in the city.

describe: A fault is a mistake.
sample: → It is my fault that the cat ran away. I left the door open.

describe: A fund is an amount of money that people have.
sample: → We all put money into our club’s fund.

describe: When someone is generous, they like to give things to people.
sample: → The generous man donated several new computers to our school.

describe: An ingredient is something that is part of a food dish.
sample: → The main ingredients in cake are eggs, sugar and flour.

describe: To insist means to be firm in telling people what to do.
sample: → I insist that you try some of these cookies.

describe: A mess is a condition that is not clean or neat.
sample: → Heather’s room was a complete mess.

describe: Metal is a strong material people use to build things.
sample: → Steel is a common metal that is used to build buildings.

describe: To monitor people or things is to watch them closely.
sample: → The teacher monitors the students when they take tests.

describe: To oppose something means to dislike it or act against it.
sample: → I want to be a police officer because I oppose crime.

describe: If a person is passive, they do not take action to solve problems.
sample: → Marcie is so passive that she never solves her own problems.

describe: A quantity is a certain amount of something.
sample: → I have a small quantity of milk in my glass.

describe: To sue someone is to take them to court for something wrong they did.
sample: → I sued the company after I slipped on a banana peel in their hallway.

describe: When someone has anxiety, they have a lot of worries and fear.
sample: → When I have to climb to high places, I’m filled with anxiety.

describe: An army is a large group of people who fight in wars.
sample: → The army protects all the people in the country.

describe: A billion is a very large number: 1,000,000,000.
sample: → There are billions of stars in outer space.

describe: To carve means to cut into something.
sample: → My father usually carves the turkey for Thanksgiving.

describe: To consult someone means to ask them for help.
sample: → I will consult my accountant to find a way to pay for my bills.

describe: An emergency is a time when someone needs help right away.
sample: → There is a huge fire in my house! This is an emergency!

describe: When someone has good fortune, it means they have luck.
sample: → I have good fortune when I play cards.

describe: To guarantee means to know something will happen.
sample: → I guarantee that the sun will come up in the morning.

describe: To hike means to walk in the mountains or forest.
sample: → I always bring plenty of equipment with me when I hike.

describe: When something is initial, it is the first thing.
sample: → The initial step when writing a paper is to find a good topic.

describe: If something is intense, it is very strong.
sample: → The skunk made an intense odor that filled the air.

describe: To lend something is to give it to someone for a short time.
sample: → My sister lost her pen, so I will lend her mine.

describe: The peak is the very top of a mountain.
sample: → There is snow on the peaks of those mountains.

describe: Potential means capable of being but not yet in existence.
sample: → I’ve thought of some potential problems with your idea.

describe: When you have pride, you are happy with yourself.
sample: → I take pride in getting good grades.

describe: Proof is a fact that shows something is real.
sample: → They used his fingerprint as proof for the crime he committed.

describe: To quit something means to stop doing it.
sample: → I quit running because I got tired.

describe: To spin is to turn around in circles.
sample: → The boy kept spinning until he fell down.

describe: When people or things are tiny, they are very small.
sample: → A baby’s hand is tiny.

describe: A tutor is someone who gives lessons in a certain subject.
sample: → My sister is bad at math. So my mother hired a tutor to help her.

describe: If something is apparent, it is easy to see.
sample: → Her happiness was apparent from the smile on her face.

describe: When people are blind, they cannot see.
sample: → The blind man didn’t see the hole and almost fell in.

describe: To calculate is to find an answer using math.
sample: → I calculated how much money I would need to buy the car.

describe: To chat is to talk with someone.
sample: → Even though they were far apart, the couple chatted every day.

describe: To commit to something is to promise to do it.
sample: → Seth wanted to go home, but he had committed to finishing the job.

describe: To compose something is to make it from smaller parts.
sample: → Tonya composed her report using many sources of information.

describe: A dormitory is a school building where students live.
sample: → I will move into the dormitory at the beginning of the school year.

describe: To exhaust someone is to make them tired.
sample: → John exhausted himself by swimming all day.

describe: A greenhouse is a small glass building that is used to grow plants.
sample: → We have a small greenhouse in our backyard where we grow plants.

describe: To ignore something is to act like you do not see or hear it.
sample: → I ignored the message he was making and kept studying.

describe: If something is obvious, it is clear and easily seen.
sample: → It was obvious that he was tired. He kept falling asleep.

describe: Physics is a science that deals with energy and how it affects things.
sample: → In physics class, we used Newton’s Cradle to learn about energy.

describe: A portion of something is a part of it.
sample: → I only ate a small portion of the pizza.

describe: To remind someone is to tell them to remember to do something.
sample: → Nick’s dad reminded him to do his homework.

describe: A secretary is a person who works in an office.
sample: → Rebecca asked her secretary to type a report.

describe: If something is severe, it is very bad or serious.
sample: → After hitting his hand with the hammer, Sam was in severe pain.

describe: If someone has a talent, they are naturally able to do it well.
sample: → Maria has a talent for playing the piano.

describe: A thesis is an idea that needs to be proved.
sample: → She did not support her thesis very well.

describe: A uniform is a piece of clothing worn by people of the same group.
sample: → All the members of our marching band wear matching uniforms.

describe: Vision is the act of seeing.
sample: → The eye doctor tested my vision.

describe: To absorb a liquid means to take it inside.
sample: → He used a sponge to absorb the water on the floor.

describe: A boss is a person in charge of other people at work.
sample: → My boss is a nice person.

describe: A committee is a group of people who meet together to make decisions.
sample: → The school’s committee agreed on a new dress code for students.

describe: A contract is a written agreement between two people.
sample: → The woman signed a contract when she bought the house.

describe: A crew is a group of workers.
sample: → My father has a crew. They help him build houses.

describe: To devote time to something means to spend a lot of time doing it.
sample: → She devotes two hours a day to playing the piano.

describe: To dig is to make a hole in the ground.
sample: → My dog digs in the yard so he can hide his bones.

describe: To dine means to eat dinner.
sample: → The young couple dined at their home.

describe: To donate is to give something to a charity or organization.
sample: → We donate money to Christmas charities every year.

describe: If something is double, it is twice as much, or twice as many.
sample: → I paid almost double the amount for that shirt.

describe: To elevate something is to put it at a higher level.
sample: → The man elevated the picture so he could see it better.

describe: A flavor is the taste of food or drinks.
sample: → The flavor of the ice cream was very good.

describe: A foundation is a group that provides money for research.
sample: → The foundation raised money to give scholarships to students.

describe: A generation is a group of people who live at the same time.
sample: → My grandparents are from a different generation than me.

describe: A handle is the part of an object people hold while using it.
sample: → The pot is very hot. So pick it up by the handle.

describe: A layer covers over something or is between two things.
sample: → There was a layer of snow on the tops of the houses this morning.

describe: Mud is soft, wet dirt.
sample: → My brother played rugby in the mud. Now he’s dirty.

describe: If something is smooth, it has no bumps.
sample: → The baby’s skin felt very smooth.

describe: Soil is the top layer of land on the Earth.
sample: → The boy planted flowers in the soil and watered them every day.

describe: If people or things are unique, they are not like the others.
sample: → Her dog is unique. I’ve never seen one quite like it.

describe: A chamber is an old word for a bedroom.
sample: → The girl was tired. She went to her chamber fora nap.

describe: To deny something is to say it is not true.
sample: → The boy denied that he broke the window.

describe: A document is an official piece of writing.
sample: → He was given an official document proving he was a citizen.

describe: To emphasize is to give importance or attention to something.
sample: → She emphasized the key points by circling them in red ink.

describe: A fever is a high body temperature that people get when they are sick.
sample: → Lydia had a high fever so she didn’t go to school.

describe: The flu is a type of sickness that makes you feel weak or your body hurt.
sample: → Since he had the flu, he felt miserable.

describe: To freeze is to become very cold.
sample: → If you don’t wear your coat in winter, you will freeze.

describe: A gesture is a movement of the hands or body.
sample: → My teacher makes a lot of gestures when she speaks.

describe: To interrupt is to briefly stop someone when they are doing something.
sample: → My mother interrupted me when I was trying to listen to music.

describe: To last is to continue or go on for an amount of time.
sample: → The football match lasted for nearly two hours.

describe: Likeness means the state of being like, or resemblance.
sample: → Michelle bears a strong likeness to her older sister Kate.

describe: Moreover means besides or in addition to something.
sample: → It’s cold outside. Moreover, the wind is very strong.

describe: A perspective is the way you think about something.
sample: → The man’s speech gave me a new perspective on our country.

describe: When something is rational, it is normal or practical.
sample: → It is hard to think in a rational way when you are scared.

describe: To recover is to go back to normal after something bad happens.
sample: → I hope the city will recover soon after the flood.

describe: To rely on something or someone is to trust or depend on them.
sample: → The boy relied on his older brother to help him.

describe: To shock people is to surprise them.
sample: → The man was shocked by the news.

describe: When people are shy, they are nervous around people strange to them.
sample: → The girl was too shy to try out for the play.

describe: To stare at something is to look at it for a long time.
sample: → The young couple stared into each other’s eyes.

describe: Thus means as a result or for that reason.
sample: → The sun was shining. Thus, I wore my sunglasses.

describe: An aim is a goal someone wants to make happen.
sample: → My aim is to become a helicopter pilot.

describe: To attach is to put two things together.
sample: → I attached the socks to the clothesline to dry.

describe: To bet is to risk money on the result of a game or a business.
sample: → How much will you bet that your horse will win?

describe: A carriage is a vehicle pulled by a horse.
sample: → We took a carriage ride in the park.

describe: If something is classic, it is typical.
sample: → The athlete made a classic mistake-he started running too soon.

describe: To commute is to travel a long distance to get to work.
sample: → I usually commute to work on the train.

describe: To confirm is to make sure something is correct.
sample: → Winning the game confirmed that James was a good player.

describe: To criticize is to say you do not like someone or something.
sample: → He criticized his wife forspending too much money.

describe: To differ is to not be the same as another person or thing.
sample: → I differ from my brother: he is short, while I am tall.

describe: An expense is the money that people spend on something.
sample: → She wrote down all the expenses for her trip.

describe: If something is formal, it is done in an official way.
sample: → It was a formal dinner, so we wore our best clothes.

describe: Height is how tall someone or something is.
sample: → My height is 168 centimeters.

describe: To invent something is to create something that never existed before.
sample: → My grandfather has invented some interesting things.

describe: If someone is junior in their job, they do not have a lot of power.
sample: → When she started at the company, she was only a junior manager.

describe: Labor is the act of doing or making something.
sample: → Building the house took a lot of labor.

describe: A mechanic is someone who fixes vehicles or machines.
sample: → We took the car to the mechanic to be fixed.

describe: If something is prime, it is the most important one.
sample: → Dirty air is a prime cause of illness.

describe: To shift to something is to move into a new place or direction.
sample: → He shifted to the other side of the table to eat his breakfast.

describe: A signal is a sound or action that tells someone to do something.
sample: → The coach blew his whistle as a signal to begin the game.

describe: When people are sincere, they tell the truth.
sample: → He sounded sincere when he apologized to me.

describe: Ability is the quality of a person being able to do something well.
sample: → His swimming abilities let him cross the entire lake.

describe: Agriculture is the growing of food and animals.
sample: → The farmer studied agriculture in college.

describe: A cartoon is a funny drawing.
sample: → Sometimes, people draw cartoons for the newspaper.

describe: The ceiling is the top of a room.
sample: → He painted the ceiling with a special roller.

describe: To convince someone means to make them sure of something.
sample: → She convinced me to buy the house.

describe: When you are curious about something, you want to know more about it.
sample: → I opened up the clock because I was curious about how it worked.

describe: To delay means to wait to do something.
sample: → I was delayed at the airport for over two hours.

describe: A diary is a book in which people write their personal experiences.
sample: → I do not let anybody read my diary.

describe: An element of something is a particular part of it.
sample: → Tackling an opponent is Johnny’s favorite element of American footbal.

describe: When people have faith in something, they believe in it and trust it.
sample: → The sick girl had faith in doctors. She knew they would make her better.

describe: Grain is food crops such as wheat, corn, rice or oats.
sample: → The farmer planted two fields of grain this year.

describe: To greet someone means to meet and welcome them.
sample: → When my friend came over, I greeted him at the door.

describe: To investigate means to search for something or learn about it.
sample: → The detective went to investigate the crime.

describe: Joy is a feeling you get when you are really happy.
sample: → I love baseball. I feel joy when I play.

describe: A label is a tag that tells about something.
sample: → The label on the back of your shirt will tell you what size it is.

describe: A monk is a religious person who lives a simple life.
sample: → The monks knew a lot about religion.

describe: When something is odd, it is unusual.
sample: → Her cat is odd. It walks on two feet.

describe: To pause means to stop doing something for a while.
sample: → Since she was so hungry, she paused to make a snack.

describe: A priest is a person trained to perform religious duties.
sample: → The priest taught us about God.

describe: A profession is a person’s job.
sample: → He loved sailing, so he chose to work on ships as a profession.

describe: To adopt someone is to make them as a part of one’s own family.
sample: → The girl was adopted by the couple when she was three.

describe: To beg is to ask for something one really wants.
sample: → The man begged for some money.

describe: If A is beyond B, A is farther away.
sample: → John’s house is beyond that lake.

describe: A costume is a set of clothes people wear for a particular occasion.
sample: → The woman wore a mask with her costume.

describe: To exclaim is to say something loudly, usually due to being excited.
sample: → “Look at her dress!” Sara exclaimed.

describe: To extend is to stretch out or reach.
sample: → The boy extended his hand to catch the ball.

describe: A fool is someone who makes unwise choices.
sample: → The girl was a fool for playing too close to the water.

describe: To forbid is to tell someone they cannot do something.
sample: → My father forbids watching TV while we’re eating dinner.

describe: To illustrate is to show something by drawing a picture.
sample: → The executive illustrated the decreasing profits of the company.

describe: Indeed means truly or really.
sample: → The birthday party was indeed fun last night.

describe: To interpret is to explain what something means.
sample: → The woman interpreted what her co-worker was trying to say.

describe: If people do something kindly, they do it in a nice way.
sample: → The stranger kindly cared for the hurt man.

describe: A motive is the reason someone does something.
sample: → His motive for studying so hard is to get into a good college.

describe: A nest is a place where a bird lays its eggs.
sample: → The bird laid her eggs in the nest that she made.

describe: The origin of someone or something is where they come from.
sample: → The origin of the honey that we eat is from a beehive.

describe: A reception is a party to welcome a person or celebrate an event.
sample: → We all danced and had a good time at the wedding reception.

describe: To reject is to refuse something because you do not want it.
sample: → The girl rejected the broken cup.

describe: Silence is complete quiet.
sample: → The man asked for silence while he worked on the problem.

describe: A stream is a small river.
sample: → The boy caught a fish in the stream.

describe: Tone is the sound of someone’s voice. It shows how they feel.
sample: → My father’s tone told me I had broken the rule.

describe: To accomplish something means to finish it.
sample: → He accomplished his goal of running ten miles.

describe: To approve of something means you like it or are happy about it.
sample: → Her co-workers approved her new plan.

describe: Approximate means to be close to an exact amount, number or time.
sample: → My approximate height is two meters.

describe: A barrier is something that is in your way.
sample: → The Great Wall was a barrier between China and its enemies.

describe: To detect something means to notice or find something.
sample: → The boy ran to the kitchen when he detected the smell of cookies.

describe: A duty is something that a person has to do.
sample: → It is parents’ duty to take care of their children.

describe: When something is elementary, it is the first or most simple thing.
sample: → Children go to elementary school before high school.

describe: A failure happens when you do not do something right.
sample: → My cooking ended in failure because I burned the food.

describe: When something is gradual, it happens slowly.
sample: → Children learn to read at a gradual pace. They do not learn right away.

describe: An immigrant is a person who moves to a different country.
sample: → My parents were immigrants. They came from Poland.

describe: To insert something means to put it in something else.
sample: → The mailman inserted the letter into the mailbox.

describe: An instant is a very short amount of time.
sample: → A microwave oven cooks food in an instant.

describe: Poverty is the state of being poor.
sample: → Poverty is a problem in many countries around the world.

describe: To pretend means to make believe something is real.
sample: → The boy liked to pretend he was a king.

describe: A person’s rank is their place in an order of people.
sample: → The man got to the rank of captain in the navy.

describe: Recognition is getting praise from other people.
sample: → The hero got recognition for his brave deed.

describe: To refrigerate something means to make it cold.
sample: → Grocery stores refrigerate fruit to make it last long.

describe: Rent is the money people pay to someone to live in a certain place.
sample: → To live in this house, I have to pay rent at the start of each month.

describe: To retire is to leave a job, usually because of old age.
sample: → My father is sixty-five years old. He is about to retire from work.

describe: A statistic is a number that tells a fact about something.
sample: → The statistics showed that we did just as well this year as last year.

describe: An astronaut is a person that goes into outer space.
sample: → The astronaut was walking on the moon.

describe: When you are awake, you are not asleep.
sample: → Sometimes I lay awake in bed because I am not tired.

describe: When you have courage, you are not afraid.
sample: → The man had the courage to touch the lion.

describe: To float is to move on top of water without sinking.
sample: → The boy’s toy boat floated in the pool.

describe: To grant something is to allow someone to have it.
sample: → The teacher granted us a break after studying hard all day.

describe: Gravity is the force that makes things fall to Earth.
sample: → There is no gravity in space.

describe: A jewel is a beautiful stone that is worth a lot of money.
sample: → A diamond is one of the most expensive jewels in the world.

describe: A miner is a person who works in a mine.
sample: → The miner was looking for gold.

describe: A mineral is a type of substance found in the Earth.
sample: → Rocks are made up of different kinds of minerals.

describe: To participate is to take part in something.
sample: → The students participated in the school play.

describe: Permission means the act of allowing the doing of something.
sample: → I have permission to drive my mom’s car.

describe: To pour a liquid means to make it come out of a container.
sample: → I poured some milk into my sister’s cup.

describe: Someone or something’s presence is the fact they are there.
sample: → The presence of dark clouds meant it would rain.

describe: If a material is raw, it is natural and has not been processed.
sample: → The company dumped raw sewage into the river.

describe: A satellite is something that is sent into space to get information.
sample: → The satellite was traveling around the earth.

describe: The scale of something is its size, especially when it is very large.
sample: → I was surprised by the scale of the buildings in the downtown area.

describe: To skip something is to not do it.
sample: → He skipped work to get more sleep.

describe: To stretch is to make your arms or legs reach out.
sample: → She stretched her body before exercising.

describe: A telescope is a tool people use to look at the stars.
sample: → With a telescope, you can see the moon and stars easily.

describe: When something is underground, it is below the surface of the Earth.
sample: → Subway trains travel underground.

describe: An alarm is something that warns people of danger.
sample: → When the students heard the fire alarm, they left the building.

describe: When people or things are apart, they are not close together.
sample: → The couple decided to live apart from each other.

describe: To arrest someone means to catch them for doing something bad.
sample: → The man was arrested for breaking the law.

describe: An award is a prize someone gets for doing something well.
sample: → He got an award for having the best grades in class.

describe: A breed is a group of animals within a species.
sample: → I like small dog breeds, such as terriers.

describe: A bucket is a round containerto put things in.
sample: → I filled the bucket with water.

describe: A contest is a game or a race.
sample: → The girls had a contest to see who could jump higher.

describe: To convict someone means to prove that they did a bad thing.
sample: → He was convicted of the crime and sent to jail.

describe: A garage is the part of a house where people put their cars.
sample: → My car does not get dirty because I keep it in the garage.

describe: A journalist is a person who writes news stories.
sample: → The journalist took notes for a story he was writing.

describe: A pup is a young dog.
sample: → All the girl wanted for her birthday was a pup.

describe: To qualify is to get, or to be declared, adequate or good enough.
sample: → He qualified to go to the final match by beating the opponent.

describe: To repair something is to fix it.
sample: → I repaired the flat tire on my car.

describe: To resume something means to start it again after taking a break.
sample: → I put the newspaper down to eat breakfast. Then I resumed reading.

describe: To rob a person or place is to take their property by using force.
sample: → A thief has robbed me of my passport.

describe: To slip means to slide and fall down.
sample: → The man slipped on the wet floor.

describe: Somewhat means to some degree, but not to a large degree.
sample: → James was somewhat upset when he had to move some boxes.

describe: When something is stable, it will not fall over.
sample: → The chair is stable. Its legs are strong.

describe: A tissue is a soft piece of paper people use to wipe their noses.
sample: → There was a box of tissue on the table.

describe: A yard is the ground just outside of a person’s house.
sample: → The girls jumped rope in the yard.

describe: If two things or people are alike, they are similar in some way.
sample: → People often think my sister and I look alike.

describe: To annoy someone means to bother them.
sample: → The flies buzzing around John’s head annoyed him very much.

describe: Architecture is the style or way a building is made.

describe: A valentine is someone you love or admire with great affection.

describe: When a plant blooms, it makes flowers.

describe: A curl is a small piece of something with a round shape.

describe: A disguise is something you wear so people cannot tell who you are.

describe: If something is fancy, it is nicer than normal.

describe: To wander is to walk without going to a certain place.
sample: → The boys like to wander in the woods and look at birds.

describe: Armor is metal worn by soldiers to protect the body.
sample: → The soldier wore armor to protect his body.

describe: To blaze means to burn brightly or powerfully.
sample: → The small fire soon blazed into a large dangerous one.

describe: To boom means to make a loud, deep sound.
sample: → The firecrackers made a loud boom when they exploded.

describe: A cliff is a high and often flat wall of rock.
sample: → The wolf stood at the cliff and howled.

describe: A flame is part of fire.
sample: → The torch was filled with yellow and orange flames.

describe: Independence is the state of being free from the control of others.
sample: → After leaving home, Sophia had a great feeling of independence.

describe: An invasion is an attack by a group from another country.
sample: → In Korea, walls were built around cities to protect them from invasions.

describe: A knight is a soldier of high rank and skill who usually serves a king.
sample: → He was the best soldier, so the king made him a knight.

describe: Lightning is the bright light seen during a storm.
sample: → The lightning flashed above the water.

describe: A rebel is a person who fights the government in order to change it.
sample: → The rebel had enough of the government’s unfair polices.

describe: To retreat means to run away because you have been beaten in a fight.
sample: → The army retreated because they were losing the battle.

describe: A revolution is a change to the political system by a group of people.
sample: → The revolution in Russia led to the creation of the Soviet Union.

describe: A spear is a long stick with a blade on one end that is used as a weapon.
sample: → The soldier was holding a spear in his hand.

describe: If something is steep, then its slope or angle rises or falls sharply.
sample: → He rode his bike up the steep hill to reach the top.

describe: A summit is the highest part of a hill or mountain.
sample: → Snow covered the summit of the mountain even during the summer.

describe: Thunder is the loud noise heard during a storm.
sample: → The sound of the thunder startled me.

describe: Troops are soldiers that fight in groups in a battle.
sample: → The troops were all prepared to go into battle.

describe: A warrior is a brave soldier or fighter.
sample: → The samurai were some of the most skilled warriors in the ancient world.

describe: To withdraw means to leave a place, usually during war.
sample: → After losing the battle, the enemy withdrew back to its own country.

describe: To yield something means to give up control of it or to give it away.
sample: → He had to yield his turn because he was in checkmate.

describe: A bench is a long seat for two or more people.
sample: → Most parks have benches for citizens to relax upon.

describe: To confront a hard situation or person is to deal with it.
sample: → The couple has to confront each other about their problems.

describe: A daisy is a small flower with white petals and a yellow center.
sample: → There were a few daisies growing in the field.

describe: A dispute is an argument or disagreement that people have.
sample: → Karen and Brian often have disputes about silly things.

describe: Horror is a feeling of being very afraid or shocked.
sample: → The audience screamed in horror when the ghost appeared in the movie.

describe: An incident is an event that is usually not pleasant.
sample: → Mr. Wilson had an incident where he became sick and had to leave.

describe: Mist is water that you can see in the air or on a surface.
sample: → The forest was covered with mist.

describe: An object is an inanimate thing that you can see or touch.
sample: → The shopping cart was filled with objects.

describe: An orphan is a child who does not have parents.
sample: → The orphan frequently cried during the night.

describe: To plot is to make a secret plan to do something that is wrong or mean.
sample: → The group was plotting to ruin the company’s financial reports.

describe: When a female is pregnant, she is going to have a baby.
sample: → The pregnant woman was shopping for baby clothes.

describe: Rage is a very angry feeling.
sample: → The chef was filled with rage when his helpers ruined the meal.

describe: Revenge is what you do to hurt or punish someone who hurts you.
sample: → He broke his sister’s doll as revenge after she lost his favorite book.

describe: Shame is a bad feeling about things you have done wrong.
sample: → The boy felt shame about misplacing his clothes.

describe: To sigh is to breathe out loudly and show that you are tired or sad.
sample: → Molly sighed when she looked at all the information she had to research.

describe: To sneak is to move quietly so that no one hears or sees you.
sample: → The thief snuck out of the house without anyone noticing him.

describe: To spare something is to give it because you have more than you need.
sample: → I wanted to help him but I couldn’t spare a tire.

describe: The stem of a plant is the stick that grows leaves or flowers.
sample: → The rose had a long thin stem.

describe: Supper is a meal that is eaten in the evening.
sample: → We usually have supper around 6 o ’clock at my house.

describe: When something is tender, it is soft and easy to chew.
sample: → The meat was so tender they didn’t need knives to cut it with.

describe: If something is beneath something else, it is under it.
sample: → The largest part of an iceberg lies beneath the waterline.

describe: A cub is a baby animal, such as a bear or lion.
sample: → The lion cub was crying for its mother.

describe: Dawn is the time of day when the sun rises.
sample: → At dawn, the sun gently rose over the farm.

describe: If you are dissatisfied, you are not happy with something.
sample: → I was dissatisfied with their decision to work on Sunday.

describe: When something is done with ease, it is not hard to do.
sample: → The monkey climbed the tree with ease.

describe: When something is evident, it is easy to see or understand.
sample: → It was evident from the look on his face that he was unhappy.

describe: Hail is ice that falls from the sky when rain freezes.
sample: → The hail from the storm was the size of golf balls.

describe: To howl means to make a long, loud sound like a wolf or a dog.
sample: → The wolf howled at the moon.

describe: To leap means to jump a long distance.
sample: → He had to leap over the gap to reach the other side of the hill.

describe: When something is magnificent, it is beautiful and grand.
sample: → The man gave his wife a pair of magnificent diamond earrings.

describe: A necessity is something that is needed.
sample: → Fresh water is a necessity for life.

describe: An outcome is the end of an action or event.
sample: → The outcome of his latest business plan was a complete failure.

describe: A pile is a large group of things on top of one another.
sample: → The pile of cups was beginning to tilt.

describe: When something is profound, it is very intelligent.
sample: → For a little boy, Jeremy has some profound thoughts.

describe: To seize something means to grab it quickly or strongly.
sample: → The man seized as much money as he could before anyone could see him.

describe: To squeeze something means to press it together and hold it tightly.
sample: → When Clara saw her cat, she gave it a big squeeze.

describe: When something is supreme, it is the highest or best.
sample: → The supreme officer was in charge of keeping the citizens calm.

describe: When something is terrific, it is very good.
sample: → My youngest daughter is a terrific painter.

describe: A trait is part of someone’s personality.
sample: → One trait of Salvador’s personality is his cheerfulness.

describe: When something is vital, it is necessary for life.
sample: → The heart is a vital organ.

describe: When you become accustomed to something, you are in the habit of it.
sample: → Grandfather is accustomed to reading the newspaper every morning.

describe: To affirm is to say that something is true.
sample: → Using a graph, Malcolm affirmed the success o f the company.

describe: If someone is astonished, they are very surprised or shocked.
sample: → I was astonished when he pulled the live rabbit out of his hat.

describe: To bang is to hit something to make a noise.
sample: → The drummer banged on his drum as he marched in the parade.

describe: A clan is a group of relatives or friends.
sample: → The Lee clan meets every year to celebrate the New Year.

describe: When something is dim, it does not give out much light.
sample: → Working in a dim room is bad for your eyes.

describe: Emphasis is special attention or importance.
sample: → The students put special emphasis on chapter 4 because it will be on the test.

describe: A fable is a short story that teaches a lesson.
sample: → In the fable about the tortoise and the hare, the lesson is consistency.

describe: A feast is a large meal for many people.
sample: → At Thanksgiving, I enjoy a wonderful feast with my family.

describe: To glow is to make a soft light.
sample: → The small flame glowed softly.

describe: When something is hollow, it has an empty space inside.
sample: → Straws are hollow, so liquid can flow through them.

describe: Instinct is the natural way that people behave without thinking about it.
sample: → Cats hunt mice because of instinct.

describe: A joint is a place of the body where the bones meet, such as the knee.
sample: → Two important bones in your leg meet at a join t in your knee.

describe: To leak is to let a liquid or gas pass through a flaw.
sample: → The pipe leaks from many places.

describe: A physician is a doctor.
sample: → The physician said I would feel better if I took my medicine.

describe: To sacrifice something valuable is to give it up to get something else.
sample: → Her parents sacrificed a lot of money in order for her to go to college.

describe: When something is stiff, it is hard to move.
sample: → The bird was standing on the tree’s s tiff branch.

describe: To stroke is to move a hand over something or someone.
sample: → She stroked her cheek to see if there was something on it.

describe: When something is tragic, it is connected with death and suffering.
sample: → The airplane crashed in a tragic accident.

describe: A tune is a song.
sample: → The students played a familiar tune for the audience.

describe: To accommodate is to have enough room.
sample: → The meeting room can accommodate nine people.

describe: A circus is a traveling show with animals and people.
sample: → I like to go to the circus to see the animals do tricks.

describe: If two things coincide, they happen at the same time.
sample: → My birthday coincides with Christmas.

describe: To commission someone to do something is to pay them to do it.
sample: → The artist was commissioned to create a picture.

describe: A dose is a certain amount of medicine that you take at one time.
sample: → My mother gave me a dose of medicine before I went to bed.

describe: To dye something is to make it a certain color by using a special chemical.
sample: → Valery got her hair dyed at the salon yesterday.

describe: The extent of something is how large, important, or serious it is.
sample: → He ate to such an extent that he became overweight.

describe: Gender is a category that describes being either a boy or a girl.
sample: → Do you know the gender of her new baby?

describe: A headline is the title of a newspaper story.
sample: → The headline on the front page was about the economy.

describe: When something is informal, it is not official.
sample: → They had an informal meeting to talk about their experiences.

describe: To inquire about something is to ask about it.
sample: → Dad called to inquire about the price of tickets for the show.

describe: A messenger is one who carries information from one place to another.
sample: → The messenger delivered an important document to the office.

describe: To peer at something is to watch it carefully.
sample: → She peered at people through the window.

describe: A portrait is a painting or photograph of someone.
sample: → I saw many religious portraits when I went to the museum.

describe: To pose is to stay in one place without moving.
sample: → The kids and their dog posed for a picture.

describe: A ranch is a large farm where animals are kept.
sample: → My uncle has many horses on his ranch.

describe: To steer something is to control where it goes.
sample: → He steered the go-cart around the track.

describe: A stripe is a thick line.
sample: → The flag of the United States has red and white stripes.

describe: When an animal is tame, it is not afraid to be near people.
sample: → The tame bird rested on his hand.

describe: To tempt people is to offer them something they want but shouldn’t have.
sample: → I wasn’t hungry, but she tempted me with a piece of my favorite cake.

describe: An Aborigine is a native of Australia before Europeans lived there.
sample: → The Aborigines created beautiful artwork.

describe: To ban something is to not let people do it.
sample: → Smoking is banned in this building.

describe: If you are cautious, you are careful in a dangerous situation.
sample: → Be very cautious as you stack those boxes.

describe: To confess something is to say that you did it.
sample: → He confessed that he was responsible for choosing the winning story.

describe: A cottage is a small, old house in the countryside.
sample: → My aunt lives in a pretty cottage in the mountains.

describe: Daytime is the time of the day when the sky is light.
sample: → I only allowed my kids to play outside in the daytime.

describe: If you are desperate, you will try anything to do or change something.
sample: → I’m desperate to find a new job.

describe: If something fades, it gets quieter or darker.
sample: → The piece of cloth I found was old and faded.

describe: If a person or animal is fierce, they are angry or violent.
sample: → Wolves are fierce animals. Do not disturb them.

describe: To gamble means to play a game that involves winning or losing money.
sample: → Many people like to go to casinos to gamble.

describe: A lawn is an area covered in grass.
sample: → My dad keeps the lawn in front of our house very neat.

describe: To mow grass is to cut it to make it very short.
sample: → I mow our lawn every weekend.

describe: An outlaw is a criminal who hides from the police.
sample: → The police passed out posters of the outlaw to all the people.

describe: A prospect is a possibility that something will happen.
sample: → He wakes up every morning with the prospect of having a good day.

describe: A purse is a bag where women keep money, makeup and keys.
sample: → My sister likes to buy designer purses.

describe: A rod is a thin stick made of wood or metal.
sample: → I bought a new fishing rod to use while on vacation.

describe: If something seldom happens, it doesn’t happen very often.
sample: → It seldom rains in southern Arizona.

describe: To shave means to cut the hairs on your face with a sharp tool.
sample: → My father shaves his face every day because he doesn’t want a beard.

describe: If you are terrified, you are extremely scared.
sample: → When I saw the ghost, I was absolutely terrified!

describe: A wizard is a man who can do magic.
sample: → The wizard made gold fall from the sky.

describe: Baggage is the set of bags that people take with them when they travel.
sample: → I’m taking several pieces of baggage with me on vacation.

describe: A bulb is the glass part of an electric light.
sample: → I had to change the light bulb in my bedroom.

describe: A bundle is a number of things that are tied together.
sample: → I was shocked when he showed me a bundle of money.

describe: Cattle are cows and bulls, especially on a farm.
sample: → The rancher’s cattle were eating the grass in the field.

describe: To flee means to run away from trouble or danger.
sample: → The crowd of men tried to flee from the danger.

describe: To graze means to eat grass.
sample: → The cows grazed in the field.

describe: Greed is a desire to have more than the things that you need.
sample: → She ate all the cookies out of her greed.

describe: A herd is a large group of the same type of animals that live together.
sample: → The herd of cows moved slowly across the ranch.

describe: To initiate something means to start it.
sample: → You have to turn the switch on to initiate the computer system.

describe: A lane is a small road.
sample: → The lane passes directly in front of our house.

describe: Nerve is bravery or the belief that you can do something.
sample: → He has the nerve to think that he can actually wrestle with a lion.

describe: An optimist is somebody who sees the good parts of a situation.
sample: → Even though he has physical problems, my brother is an optimist.

describe: A parade is a celebration when groups of people walk in the same direction.
sample: → There were many marching bands in the spring parade.

describe: To pave the ground is to lay material on it to make it easier to walk or drive on.
sample: → The path was paved with yellow bricks.

describe: A phantom is a ghost or spirit.
sample: → A scary phantom appeared from out of the darkness.

describe: Something that is portable is able to be moved or carried easily.
sample: → Since computers are portable, people can use them anywhere.

describe: A poster is a written announcement that is used to advertise something.
sample: → I saw a poster about a free concert in the park.

describe: To scratch is to make small cuts with a claw or fingernail.
sample: → I used a stick to scratch my back.

describe: A symphony is a long piece of music performed by many musicians.
sample: → Alex, a violin player, has always dreamt of playing a symphony.

describe: A widow is a woman whose husband has died.
sample: → The widow had no children and was very lonely.

describe: To circulate something is to spread it quickly.
sample: → The fan helped to circulate cool air through the room.

describe: Consequent means happening because of a different situation.

describe: To derive something from another source means to get it from that thing.

describe: To drown is to die from not being able to breathe underwater.

describe: A dynasty is a series of rulers who are all from the same family.
sample: → The ancient Egyptians had a dynasty that lasted for many years.

describe: A fraction is a small part of something.

describe: Frost is a white layer of ice that forms during very cold weather.
sample: → In the morning, the trees were all covered with frost.

describe: An illusion is something that looks real, but doesn’t actually exist.
sample: → Some pictures create an illusion for the eyes.

describe: To invade is to take over a place by force.

describe: A lieutenant is a rank in the military or police, or a person with that rank.

describe: The word marine describes something related to the sea.
sample: → A healthy ocean is full of marine animals.

describe: The merit of something or someone is their good qualities.

describe: A navy is the part of a country’s military that fights at sea.
sample: → My country is known for our strong navy.

describe: Polar relates to the cold places on Earth’s north and south ends.

describe: A ray is a line of light that comes from a bright object.

describe: To resign means to quit a job.

describe: Suicide is the act of killing oneself.
sample: → Some people feel so sad that they think suicide is the only answer.

describe: To tremble is to shake as a result of cold weather.

describe: When something is underlying, it is a hidden cause of something else.

describe: To travel via something means to travel through or using something.

describe: To alter something means to make a small change to it.

describe: If someone stands aside, they are on or to one side.

describe: Autumn is the season of the year between summer and winter.

describe: To blend is to mix two or more things together so that they become one thing.

describe: To collapse is to fall down suddenly.

describe: To crush something is to press it together so its shape is destroyed.

describe: To curve is to move in a line that bends and does not go straight.

describe: If something is disgusting, it is very unpleasant.

describe: A drain is a pipe that carries away water from a building, such as in a kitchen.
sample: → The water in the sink goes down the drain as you wash your hands.

describe: To embrace is to hug.
sample: → When they saw each other again, the happy couple embraced.

describe: To envy someone is to wish that you had something that they have.
sample: → Sally envied the happy couple.

describe: Fireworks are objects that create colored lights when they are lit.
sample: → The display of fireworks was so beautiful.

describe: Flour is a powder made from plants that is used to make foods like bread.
sample: → I wanted to bake a pie, but I needed flour.

describe: A fuse is a string that you light on fireworks to make them explode.
sample: → The boy litthe fuse on the rocket and waited for it to burst in the sky.

describe: Ginger is a spice from the root of a plant. It tastes spicy and sweet.
sample: → Ginger is a common ingredient in many dishes from India.

describe: If you are jealous, you think someone might take something from you.
sample: → Miriam was jealous because Sue was paying too much attention to Jim .

describe: A paste is a thick and smooth substance.
sample: → My son needed some paste for a school project.

describe: A receipt is a paper that proves that something was received or bought.
sample: → After looking at my receipt, I realized that I had spent too much money.

describe: To wipe something is to slide a piece of cloth over it to clean it.
sample: → She wiped the dust from the windows.

describe: A wire is a thin string made out of metal.
sample: → The wires were connected to towers that brought electricity to the city.

describe: If you acknowledge something, you accept that it is true or that it exists.
sample: → The teacher acknowledged that the young student was hungry.

describe: An ambassador is a government worker who works in another country.
sample: → The ambassador from Korea was in charge ofthe conference.

describe: If someone is a blonde, they have light-colored hair.
sample: → My cousin is different from me. She is a blonde with blue eyes.

describe: To conquer a country means to attack and take control of it.
sample: → The soldiers were trying to conquer the world.

describe: To drag something means to pull it across the ground.
sample: → The dog was dragging his owner down the street.

describe: To exaggerate is to say that something is bigger or better than it really is.
sample: → Jimmy wasn’t exaggerating about the seriousness of his injury.

describe: Heritage is the collection of features of a society, such as language and religion.
sample: → Teepees are part ofthe heritage of the American Indians of the plains.

describe: To insult someone is to say things that will hurt their feelings.
sample: → The girls insulted each other all afternoon.

describe: Meanwhile means until something happens or while something is happening.
sample: → He wants to be a doctor in the future, but meanwhile, he works a regular job.

describe: A necklace is a piece of jewelry that people wear around their necks.
sample: → Joyce received a lovely pearl necklace for her wedding anniversary.

describe: A noble is a rich and powerful person.
sample: → The Queen invited a noble from a nearby country to dinner.

describe: When something is precious, it is valuable and important.
sample: → In a desert, water can be more precious than money.

describe: A prejudice is an unfair opinion about someone before you get to know them.
sample: → The company’s rules against gender prejudice must be enforced.

describe: A rumor is a story that may not be true.
sample: → Carla was spreading rumors around the office.

describe: A sin is something that is wrong for religious reasons.
sample: → Taking something that doesn’t belong to you is a sin.

describe: A spectacle is an amazing sight.
sample: → Niagara Falls is quite a spectacle.

describe: A stack is a pile of different things.
sample: → There was a stack of paperwork on his desk to complete.

describe: If someone is suspicious of someone else, they do not trust that person.
sample: → Dad was suspicious ofthe caller on the line.

describe: Tin is a cheap white metal.
sample: → Soup is a common food that is often sold in tin cans.

describe: A vase is an attractive container where people keep flowers.
sample: → The vase was filled with such lovely flowers.

describe: If something aches, it hurts.
sample: → Mindy’s head ached because she bumped it against the wall.

describe: If something is arctic, it is from far north near the North Pole.
sample: → It is cold when the arctic winds blow.

describe: A canal is a path for water to travel through.
sample: → The city of Venice, Italy, has many canals.

describe: A chemist is a scientist who works with chemicals.
sample: → My mother is a successful chemist who helps invent new products.

describe: A chill is a feeling of cold.
sample: → The chill from the cold wind made Bill shiver.

describe: Congress is a group of leaders in a government.
sample: → Congress makes laws for people to follow.

describe: If something is dairy, it is made from milk.
sample: → Things like milk and cheese are dairy foods.

describe: To descend is to go downward.
sample: → I descended the stairs to get out of the building.

describe: A grocer is a person who sells food.
sample: → Our grocer, Mr. Smith, is a very kind man.

describe: To hesitate is to wait for a short time before doing something.
sample: → He hesitated for a moment before he decided which choice to make.

describe: An institution is an organization that works to help a city or group of people.
sample: → Banks are vital institutions that businesses and people use every day.

describe: To jog is to run slowly.
sample: → He jogs every day so he can be healthier.

describe: A merchant is a person who sells things.
sample: → The merchant was selling used cars.

describe: To poke something is to push it with your finger.
sample: → I poked my finger on a thumb tack.

describe: To postpone something is to make it happen later than planned.
sample: → They postponed the meeting until Elena arrived.

describe: When a liquid splashes, it bursts and hits something.
sample: → Some green paint splashed upon the floor.

describe: If people are stubborn, they don’t change their minds easily.
sample: → Both of my parents are stubborn. They never give in to each other.

describe: A suburb is a small part of a large city.
sample: → I grew up in the suburbs only a few minutes outside of the city.

describe: The tide is the level of the water in the sea.
sample: → The tide continued to crawl upon the beach little by little.

describe: A tragedy is a very sad event.
sample: → It was a tragedy when his house was struck by lightning and burned.

describe: A bomb is an object that explodes and destroys large areas.
sample: → The bomb will destroy anything that is near.

describe: A certificate is a document that says that something is true or happened.
sample: → I was given a certificate after completing the computer course.

describe: A circumstance is an event that makes a situation what it is.
sample: → There were many circumstances behind their success like hard work.

describe: A coffin is a box used to bury dead people.
sample: → When a person passes away, they are usually buried inside of a coffin.

describe: To cope with a difficult or stressful situation means to deal with it.
sample: → He copes with work stress by exercising three or four times a week.

describe: Criticism is the act of saying that you don’t like or approve of something.
sample: → She had a lot of criticism about their new plan.

describe: To devastate something means to completely destroy it.
sample: → The entire wall was devastated.

describe: To frown is to make an unhappy look with your face.
sample: → Melissa frowned when she found out that the party had been cancelled.

describe: To gaze at something means to look at it for a long time.
sample: → We used a telescope to gaze at the stars for over an hour.

describe: To glance at something means to look at it quickly.
sample: → She glanced behind her to see if he was looking at her.

describe: Grief is the feeling of deep sadness, usually when a person dies.
sample: → The grief caused by losing her parents was very difficult for her.

describe: A groom is a man who is going to be married.
sample: → The groom looked happy as he walked with his new wife.

describe: A license is an official document that gives one permission to do something.
sample: → In the United States you need a driver’s license to drive legally.

describe: A microscope is a device that makes small objects look bigger.
sample: → Germs cannot be seen without a microscope.

describe: When something is nuclear, it relates to the division or joining of atoms.

describe: To portray something means to describe it or show it in a picture.
sample: → Her picture portrayed the house she grew up in when she was little.

describe: To rotate something means to turn it around in a circle.
