describe: A pesticide is a substance used to kill insects.
sample: → The farmer sprayed his crops with a pesticide to keep bugs away.

describe: To regulate something is to control how it happens.
sample: → The bank regulates how much money people can borrow from it.

describe: To reinforce something is to make it stronger.
sample: → Peter reinforced his opinion with information from a book.

describe: If one is stricken by a disease or problem, they are badly affected by it.
sample: → Mike was stricken with a horrible illness.

describe: If something is vast, it is very large.
sample: → The wealthy man bought a vast amount of land in the countryside.

describe: A vegetarian is someone who does not eat any meat products.
sample: → I became a vegetarian because I don’t like the taste of meat.

describe: To cherish something means to hold it as very important.
sample: → I cherish this trophy I won.

describe: Compassion is a feeling of understanding for someone who is hurt or suffering.
sample: → The veterinarian had compassion for the sick little puppy.

describe: Consent is permission to do something.
sample: → Their mother gave the children consent to go outside and play.

describe: The core is the center of something.
sample: → The rings of a tree start forming at its core.

describe: If someone is cunning, they are good at tricking people.
sample: → The cunning child fooled his parents into thinking that he was kind.

describe: If someone is dizzy, then they feel off balance as if they will fall down.
sample: → The pregnant woman was dizzy after standing up too quickly.

describe: Equilibrium is the balance between different forces.
sample: → The sudden drop in prices upset the equilibrium of the economy.

describe: To foster a feeling or a skill means to help it develop.
sample: → She helped foster a sense of calm in the little boy.

describe: To grind something means to break it into very small pieces or powder.
sample: → She wanted to grind the beans, so she could brew some coffee.

describe: To growl means to make a deep, angry sound.
sample: →  The dog started to growl at the man walking by.

describe: Moderation is a state of being just enough but not too much.
sample: → It is important to eat in moderation so that you can have a healthy body.

describe: A predator is an animal that kills and eats other animals.
sample: → The peregrine falcon is a predator that eats fish.

describe: If someone is sane, they can think in a normal way.
sample: → Oliver does not act like a sane person when he is angry.

describe: A saucer is a small round dish that you set a cup on.
sample: → He placed the spoon on the saucer.

describe: To snatch something means to take it away with a quick motion.
sample: → He was so hungry that he snatched an apple from a tree.

describe: To stagger means to move in an unsteady way and almost fall over.
sample: → He staggered around after having too much to drink.

describe: To stumble means to put your foot down wrong so that you almost fall.
sample: → He stumbled as he ran through the puddle.

describe: If someone is tense, they are worried something bad might happen.
sample: → After the phone call, Monica was very tense.

describe: To tumble means to fall, often in a rolling way.
sample: → He lost his balance while snowboarding and tumbled to the ground.

describe: To withhold something is to not give it to someone.
sample: → They withheld all information until she paid her fine.

describe: An aircraft is a vehicle that flies in the sky, such as an airplane or helicopter.
sample: → At the museum in the airport, you can see a lot of old aircraft.

describe: A celebrity is someone who is famous.
sample: → It was the highlight of the evening when the celebrities arrived.

describe: Concrete is a substance made from stones.
sample: → The man covered the ground with concrete.

describe: If someone is decisive, they make decisions quickly.
sample: → Our boss is very decisive, so it did not take long to organize the project.

describe: If someone is esteemed, many people like or respect them.
sample: → An esteemed scientist is coming to the university to talk about her discoveries.

describe: If something is ethical, it is the right thing to do.
sample: → Many people believe that it is ethical to help others in need.

describe: If plants or animals are extinct, there are none left.
sample: → There used to be dinosaurs all over the world, but now they are extinct.

describe: If a person or plant is hardy, it is strong and can live though difficult conditions.
sample: → The farmer is a hardy man and doesn’t mind working outside.

describe: An institute is an organization that is interested in research or teaching.
sample: → I am going to a lecture about ancient Rome at the Historical Institute.

describe: Jealousy is a feeling of wanting something that somebody else has.
sample: → She felt a lot of jealousy when she saw Luke with two girls.

describe: To migrate means to move from one place to another.
sample: → Many birds migrate to warmer countries in the winter.

describe: To nurture something means to care for it as it grows or develops.
sample: → Robert nurtured his plants, and that is why they grow so well.

describe: If something is overhead, it is located above you.
sample: → As we sat on top of the hill, a plane flew overhead.

describe: A principle is a belief about the correct way to behave.
sample: → To maintain principles, it’s vital to watch, listen, and speak carefully.

describe: If a place is rural, it is in the countryside instead of the city.
sample: → I want to live in a small house in a rural area.

describe: If a place is secluded, it is far away from any other place.
sample: → There was a secluded bench in the park.

describe: A species is a type of plant or animal.
sample: → There are 21 different species of butterfly in this forest.

describe: A swamp is a very wet area of land.
sample: → There are lots of wild animals living in the swamp.

describe: To traverse means to move or travel through an area.
sample: → The explorer traversed the desert alone on a camel.

describe: Zoology is a subject in which people study animals.
sample: → Helen wants to study zoology because she has always liked animals.

describe: An assumption is something that you believe is true but cannot prove.
sample: → I went to the cafeteria on the assumption that everyone would be there.

describe: Barley is a grain that is used for animal feed, health food and beer.
sample: → The farmer grew barley to feed his cows in the winter.

describe: A beast is a large, dangerous animal.
sample: → A lion is one of the fiercest beasts on Earth.

describe: A colonel is a military officer.
sample: → James has been given a promotion in the army. He is now a colonel.

describe: If a disease is contagious, it is easily carried from one person to another.
sample: → You must wear protective clothing because the patient’s illness is contagious.

describe: A corpse is a dead body of a human.
sample: → After the accident, the corpse was taken to the hospital.

describe: A crisis is a situation that is extremely stressful or dangerous.
sample: → The airport workers’ strike led to a crisis at the airport.

describe: To cure means to cause an illness or injury to end or disappear.
sample: → My dentist cured me of my toothache.

describe: If something is deformed, it is not shaped normally and may appear ugly.
sample: → Even though the carrot was deformed, it was still safe to eat.

describe: To discriminate means to judge people according to their looks.
sample: → They discriminated against her because she was different.

describe: An embassy is where government officials work in a foreign country.
sample: → If you lose your passport, you should contact the embassy.

describe: To extinguish a fire means to make it stop.
sample: → Michael extinguished the small fire with the hose.

describe: Flint is a hard stone that people used to make weapons for hunting.
sample: → There are a lot of flint tools in the museum.

describe: To harass someone means to annoy or trouble them.
sample: → The children harassed their mother because they wanted her attention.

describe: To integrate means to join, communicate and socialize.
sample: → Governments want immigrants to integrate with the population.

describe: If something is miniature, it is very small.
sample: → The boy enjoys playing with his miniature train set in his bedroom.

describe: Nutrition is the process by which people use food to stay healthy.
sample: → It is important to pay attention to nutrition if you want to be an athlete.

describe: If something happens promptly, it happens quickly or on time.
sample: → Arrive promptly, or we won’t have time to discuss everything.

describe: A technician is a person who is skilled in electronic or mechanical work.
sample: → I need to call the technician to help me with my computer.

describe: The tropics are the areas of land and sea close to the equator.
sample: → People like to go to the tropics for vacation because it’s warm.

describe: If something is beneficial, it is good for you.
sample: → Drinking milk everyday is beneficial to your bones.

describe: A birthplace is a place where a person is born or where something started.
sample: → China is the birthplace of chopsticks.

describe: The capacity of something is the amount of things that can be put in it.
sample: → The parking lot has reached its full capacity.

describe: If something is comparative, it is being judged based on something else.
sample: → The money that John has is comparative to most other adults.

describe: If something is comprehensive, it has all the details about something else.
sample: → The teacher gave us a comprehensive review for the exam.

describe: To conserve something is to protect it from being ruined or used completely.
sample: → The group worked to conserve the beauty of Europe’s national parks.

describe: If something is crucial, it is extremely important to another thing.
sample: → Clean air is crucial to the survival of humans, plants, and animals.

describe: Cumulative describes an increase by adding one after another.
sample: → The cumulative snowfall in the area is 50 centimeters per year.

describe: To deposit something is to put it into a place or another thing.
sample: → I deposited the money into my bank account.

describe: To distribute something is to give it to a number of people.
sample: → The teacher distributed crayons and markers to his students.

describe: The equator is an imaginary line that splits the Earth into north and south.
sample: → The equator crosses the northern part of South America.

describe: Exotic describes something unusual because it is from far away.
sample: → Rebecca tried many exotic foods on her trip to Africa.

describe: If something is federal, it comes from the government of a country.
sample: → Sometimes federal laws are different from state laws.

describe: A formation is the way that something is made.
sample: → The formation of ice happens when water freezes.

describe: The frequency of something is the number of times that it happens.
sample: → The frequency of rainstorms is very high, especially during the spring.

describe: An objective is a goal or plan that someone has.
sample: → My objective this week is to finish my homework by 7:30 every night.

describe: Oxygen is a gas that all living things need to breathe.
sample: → My aunt believes that the oxygen in the country is cleaner than in the city.

describe: A rainforest is a forest that is in a place where it rains very often.
sample: → The rainforest is home to many animals.

describe: A strategy is a plan for how to do something.
sample: → The team came up with a strategy to win the game.

describe: If an area is wooded, it is covered with trees.
sample: → Jim and Ben decided to go hiking in the wooded area by the river.

describe: Avail is help. It is often used in the achievement of a goal.
sample: → His studying was to no avail because he failed the test.

describe: To expand is to become bigger in size.
sample: → A balloon will expand as you blow air into it.

describe: To define means to clearly state, show, or explain what something is.
sample: → People define success in many different ways.

describe: To dread is to be afraid of something that could, or is going to, happen.
sample: → I dread the idea that I will not get into college.

describe: If something is fundamental, it is a basic part of something.
sample: → The fundamental rules of basketball are easy.

describe: If something is horrifying, it is frightening and very unpleasant.
sample: → There was a horrifying car accident today.

describe: If someone is incredulous about something, they do not believe that it is true.
sample: → She was incredulous that monkeys could ever drive a car.

describe: To linger is to last for a long time.
sample: → The smell of fresh cookies lingered in the bakery.

describe: An organism is a living thing, especially a very small one.
sample: → We studied the organism on the microscope.

describe: To paraphrase is to make someone else’s writing or speech shorter.
sample: → The students were asked to paraphrase the story they just heard.

describe: A plague is a serious disease that quickly spreads to many people.
sample: → A plague in Europe killed millions of people.

describe: If something happens presently, it is happening right now.
sample: → Presently, our profits are good, but by next year we can do even better.

describe: If something is random, it happens without any pattern or reason.
sample: → Young children often ask random questions.

describe: A riot is a crowd that reacts to bad news by violently breaking laws.
sample: → A riot broke out after the candidate lost the election.

describe: To scribble is to write something quickly without caring about how it looks.
sample: → I scribbled a rough diagram of our plan and gave it to him.

describe: A shrine is a religious building built to honor a person, event, or god.
sample: → He prayed at the shrine for an hour.

describe: Solitude is the state of being totally alone.
sample: → John lives a life of solitude because he doesn’t get along well with people.

describe: If a contrast is stark, then the things being compared are utterly different.
sample: → There is a stark contrast between their test scores.

describe: To summon a person is to ask them to come to you.
sample: → We summoned the doctor as soon as we noticed she was sick.

describe: To worsen is to get worse.
sample: → The weather suddenly worsened, and we had to stay inside.

describe: An automobile is a car.
sample: → The first automobiles were very different from the ones that exist today.

describe: A candidate is a person who is competing to win something such as a job.
sample: → Alice is the best candidate for the job.

describe: If something is confidential, it must be kept secret.
sample: → The information from the meeting is confidential.

describe: If something is corporate, it is related to a large business.
sample: → Tom enjoys working in the corporate world.

describe: To enhance something is to make it better.
sample: → Amy’s blue shirt really enhances the color of her eyes.

describe: An era is a period of time that has something special about it.
sample: → During the medieval era, knights wore protective armor.

describe: A guideline is a rule about how to do something.
sample: → Before they began the project, the teacher gave them some guidelines.

describe: To incorporate is to add something to another thing.
sample: → I decided to incorporate a new ingredient into my cake recipe.

describe: To interact is to talk to or do something with another person.
sample: → The kids began to interact when the adults left the room.

describe: An interval is the time between two things happening.
sample: → Tony rested for brief intervals while he worked in the yard.

describe: If something is mobile, it can be moved easily.
sample: → Mobile phones are popular because you can take them anywhere.

describe: To modify something is to change it a little bit.
sample: → I modified my outfit by adding a belt to it.

describe: If two things are parallel, they are the same distance away from each other.
sample: → There are two yellow parallel lines dividing both sides of traffic.

describe: A phenomenon is something that can be seen as it is happening.
sample: → I was amazed when I saw the phenomenon of shooting stars.

describe: To pollute means to make air, water, or land dirty, unclean, or foul.
sample: → The careless factory polluted the river with chemicals.

describe: To ridicule is to make fun of something in a mean way.
sample: → The other students ridicule Peter’s foreign accent.

describe: If something is solar, it is related to the sun.
sample: → Using solar energy is good for the environment.

describe: A territory is a piece of land that belongs to a country but isn’t a state.
sample: → Gibraltar is a territory of Great Britain.

describe: A tournament is a competition, usually with many people participating.
sample: → My dad is playing in a golf tournament tomorrow.

describe: Transportation is any type of vehicle that can carry people or things.
sample: → I don’t have a car, so my normal transportation is the train.

describe: A bill is a statement of money owed for goods or a service.
sample: → I have so many bills that I do not know how to pay for them all.

describe: A boundary is the line where one area of land stops, and another begins.
sample: → This fence shows the boundary between our yard and yours.

describe: Chaos is a situation that is confusing and not ordered.
sample: → His presentation was in chaos. I couldn’t understand what he meant.

describe: If a person is consistent, they keep the same behavior or attitude.
sample: → Sara comes in every day and is our most consistent worker.

describe: A cyclone is a large storm with heavy rain and winds that spin in a circle.
sample: → Hundreds of homes were damaged by the cyclone.

describe: If someone or something is doomed, they are going to fail or be destroyed.
sample: → Since I spent all my money, my date with Jane is doomed.

describe: An heir is a person who receives money or property of someone who dies.
sample: → The princess was the heir to the king and queen’s throne.

describe: If something is martial, it is related to fighting or war.
sample: → Karate is a martial art that began many years ago in Japan.

describe: If food is organic, it is grown without adding chemicals to it.
sample: → The organic carrots are more expensive, but they’re better for you.

describe: Poultry is a bird, such as a chicken, that is used for meat and eggs.
sample: → He raises poultry and sells their meat for extra money.

describe: To scramble is to move somewhere quickly and desperately.
sample: → The hikers scrambled down the side of the hill.

describe: A sergeant is a soldier or police officer of middle rank.
sample: → He was promoted to sergeant after a year in the army.

describe: If you describe something as sheer, it is complete and very strong.
sample: → I was impressed by her sheer dedication to jogging.

describe: A stance is an attitude about an issue that someone states clearly.
sample: → My stance is that using oil and gas is bad for the environment.

describe: A telegraph is a method of sending electric messages on wires.
sample: → In the 1900s, the telegraph was the fastest way to send a message.

describe: Textile is cloth that has been woven or knitted.
sample: → The blue textile was going to be used to make blouses.

describe: A tornado is a tube-shaped formation of air that spins very quickly.
sample: → During a tornado, the safest place to be is underground.

describe: A typhoon is a large tropical storm that moves in circles.
sample: → Thousands of people lost electricity after a typhoon hit Australia.

describe: To wail is to show sadness by crying loudly.
sample: → The baby wailed because it was hungry.

describe: A wardrobe is the collection of all of a person’s clothing.
sample: → She bought some new clothes to expand her wardrobe.

describe: To allot something means to give it to someone.
sample: → The coach allotted each team five minutes to prepare a strategy.

describe: To appall means to horrify, shock, or disgust someone.
sample: → The boy was appalled when he saw the accident.

describe: A cache is a hiding place for valuable things.
sample: → The pirates kept their jewelry in a cache hidden in a cave.

describe: Convenience is a state of being able to do something with little effort.
sample: → The Internet allows consumers to shop at their own convenience.

describe: A dearth is an amount or supply which is not large enough.
sample: → There is a dearth of money in my bank account. I can’t afford a new car.

describe: If a thing you do is deliberate, you intend to do it.
sample: → She made a deliberate effort to save money each month.

describe: When something is dire, it is terrible and very serious.

describe: To elapse means to pass, as in seconds, minutes, or hours.
sample: → A few seconds must elapse before you can take another picture.

describe: Empathy is sharing or understanding another person’s feelings.
sample: → The caring nurse had empathy for her patients.

describe: When something is fanciful, it is unusual or unrealistic.
sample: → The girl had fanciful ideas about doing well in school without studying.

describe: To gripe means to complain constantly.
sample: → Lawrence always gripes when he has to do chores.

describe: When something is grueling, it is very hard to do.
sample: → The climber faced the grueling task of reaching the top of the steep mountain.

describe: When something is mundane, it is boring, common, or ordinary.
sample: → The man had the mundane chore of raking thousands of leaves into piles.

describe: To opt is to make a choice, especially when deciding in favor of something.
sample: → My brother likes chocolate ice cream, but I always opt for vanilla.

describe: Outrage is a very strong emotion of anger or shock.
sample: → Tommy was feeling outrage when his parents said he couldn’t go to the dance.

describe: When an amount of something is paltry, it is very small.
sample: → The poor man had a paltry sum of money.

describe: To rectify something means to correct it.
sample: → I quickly rectified the spelling mistakes that I had on my essay.

describe: When someone is resourceful, they are good at dealing with hard situations.
sample: → After his boat sunk, Matt was resourceful enough to build a raft.

describe: Sustenance is food and water needed to keep a person, animal, or plant alive.
sample: → Without the proper sustenance, the man will starve.

describe: When something is tedious, it is long, frustrating, and boring.
sample: → His job involved a lot of tedious typing, filing, and organizing.

describe: An abbey is a house or group of houses where monks or nuns live.
sample: → When the monk returned to the abbey, he went immediately to his bedroom.

describe: If something is abundant, then it is available in large quantities.
sample: → Cakes, cookies, and candy were so abundant that the child was very happy.

describe: To adjoin something means to be next to or attached to something else.
sample: → She can listen to her brother’s conversations because her room adjoins his.

describe: If something is ample, then it is enough or more than enough.
sample: → There was an ample supply of oats to feed the horses.

describe: If a place is arid, then it is hot and dry and gets very little or no rain.
sample: → Not many plants grow in the arid desert.

describe: A cathedral is an important and often large and beautifully built church.
sample: → The large cathedral is full of people on Sunday mornings.

describe: To deprive someone of something means to not let them have it.
sample: → Because the child was bad, she was deprived of her dessert after dinner.

describe: A drought is a long period of time in which little or no rain falls.
sample: → After three months of drought, the vegetation and trees started dying.

describe: If someone is eligible, then they are permitted to do or have something.
sample: → Only people who bought tickets were eligible to win a prize.

describe: To fast means to go without food or drink for a period of time.
sample: → In her religion, they fast for five days and then have a big feast.

describe: To grumble means to complain.
sample: → He grumbled about having to work late on Friday.

describe: If someone goes inland, they travel into the center of a country or land.
sample: → The river curved inland near the campground.

describe: Moisture is small drops of water in the air or on a surface.
sample: → If you breathe on a window, moisture from your breath collects on the glass.

describe: If something happens nonetheless, then it occurs despite some other thing.
sample: → She tried to keep the dog out of the mud, but it got dirty nonetheless.

describe: An oath is a formal, often public, promise.
sample: → Judges must take an oath to be fair to everyone in court.

describe: A prairie is a large flat area of grassland.
sample: → The prairie was perfect for a farm because there were hills and trees.

describe: If something is ragged, then it is old, torn, and falling apart.
sample: → They could see his toes through the holes in his ragged shoes.

describe: If an area of land is rugged, then it is rocky and difficult to travel through.
sample: → Their car couldn’t make it far along the rugged roads.

describe: If something is scarce, then it is in a very small amount.
sample: → When gasoline was scarce, we rode our bikes, instead of driving, to school.

describe: To speculate means to guess about something.
sample: → My sister looked at the sky and speculated that it would rain tomorrow.

describe: If something is analytic, it is related to logic and reasoning.
sample: → The analytic article criticized the new plan and presented one of its own.

describe: To assert a fact or belief means to state it with confidence.
sample: → He asserted that his mother’s cooking was better than his best friend’s.

describe: A bachelor is an unmarried man.
sample: → Since he was a bachelor, Jason did his shopping by himself.

describe: Calculus is an advanced type of mathematics.
sample: → By using calculus, scientists determined small changes in the stars’ brightness.

describe: If something is celestial, it is related to the sky or to outer space.
sample: → Comets are celestial objects that are rarely seen.

describe: If something is cognitive, it is related to learning and knowing things.
sample: → After her physical examination, her cognitive strengths were tested.

describe: A collision is the act of two things hitting into each another.
sample: → The collision between the two cars created a loud noise.

describe: If someone is competent, they are able to think or act successfully.
sample: → Competent employees are much better than unknowledgeable ones.

describe: A diploma is a certificate proving that someone has completed their studies.
sample: → After four years of college, Mary finally had a diploma.

describe: To excel at a subject or activity means to be very good at it.
sample: → Jenny excels at playing the piano.

describe: Geology is the study of the Earth’s natural structures and how they change.
sample: → Because he studied geology, he knew how the mountains were formed.

describe: To harness something means to control and use it, usually to make energy.
sample: → The sails harness the wind in order to move.

describe: An intellect is a person’s ability to understand things easily.
sample: → She was known for her quick and strong intellect as well as her beauty.

describe: If someone is keen, they are intelligent.
sample: → Only the keenest of students could have solved that math problem.

describe: Mythology is a group of stories from a particular country or region.
sample: → Egyptian mythology was the basis for a religion.

describe: Physiology is the study of the various parts of living things.
sample: → His work in physiology helped him understand how the human body works.

describe: If something is radioactive, then it lets out, or is related to, radiation.
sample: → Radioactive materials can be very bad for anyone’s health.

describe: Relativity is a set of ideas about time and space developed by Albert Einstein.
sample: → Relativity teaches that light travels at the same speed in the universe.

describe: Sociology is the study of human society, its organizations, and problems.
sample: → Sociology teaches that people’s problems are a result of their society.

describe: If something is theoretical, it is based on theory rather than experience.
sample: → His conclusion was only theoretical and not meant to be publicized.

describe: An administrator is a person who controls a business, company, or organization.
sample: → Everyone in the store did whatever the administrator asked them to do.

describe: If someone is affluent, they are wealthy.
sample: → People in the city are usually more affluent than people in the country.

describe: To audit means to inspect financial records from a person or business.
sample: → The government usually audits companies that report lower than usual incomes.

describe: To automate a company means to install machines or computers to do the work.
sample: → When the bank automated, it started installing ATM machines.

describe: To bribe someone means to illegally persuade them for a favor with money.
sample: → The judge was bribed so that she would set the suspect free.

describe: If someone is corrupt, they break the law for money or fame.
sample: → The corrupt policemen didn’t arrest the man because he gave them money.

describe: To dispose of something means to get rid of it.
sample: → He disposed of the can by throwing it into the recycle bin.

describe: A headquarters is a building where the bosses of a company work.
sample: → He drove the long route to headquarters because it was a nice day.

describe: An incentive is what makes a person want to do something.
sample: → The chance of winning a prize was incentive to get people to play the game.

describe: An infrastructure is a collection of services needed to run a society or business.
sample: → Power lines are important parts of a city’s infrastructure.

describe: To legislate means to make laws.
sample: → Senators have to legislate fairly, so most people will enjoy the benefits.

describe: If something is legitimate, then it is acceptable according to the law.
sample: → She found a legitimate plan to raise extra funds for her vacation.

describe: To manipulate something means to skillfully or unfairly control or affect it.
sample: → The Dr. manipulated the data to make it look like the cure was working.

describe: Merchandise is goods ready to be purchased or sold.
sample: → The store added more merchandise because there were more shoppers.

describe: Retail is the activity of selling goods to the public, often for personal use.
sample: → Though cheap to make, once a t-shirt reaches retail, it costs ten times as much.

describe: Revenue is the income made by a company.
sample: → The new products really increased the business’s monthly revenue.

describe: Rubbish is trash or waste.
sample: → The floor around the garbage can was covered with all kinds of rubbish.

describe: A subsidy is money given by the government to companies to assist them.
sample: → The official gave the company a subsidy, so it could open two new factories.

describe: A transaction is an act of buying or selling something.
sample: → Because the clerk was new at the job, the simple transaction took a long time.

describe: To violate a law, rule, or agreement means to break it.
sample: → I was given a ticket because the policeman said I violated the speed limit.

describe: To assess something means to judge the structure, purpose, or quality of it.
sample: → She assessed the condition of the toy car before buying it.

describe: To astonish someone means to greatly surprise them.
sample: → The amount of people that came to her party astonished her.

describe: To commence something means to begin it.
sample: → His speech commenced with a “thankyou” to all who had helped him succeed.

describe: The essence of something is its important qualities or basic characteristics.
sample: → The essence of the argument was that both sides felt they had lost money.

describe: To extract something means to remove it.
sample: → The dentist extracted the woman’s damaged tooth and put in a fake one.

describe: If something is fabulous, it is extremely good.
sample: → This strawberry is the best I’ve ever had. It’s fabulous.

describe: Haste is speed in movement or action.
sample: → In order to get to the meeting in time, he proceeds with haste.

describe: An impulse is a sudden thoughtless urge to do something.
sample: → Because of the scary noise, she had an impulse to run somewhere and hide.

describe: Latter describes something last in a series or the second choice of two things.
sample: → In the latter minutes of the game, the visitors scored the winning goal.

describe: A molecule is the smallest basic unit that makes up a physical substance.
sample: → A tiny drop of water is made up of thousands of molecules of water.

describe: If something is ongoing, then it is still happening or still growing.
sample: → The development of plants is ongoing because it takes time for them to mature.

describe: If something is pharmaceutical, then it is related to the development of drugs.
sample: → Pharmaceutical companies discover new cures to illnesses all the time.

describe: If someone is precise, then they are exact and careful about their work.
sample: → The builder was very precise about where he placed the nails.

describe: Proximity is closeness in time, space, or relationships.
sample: → All the trees in the proximity of the beach had been cut down.

describe: Publicity is public attention given to someone or something by the media.
sample: → She received a lot of publicity after her performance in the film.

describe: A remedy is a cure for a disease, argument, or problem.
sample: → A good remedy for a headache is an aspirin and a glass of water.

describe: The significance of something is the quality that makes it important.
sample: → The significance of the snowy weather was that we didn’t have to go to school.

describe: If something is subsequent, then it comes after something else in time.
sample: → The flood and the subsequent rescue of those caught in the flood were on TV.

describe: If something is synthetic, then it is made to be like something natural.
sample: → Clothing made out of synthetic fabrics is very effective at keeping people warm.

describe: If something is terminal, then it causes or results in death.
sample: → Since his condition was not terminal, he felt a great sense of relief.

describe: The altitude of a place is its height above sea level.
sample: → The air was thin at such a high altitude on the mountain.

describe: A coastline is the outline of a country’s coast.
sample: → He noticed that most of the cities in Australia are on the coastline.

describe: To deter means to prevent or discourage someone from doing something.
sample: → Icy roads deter people from driving their cars.

describe: To devise something means to have an idea or plan about it in the mind.
sample: → The thieves devised a plan to steal the diamonds.

describe: Expertise is the knowledge and skills to do something well.
sample: → John has a lot of advertising expertise. He can sell anything!

describe: A fracture is a crack or break in something.
sample: → Don’t stand on that teg because there is a fracture. It might get worse.

describe: To impair something means to damage it or make it worse.
sample: → Drinking coffee impairs my ability to go to sleep.

describe: To implement something means to ensure that what has been planned is done.
sample: → The school decided to implement a new teaching strategy.

describe: If something is indigenous, it is originally from, or native to, a place.
sample: → Tomatoes are indigenous to the Americas.

describe: Insight is a deep and accurate understanding of something.
sample: → The physics textbook gave the student new insight about gravity.

describe: A limb is a large branch on a tree.
sample: → The monkey sat on the tree limb and enjoyed a piece of fruit.

describe: A migraine is a painful headache that makes one feel sick.
sample: → My sister gets a migraine every time she has a lot of stress.

describe: Optimism is the feeling of being hopeful about the future or success of something.
sample: → The mother had optimism about her children’s futures.

describe: When something is peculiar, it is strange, sometimes in a bad way.
sample: → That peculiar smell coming from the kitchen reminds me of rotten eggs.

describe: When a person is proficient at something, they can do it well.
sample: → Secretaries are proficient at typing quickly.

describe: A quest is a long and difficult search for something.
sample: → The treasure hunter went on a quest to find an ancient gold necklace.

describe: A ridge is a long, narrow piece of raised land.
sample: → The brown bear walked along the edge of the mountain ridge.

describe: A spouse is the person to whom someone is married.
sample: → I live in a home with my spouse and our two children.

describe: To thrust means to push or move something quickly with a lot of force.
sample: → The boxer thrust his fist into the punching bag.

describe: To tolerate something means to be able to accept it even when it is unpleasant.
sample: → When you are in a hurry, it can be hard to tolerate traffic signals.

describe: If a plant or animal is aquatic, it lives or grows in water.
sample: → The dolphin is an aquatic mammal.

describe: The biosphere is the earth’s surface and atmosphere where there are living things.
sample: → Birds, trees, and worms all thrive in the biosphere.

describe: When something is bizarre, it is very strange.
sample: → My bizarre dreams make no sense to me when I am awake.

describe: Celsius is a scale for measuring temperature.
sample: → Water freezes at zero degrees Celsius.

describe: If something is coarse, that means it has a rough texture.
sample: → The coarse sweater made my skin itch.

describe: A companion is a person that someone spends a lot of time with.
sample: → I always walk to school with my companion Frank.

describe: To digest means to swallow food and pass it through the body.
sample: → Allow some time for food to be digested before going swimming.

describe: The duration of an event is the time during which it happens.
sample: → The girls watched television for the duration of the evening.

describe: Ecology is the study of the environment and living things.
sample: → We study ecology to learn how to help improve the Earth.

describe: A feat is an impressive or difficult achievement or action.
sample: → The elephant’s standing up on one leg was a feat.

describe: If something is infinite, it has no limit or end.
sample: → Many scientists believe that the universe is infinite.

describe: The nucleus is the central part of an atom or cell.
sample: → The nucleus is made up of many tiny particles.

describe: A parasite is a tiny animal or plant that attaches to another animal to get food.
sample: → The sick dog was covered in parasites.

describe: When something is prominent, it is important and well known.
sample: → Queen Victoria was a prominent person in history.

describe: When something is repetitive, it is repeated many times and becomes boring.
sample: → Working on an assembly line making cars every day is a repetitive job.

describe: If something is reproductive, it has to do with a living thing producing young.
sample: → The reproductive system of a plant is simple.

describe: When a place is temperate, it never gets too hot or cold.
sample: → In Peru, the weather is temperate and rarely gets too hot or cold.

describe: Tolerance is the ability to accept something painful or unpleasant.
sample: → Boxers have a high tolerance for pain.

describe: To undergo an action means to have it happen to you.
sample: → The cancer patient undergoes treatments twice a week. gous

describe: When someone is vulnerable, they are weak and without protection.
sample: → He felt very vulnerable when he was stranded in the desert.

describe: If someone is adept at something, they are very good at doing it.
sample: → The carpenter is very adept at building houses.

describe: If land is barren, it has no plants growing on it.
sample: → People cannot farm in barren lands.

describe: If something is ceramic, it is made of baked clay.
sample: → The house’s roof was made of ceramic tiles.

describe: If something is culinary, it is related to cooking.
sample: → I gained culinary skills after working in a restaurant for many years.

describe: If something is dense, it has a lot of things close together.
sample: → I easily became lost in the dense forest.

describe: Dignity is the ability to be calm and worthy of respect.
sample: → When his company went out of business, he faced it with dignity.

describe: To dominate someone or something is to control them.
sample: → The loud man dominated the conversation.

describe: If something is edible, you can eat it.
sample: → We learn about edible plants when we go camping.

describe: If someone is hostile, they are angry and unfriendly.
sample: → We were happy to move away from our hostile neighbor.

describe: Your intake of food is the amount of food you take into your body.
sample: → The doctor said I needed to increase my intake of fruits and vegetables.

describe: If someone does something likewise, they do the same thing as someone else.
sample: → If Joe is staying away from school to go swimming, I want to do likewise.

describe: Malnutrition is the condition of not getting enough nutrients.
sample: → After eating only a meager amount of food, she suffered from malnutrition.

describe: Medication is medicine or drugs given to people who are sick.
sample: → The doctor gave me medication to treat my illness.

describe: A misconception is a wrong idea about something.
sample: → People once believed the misconception that the Earth is flat.

describe: If something is obscure, it is not well-known.
sample: → The old man travels the world in search of obscure books.

describe: To oppress someone means to rule over them in a cruel and unfair way.
sample: → Free speech had been oppressed in his country.

describe: To peel fruits and vegetables is to remove their skin.
sample: → We peeled the apple before eating it.

describe: A prescription is permission from a doctor to get medicine.
sample: → The doctor gave me a prescription for my medication.

describe: A respirator is a machine that helps weak or sick people breathe.
sample: → The man needed a respirator to breathe.

describe: To strive is to struggle to achieve something.
sample: → People who strive to succeed often do.

describe: If something is archaic, it is very old or outdated.
sample: → To be competitive, we must update our archaic equipment.

describe: If someone is benevolent, they are kind and generous.
sample: → My father was a benevolent man and gave lots of money to charity.

describe: Brass is a metal that is used to make musical instruments and ornaments.
sample: → Brass is used to make musical instruments like trumpets.

describe: Capitalism is an economic system where private companies make goods for profit.
sample: → Most industries in the world today are based on capitalism.

describe: A component is a part of a larger machine.
sample: → Computers have many different components, so they are complicated to build.

describe: Dependence is a situation in which somebody relies on something else.
sample: → Young children have a dependence on their parents.

describe: To diminish means to reduce or get smaller.
sample: → As the economy got worse, my savings diminished.

describe: A drawback is a disadvantage.

describe: A fad is something that is popular for a short time.

describe: To impose means to interrupt or force your ideas on other people.

describe: Managerial describes something related to a manager or management.
sample: → Nancy has a managerial position at the bank.

describe: If something is medieval, it comes from the period between 650 and 1500 CE.
sample: → We visited a castle that was built during medieval times.

describe: If something is obsolete, it is not used anymore because something better exists.
sample: → Since computers became inexpensive, typewriters have become obsolete.

describe: A peninsula is a large piece of land that is surrounded by the sea on three sides.
sample: → The state of Florida is an example of a peninsula.

describe: If a person has prestige, people admire or respect them.
sample: → The young actress gained much prestige after she won an award.

describe: A proportion is an amount that shows the link between the parts and the whole.
sample: → Only a small proportion of the people in this town actually work here.

describe: If something is radical, it is very new or different.
sample: → The president is planning to make some radical changes to the law.

describe: To refute something means to prove that it is false or incorrect.
sample: → The bank manager has refuted the claims that he lied to his customers.

describe: If something is spectacular, it looks or sounds very impressive.
sample: → There was a spectacular fireworks display in the park at New Year.

describe: To weave means to make cloth using horizontal and vertical threads.
sample: → We saw a woman weave a blanket on our vacation to South America.

describe: An accountant is a person whose job is to keep financial accounts.
sample: → The accountant helped me keep track of my money.

describe: A capitalist is a business person who invests in trade and industry for profit.
sample: → The capitalist invested in a factory that made wheat into cereal.

describe: Contempt is the feeling of having no respect for something.

describe: To dedicate oneself to something means to put a lot of time and effort into it.
sample: → The nun dedicated herself to helping people in need.

describe: A ditch is a narrow hole cut into the ground by a road or a field.

describe: An enterprise is a company or business.
sample: → My father owns an advertising enterprise.

describe: When something is exquisite, it is very beautiful or pleasant.
sample: → The artist made exquisite watercolor paintings.

describe: To finance someone or something means to provide money for them.

describe: When someone is indifferent toward something, they have a lack of interest in it.

describe: To irrigate means to supply water to land so that crops can grow.

describe: To maximize something is to make it as great in amount, size, or importance.

describe: When something is monetary, it relates to money.

describe: A precaution is an action that is meant to stop something bad from happening.

describe: To saturate something means to completely soak it with a liquid.

describe: The simplicity of something is the fact that it is easy to do or understand.
sample: → We were able to find the house thanks to the simplicity of the directions.

describe: To sow seeds means to plant them in the ground.
sample: → He always sows his garden seeds in the springtime.

describe: Soy is a food made from soybeans, such as flour or butter.
sample: → Soy can be made into tofu, sauce, and also milk.

describe: A spade is a tool used for digging.
sample: → The gardener used her spade to make a hole for the seed.

describe: When something is upcoming, that means it will happen in the near future.
sample: → The kids were worried about their upcoming exam.

describe: Aggression is behavior that is mean or violent to others.
sample: → The problem was only made worse by Mark’s aggression.

describe: A banquet is a grand formal dinner.
sample: → Both families brought a lot of food for the wedding banquet.

describe: A biography is an account of someone’s life that is written by someone else.
sample: → We read a biography about Charles Darwin in science class.

describe: To boost something means to increase or improve it.

describe: To clap means to hit one’s hands together to express pleasure or get attention.

describe: To compel someone to do something means to force them to do it.

describe: The dominance of a person is their state of being more powerful than others.

sample: → The girl picked out a gorgeous dress to wear to the dance.

describe: When something is inevitable, it is certain to happen or cannot be avoided.
sample: → It is inevitable that the days will get longer in the summer.

describe: A masterpiece is a very good painting, novel, movie, or other work of art.
sample: → The Arc de Triomphe is considered a masterpiece in the world of architecture.

sample: → This story was written by John, but Aaron is narrating it to the crowd.

sample: → Overall, the party was a huge success.

describe: A partiality is a tendency to prefer one thing to another.
sample: → She has a partiality for walking to school instead of driving.

describe: When an act is spontaneous, it is not planned. It happens suddenly.

describe: Anthropology is the study of people, society, and culture.

describe: To applaud means to clap in order to show approval.

describe: A brook is a small stream.

describe: To revere something is to admire it greatly.

describe: When something is elaborate, it contains a lot of details.

describe: To facilitate something is to make it easier.

describe: A grid is a pattern of squares with numbers and letters to find places on a map.

describe: Marble is a type of rock that feels cold and is smooth when cut.

describe: A mast is a long pole on a ship that holds the sail.
sample: → The mast held both sails of the ship upright.

describe: Nausea is the feeling of being sick to your stomach.
sample: → The doctor said the medicine would help get rid of her nausea.

sample: → The country sent all of its naval forces to protect them.

describe: A pouch is a small, flexible bag that is usually made of cloth.
sample: → I keep my money in a small pouch.

describe: If something is saturated, it is completely wet.
sample: → Leigh’s hair became saturated in the rain storm.

describe: An update is an act of making something more modern.
sample: → I’m doing an update on my personal phone directory.

describe: An addict is a person who cannot stop doing or having something.

describe: When something is archeological, it relates to archeology.

describe: Archeology is the study of ancient people through their artifacts.

describe: To brainstorm is to have a lot of ideas about a certain topic.

describe: A budget is the amount of money available to spend on something.

describe: When something is chaotic, it is crazy, confused, and hectic.

describe: To cite something is to mention it as an example or as proof of something.

describe: To correspond is to match or to be similar to something.

describe: A courtyard is an outdoor area that is surrounded by the walls of a building.
sample: → During the summer, the courtyard is a nice place to have lunch.

describe: An estate is a large area of land owned by a family or organization.
sample: → He lived on his father’s estate in the country.

describe: Fraud is the crime of gaining money by lying or by tricking people.

describe: Hydrogen is a gas that has no taste, color, or smell.
sample: → Balloons filled with hydrogen can easily float away if you aren’t careful.

describe: Integrity is honesty and good morals.
sample: → The principal had a lot of integrity.

describe: To knit is to make fabric by connecting strings together.

describe: An outlook is a person’s opinion or way of thinking about something.

describe: A parachute is a device that helps people and things fall to the ground safely.

describe: When something is prehistoric, it is from a time when there was no written history.

describe: A proponent is a person who supports an idea or a plan.

describe: To refine something is to make it better by making changes.

describe: To restrict is to limit something and prevent it from getting bigger.

describe: An attorney is one who gives others advice about the law.

describe: When something is chronic, it happens over and over again over time.

describe: A donor is somebody who gives something to an organization.

describe: A fellow is someone who shares a job or quality with someone else.

describe: Gossip is information that might be untrue but is still discussed anyway.
