describe: To graduate from a school means to complete and pass all courses of study there.
sample: → At the end of the spring, my friends and I will graduate from high school.

describe: Graffiti is words or drawings in public places.
sample: → The wall was covered with colorful graffiti.

describe: A guardian is someone who protects somebody or something.
sample: → The librarians are the guardians of the books.

describe: To implicate someone is to show that they have done a crime or something bad.
sample: → The man was implicated in the theft at the store.

describe: Kin is a person’s family and relatives.
sample: → His kin were all farmers.

describe: A referee is a person who makes sure that the rules are followed in sports.
sample: → The soccer player didn’t agree with the referee.

describe: To sever something is to cut through it completely.
sample: → He severed the string using scissors.

describe: A shaft is a handle of a tool or weapon.
sample: → The golf club had a long wooden shaft that he held in his hands.

describe: To stab means to cut someone or something with a sharp object like a knife.
sample: → He stabbed the fork into the potato and passed it to his daughter.

describe: A stimulus is something that causes growth or activity.
sample: → Having a lot of money is a stimulus for people to buy more things.

describe: A suspicion is a feeling that something is possible or true in a crime.
sample: → The police had a suspicion that the driver had stolen the purse.

describe: To terminate something means to stop or end it.
sample: → The trip was terminated after the car broke down.

describe: A theme is the main subject of a book, movie, or painting.
sample: → The students discussed the book’s theme in class.

describe: Tuition is the amount of money paid to go to a school.
sample: → University tuitions have increased by fifty percent in the last five years.

describe: If someone is aggressive, then they constantly want to fight.
sample: → Nobody liked to play games with him because he was always too aggressive.

describe: Amnesty is a pardon given to prisoners of war.
sample: → She was denied amnesty for her involvement in the war.

describe: An arena is a building where people can watch sports and concerts.
sample: → The new arena was all set to hold the championship match.

describe: An auditorium is a large building used for public events.
sample: → People have gathered at the school auditorium to watch the play.

describe: A captive is a prisoner.
sample: → The guards told the captive that there was no way he could escape the prison.

describe: Combat is fighting between two people or groups.
sample: → The two warriors were locked in combat.

describe: If something is commonplace, then it is ordinary.
sample: → There is nothing commonplace about the way Morris dresses.

describe: A compound is an enclosed area such as a prison or factory.
sample: → The workers waited outside the compound for the gates to the factory to open.

describe: A corps is a division of a military force.
sample: → The army had a corps of archers who trained apart from the regular soldiers.

describe: To distract someone means to stop them from concentrating on something.
sample: → The phone call distracted him so much that he forgot all about his homework.

describe: If someone is dumb, they are unable to speak.
sample: → She did not share the secret. She remained silent as if she were dumb.

describe: A foe is an enemy or opponent.
sample: → It was hard to believe that anyone could be his foe.

describe: To hack something means to cut it into uneven pieces.
sample: → My uncle used the ax to hack the tree into many logs.

describe: To meditate means to focus or think deeply in silence.
sample: → She liked to meditate for several hours of each day.

describe: To nick someone means to cut them slightly with a sharp object.
sample: → While cutting the carrots, the cook nicked his finger with the edge of his knife.

describe: To provoke someone means to annoy them on purpose to cause violence.
sample: → The older boy provoked Paul by calling him mean names.

describe: A realm is any area of activity or interest.
sample: → He was not very active in the realm of business.

describe: A reign is the period of time in which a ruler rules.
sample: → The emperor’s reign lasted for only two years.

describe: Rust is a red and brown coating on iron objects caused by water and air.
sample: → The old metal gate would not swing because the hinges were covered in rust.

describe: If something is sacred, then it is worshipped and respected.
sample: → One religion in India will not harm cows because it believes that they are sacred.

describe: If someone acts accordingly, they act in a way that is suitable.
sample: → He feels like he did a good job, and his boss should pay him accordingly.

describe: An anchor is a heavy object dropped from a boat to make it stay in one place.
sample: → When the ship reached its destination, the crew dropped the anchor.

describe: A buoy is a floating sign that warns boats of dangerous areas.
sample: → Don’t steer the boat near those buoys. There are rocks underneath the water.

describe: A catastrophe is an unexpected event that causes great suffering or damage.
sample: → It was a catastrophe for my family when my dad lost his job.

describe: Context is the situations that form the background of an event.
sample: → They studied the context of the battle before giving their presentation.

describe: To designate someone or something means to give them a particular description.
sample: → The famous lighthouse was designated a historical monument.

describe: To distort something means to lie about it.
sample: → His lawyer distorted the facts so that he would be set free.

describe: A dock is an enclosed area where ships go to be loaded, unloaded, and repaired.
sample: → The huge ship pulled into the dock, and the crew unloaded the cargo.

describe: The fore of something is the front part of it.
sample: → The teacher’s desk is at the fore of the classroom.

describe: If something is frequent, then it happens or is done often.
sample: → While Dad was sick, the doctor made frequent visits to his house.

describe: When something is genuine, it is true or real.
sample: → After the painting was determined to be genuine, it sold for a million dollars.

describe: Grease is an oily substance put on moving parts, so they work smoothly.
sample: → When I was done working on the car, I had grease all over my hands.

describe: When something is intricate, it has many small parts or details.
sample: → The intricate painting on the quilt was very lovely.

describe: To offset means to use one thing to cancel out the effect of another thing.
sample: → Increased wages are offset by higher prices for goods.

describe: To overlap something means to cover a piece of it.
sample: → The gift on top overlaps the other gift on the bottom.

describe: To precipitate an event means to cause it to happen sooner than normal.
sample: → The violent attack precipitated an all-out war.

describe: When something is secondhand, it has been owned by someone else.
sample: → Her secondhand jeans were a bit faded in the front.

describe: A slot is a narrow opening in a machine or container.
sample: → To operate the machine, put your coins into the slot.

describe: To submerge something means to put it below the surface of a liquid.
sample: → The whale submerged its huge body into the ocean.

describe: A tactic is a careful plan to achieve something.
sample: → Sam thought of a good tactic in order to attract more business.

describe: When a number is aggregate, it is made up of smaller amounts added together.
sample: → The company totaled its aggregate sales for the entire year.

describe: An antibiotic is a medical drug used to kill bacteria and treat infections.
sample: → The doctor gave me a shot of an antibiotic when I got the flu.

describe: A circuit is a piece of an electronic device that allows electricity to flow.
sample: → Be very careful not to shock yourself when fixing an electrical circuit.

describe: To complement something or someone is to make them better.
sample: → The wool scarf complemented her lovely eyes.

describe: To compress something means to press or squeeze it so that it takes up less space.
sample: → I compressed my clothes to fit into a single suitcase.

describe: A database is a collection of data that is stored in a computer.
sample: → The company has a database of all the names and accounts of their customers.

describe: An equivalent is an amount or value that is the same as another amount or value.
sample: → I worked the equivalent of sixty hours this week.

describe: When someone is immune to a disease, they cannot be affected by it.
sample: → Children usually get shots to make them immune to certain diseases.

describe: Input is information that is put into a computer.
sample: → Type the input into the computer program.

describe: When a relationship is intimate, the two things are very closely connected.
sample: → I only tell my secrets to my most intimate friends.

describe: A magnet is a piece of iron or other material which attracts iron toward it.
sample: → I used a magnet to pick up the nails that were scattered on the floor.

describe: A person’s metabolism is the way chemical processes in their body use energy.
sample: → If you exercise every day, your metabolism speeds up.

describe: A microchip is a small device inside a computer that holds information.
sample: → I can put more data on my computer if I buy a more powerful microchip.

describe: A phase is a stage in a process or the gradual development of something.
sample: → The first phase in the recycling project involves finding volunteers to help out.

describe: To pinch means to take a piece of skin between one’s fingers and squeeze.
sample: → I pinched my nose, so I couldn’t smell the odor from the garbage.

describe: When something is prevalent, it is common.
sample: → Growing a beard is more prevalent behavior in men than women.

describe: When something is quantum, it relates to the behavior of atomic particles.
sample: → The physics student studied quantum mechanics.

describe: A ratio is a relationship between two things expressed in numbers or amounts.
sample: → The boy to girl ratio is one to three.

describe: A spiral is a shape which winds round and round in a larger and larger circle.
sample: → A strand of DNA looks like two interlocking spirals.

describe: When something is viral, it is a disease or infection that is caused by a virus.
sample: → The girl was in bed fora week when she had a viral infection.

describe: If you are astounded, you are very surprised.
sample: → I was astounded that Monica won the art competition.

describe: An attribute is a characteristic of a person or thing.
sample: → He isn’t very clever, but he does have some other positive attributes.

describe: If someone is bilingual, then they can speak two languages.
sample: → Since you already know English, after learning French you’ll be bilingual.

describe: A clone is an identical copy of a living creature.
sample: → Scientists recently made a clone of a sheep.

describe: Colloquial describes informal words that are more suitable for speech than writing.
sample: → I find it difficult to understand people if they use colloquial language.

describe: Cosmetics are substances that make the face and skin more beautiful.
sample: → Girls often look nicer when they don’t use so many cosmetics.

describe: To dash means to run or move quickly.
sample: → Helen dashed up the stairs, so she wouldn’t be late for her appointment.

describe: Disgust is a feeling of distaste and anger caused by something rude or unpleasant.
sample: → He felt disgust toward his date because she had such terrible eating habits.

describe: If something is fluorescent, it is such a bright color that it seems to give off light.
sample: → She highlighted the key words in the document with a fluorescent yellow pen.

describe: If you are furious, you are extremely angry.
sample: → My father was furious when he read my bad school report.

describe: A gulf is a gap between people who do not understand each other.
sample: → There has been a gulf between James and Tony since their parents died.

describe: Humanities are subjects which analyze human ideas, such as history and literature.
sample: → Jennifer has always been more interested in humanities than science.

describe: A knot is made when you tie the ends of rope or cord together.
sample: → He tied a knot in his shoelaces, so they wouldn’t come off during the race.

describe: A linguist is someone who studies languages.
sample: → Tony is a good linguist and speaks four different languages.

describe: A participant is someone who joins in a social event or competition.
sample: → There were thousands of participants in this year’s marathon.

describe: If something is plausible, it is reasonable or possible.
sample: → It is plausible that Jack isn’t here today because he is sick.

describe: A ritual is a formal custom that people do regularly.
sample: → Ken was very interested to learn about the religious rituals of the natives.

describe: A sibling is a brother or sister.
sample: → Jane has two siblings, an older brother and a younger sister.

describe: If someone is skinny, they are extremely thin.
sample: → Polly is very skinny. I think she needs to eat more.

describe: If something is vague, it is not clear, and it gives very few details.
sample: → I asked him about his mother’s health, but he was very vague about it.

describe: An acid is a chemical that can burn or dissolve other substances.
sample: → In chemistry class, we mixed two acids together and watched the reaction.

describe: An administration is the group of people who manage a company or organization.
sample: → She hoped she could be promoted to a job in the administration.

describe: Administrative describes anything related to managing a company or organization.
sample: → I work as an administrative assistant to the owner of the company.

describe: Biotechnology is the use of living parts, such as cells, in industry and technology.
sample: → Researchers at the biotechnology company use bacteria to make medicine.

describe: Cholesterol is a substance in fat, tissues, and blood of all animals.
sample: → When people have too much cholesterol, they are at a high risk for heart problems.

describe: A coalition is a group of people or organizations working for a common purpose.
sample: → The companies formed a coalition to make trade less expensive.

describe: When something is deceptive, it encourages one to believe something that is false.
sample: → The scary-looking man’s appearance is deceptive, but he is actually very nice.

describe: Diabetes is a medical condition where a person has too much sugar in their blood.
sample: → Overweight people are more likely to suffer from diabetes than slimmer ones.

describe: To eliminate something that is unwanted means to completely remove it.
sample: → Wearing a seatbelt eliminates some of the dangers of driving a car.

describe: Erosion is the destruction of rock or soil due to flowing water or weather.
sample: → Canyons are formed because rivers of fast-moving water caused erosion.

describe: Ethics are moral beliefs or rules about right or wrong.
sample: → The act of stealing certainly doesn’t go against some people’s ethics.

describe: If something is explicit, it is very clear, open, and truthful.
sample: → The man gave a very explicit account of the car accident.

describe: A framework is a set of rules or ideas that people use to solve problems.
sample: → His ideas fit into the framework of a successful business plan.

describe: To manufacture something means to make it in a factory.
sample: → My father’s company manufactures steel building materials.

describe: A mechanism is a part of a machine that performs a certain function.
sample: → I can’t open my car door because the locking mechanism is broke.

describe: To minimize means to reduce something to the lowest possible level.
sample: → I checked my homework twice to minimize errors I might have made.

describe: Nectar is a sweet liquid produced by flowers that bees and other insects collect.
sample: → Bees use nectar to make their honey.

describe: A notion is an idea or belief about something.
sample: → I have a notion that this route would get us to the beach.

describe: When things are prone to some bad thing, they are likely affected by it.
sample: → Some people are more prone to catching colds than others.

describe: When something is straightforward, it is good because it is easy to understand.
sample: → The teacher’s grading system was straightforward and fair.

describe: If something is astronomical, then it is extremely large.
sample: → It’s an astronomical distance between the Milky Way galaxy and the nearest galaxy.

describe: An atom is the smallest unit of a substance.
sample: → A molecule consists of a combination of two or more atoms.

describe: Breadth is the distance from one side to the other side of something.
sample: → The breadth of the northern wall of the house is twenty meters.

describe: A circumference is the distance completely around a circular object.
sample: → The circumference of the Earth is obviously much larger than a baseball’s.

describe: A comet is an object in space made of ice and rock with a tail of glowing dust.
sample: → Comets take many decades to complete an orbit around a star.

describe: A crater is a large hole in a planet’s or moon’s surface.
sample: → They could clearly see the big crater on the moon through the telescope.

describe: A crescent is the curved shape lit on the moon’s face during its early and late stages.
sample: → Ten days ago the entire moon was bright, but now only a small crescent is shining.

describe: Debris is the small pieces scattered from something wrecked or destroyed.
sample: → The debris from the cube scattered on the floor.

describe: Despair is the complete loss of hope.
sample: → After the other company won the account, our salespeople were filled with despair.

describe: To embed something means to place it firmly within a surrounding thing.
sample: → The logger embedded the ax into the wood after chopping several logs.

describe: A fragment is a small part of something.
sample: → After the light broke, there were fragments of glass to clean up.

describe: A galaxy is any extremely large collection of star systems.
sample: → Our solar system is located in the outer area of our galaxy.

describe: If something is gigantic, then it is extremely large.
sample: → Some dinosaurs were so gigantic that they were the size of buildings.

describe: Gloom is a state of being almost completely dark.
sample: → In the gloom of the morning, it was difficult to see the boat on the lake.

describe: To radiate means to send out energy or heat.
sample: → The heat from the fireplace radiated throughout the room.

describe: To roam means to move around without a plan or purpose.
sample: → All day the cows roamed around the field eating grass.

describe: If something is solitary, then it is lonely or the only one.
sample: → The only thing in the room was a solitary chair.

describe: The spectrum is the full range of color ranging from red to violet.
sample: → You can see the entire spectrum in a rainbow.

describe: A sphere is a three-dimensional round shape, like a ball.
sample: → The balloons were inflated into a variety of colorful spheres.

describe: Status is the position of something or someone in relation to others.
sample: → She had achieved the status of being the smartest girl in the class.

describe: If someone is bankrupt, then they are unable to pay their debts.
sample: → The store had few customers and soon went bankrupt.

describe: To conform to rules or laws is to obey them.
sample: → The new student had to conform to the school’s dress code.

describe: To employ someone means to give work to them.
sample: → The bookstore employed two full-time clerks.

describe: To expel someone means to force them to leave a place.
sample: → Since he would not follow the rules, the principal had to expel the student.

describe: An extension is a part added to something to give it more time or space.
sample: → My parents decided to add an extension to our house for the new baby.

describe: If something is forthcoming, then it is about to happen in the future.
sample: → Some economists predicted that the forthcoming world economy would be severe.

describe: To furnish means to put furniture in a house or room.
sample: → Most homes are furnished with tables, chairs, and beds.

describe: Hygiene is the conditions or methods needed for health and cleanliness.
sample: → People who brush their teeth at least twice a day are practicing good hygiene.

describe: If something is hygienic, then it is clean and unlikely to cause disease.
sample: → My sister works very hard to keep her entire home as hygienic as possible.

describe: A landlord is a man who rents property to a person.
sample: → The landlord collected everyone’s rent money on the first day of every month.

describe: To lease means to rent property, usually an apartment or land.
sample: → When the family first leased the apartment, the rent was very low.

describe: If something is mandatory, then it is required by law.
sample: → It’s mandatory that everyone be at least sixteen to drive a car in the US.

describe: To mend something means to fix it when it is broken or damaged.
sample: → Mother mended the rip in my pants with a piece of cloth.

describe: A mortgage is a loan for property, especially homes and businesses.
sample: → When they bought their new home, the married couple had to sign a mortgage.

describe: Personnel are employees in a business.
sample: → When business increased, we had to hire more personnel.

describe: Plumbing is the system of pipes used in a home to supply water.
sample: → When the plumbing stopped working, no one was allowed to use the toilets.

describe: A tenant is a person who rents property from a landlord.
sample: → The new tenants moved into the house across the street.

describe: If something is trendy, then it is very popular and new.
sample: → Carlo bought a trendy new car.

describe: A utility is a business that supplies services such as water or electricity.
sample: → If you don’t pay the utilities, you may have your electricity turned off.

describe: Whereby means by which or through which.
sample: → The mayor had a new bridge built whereby the citizens could cross the river.

describe: If something is aesthetic, then it is concerned with a love of beauty.
sample: → The dresses were noteworthy for their aesthetic design.

describe: If someone is arrogant, they think that they are more important than others.
sample: → He is very arrogant. Even though he’s not the boss, he tells everyone what to do.

describe: A bias is a person’s likelihood to like one thing more than another thing.
sample: → The mothers had a natural bias for their own child’s picture.

describe: A canyon is a narrow valley with steep walls through which a river often flows.
sample: → The canyon was so deep that the ground inside was covered in shadow.

describe: A creek is a stream or small river.
sample: → Only small fish lived in the shallow waters of the creek.

describe: A drill is a tool with a point that spins in order to make a hole.
sample: → The carpenter used the drill to make several holes in the wood.

describe: An executive is the top manager of a business.
sample: → After twenty years at the company, he finally became the executive.

describe: Fatigue is a feeling of extreme tiredness.
sample: → After three days with little sleep, she was feeling a lot of fatigue.

describe: An incline is a sharp rise in something, especially a hill or mountain.
sample: → This mountain has one of the steepest inclines in the world.

describe: If something is nasty, then it is not nice or pleasant.
sample: → The rotten apple left a nasty taste inside her mouth.

describe: To perceive something means to be aware of it.
sample: → He was talking loudly, so he did not perceive that the music had stopped.

describe: A primate is a type of mammal that includes monkeys, apes, and humans.
sample: → Primates use their hands for such tasks as swinging from branches.

describe: If something is primitive, then it is simple, basic, and not very developed.
sample: → The computers of the 1980s are primitive compared to those of todays.

describe: A stereotype is a general but often incorrect idea about a person or thing.
sample: → There’s a stereotype that pigs are dirty animals. But they are rather clean.

describe: If something is sticky, then it is covered with a substance that things stick to.
sample: → Place the sticky part of the tape against the paper, so it will cling to the wall.

describe: A termite is an insect that lives in groups and feeds on wood.
sample: → The wood we found was full of termites.

describe: If something happens thereby an action, then it is the result of that action.
sample: → He didn’t score a goal, thereby ending his chance at setting a record.

describe: A trail is a path through a wild area.
sample: → A narrow trail cut through the field and over the hills.

describe: A twig is a short and thin branch from a tree or bush.
sample: → They started the fire with a handful of dry twigs.

describe: Welfare is the health and happiness of a person or group.
sample: → Having plenty of clean water is necessary for the welfare of people.

describe: If something is done on one’s behalf, it is done for that person by another.
sample: → The original speaker was sick, so his son gave the speech on his behalf.

describe: To flap means to move quickly up and down or from side to side.
sample: → The tiny bird flapped its wings and ate from the flowers.

describe: A glacier is a large piece of ice that moves very slowly.
sample: → The North Pole is covered by a huge glacier.

describe: The globe refers to the Earth.
sample: → Water covers most of the globe.

describe: When something is horizontal, it is flat and level with the ground.
sample: → The Russian flag has three horizontal stripes of white, blue, and red.

describe: To hum means to make a low, continuous noise.
sample: → The man hummed his favorite song.

describe: An inventory is a supply of something.
sample: → Gwen was checking the inventory to make sure we had what we needed.

describe: If a thought or feeling is inward, it is not expressed or shown to others.
sample: → She had an inward feeling of guilt when she lied to her mother.

describe: A loaf of bread is bread shaped and baked in one piece.
sample: → Could you please buy a loaf of bread for sandwiches?

describe: An oracle is person who speaks with gods and gives advice about the future.
sample: → The king went to the oracle to ask if going to war was a good idea.

describe: To orbit something means to move around it in a continuous, curving path.
sample: → The moon orbits the Earth.

describe: An overview is a general description of a situation.
sample: → My brother gave me an overview of the important parts of the book.

describe: A preview is an opportunity to see something before it is available to the public.
sample: → The band played us a preview of their new song.

describe: If something is previous, then it happened earlier in time or order.
sample: → He turned back to the previous page to read the paragraph again.

describe: To provide something means to supply it.
sample: → Each student was provided with a test and three sharp pencils.

describe: To recur means to happen more than once.
sample: → Burglaries seem to recur over and over in our neighborhood.

describe: When something is relevant, it is important to a certain person or situation.
sample: → The thirty-year-old book about politics is still relevant to our society today.

describe: A rite is a traditional ceremony carried out by a particular group or society.
sample: → Special masks are worn during the rite when a new baby is born.

describe: To stall means to stop a process and continue it at a later time.
sample: → If you give the car a push, it won’t stall.

describe: If something is supernatural, it is not real or explainable by natural law.
sample: → The dragon had supernatural powers such as flying and breathing fire.

describe: To adapt means to change in order to deal with a new situation or addition.
sample: → When he went to the new town, he had to adapt to all the weather changes.

describe: Biological describes the process of life and living things.
sample: → In science, we learned about the biological process of bacterial growth.

describe: When something is cellular, it relates to the cells of animals or plants.
sample: → She used a microscope to see the activity at a cellular level.

describe: When people are dynamic, they are lively and have creative ideas.
sample: → The new, dynamic employee came up with a good way to juggle his work load.

describe: A fantasy is a pleasant situation that people think about but is unlikely to happen.
sample: → Becoming an astronaut is a fantasy shared by many children.

describe: Heredity is the process of passing on features from parents to children.
sample: → The boy’s face is similar to his father’s because of heredity.

describe: When something is internal, it exists or happens inside a person, object, or place.
sample: → We removed the outer case to reveal the computer’s internal wires.

describe: When something is minimal, it is very small.
sample: → My lazy husband does a minimal amount of work around the house.

describe: A pioneer is a person who is the first to discover or be involved in something.
sample: → He was a pioneer of computer programming.

describe: To prescribe medicine means to tell someone to take it.
sample: → When I was sick, the doctor prescribed me flu medicine.

describe: When things are respective, they relate separately to each person just mentioned.
sample: → The boxers were told to return to their respective corners.

describe: To revive someone or something means to restore health or life to them.
sample: → She revived the feeling of warmth in her leg by rubbing it softly.

describe: When rules or systems are rigid, they are severe because they cannot be changed.
sample: → Societies often have rigid rules about the way that people are supposed to act.

describe: A sequence is a number of events or things that come one after another.
sample: → The dominos fell in a sequence of one after another.

describe: To substitute something or someone means to have them take the place of another.
sample: → When I ran out of juice, I had to substitute water to drink in the morning.

describe: A surgeon is a doctor who is trained to do surgery.
sample: → The surgeon operated on the old man’s heart.

describe: Therapy is treatment for a particular physical or mental illness or condition.
sample: → After she broke her legs, she used physical therapy to learn how to walk again.

describe: To transfer something means to move it from one place to another.
sample: → The family transferred the groceries from the shopping cart to the car.

describe: A transition is a process where there is a change from one form to another.
sample: → The weather gets colder during the transition from summer to autumn.

describe: A transplant is an operation in which a damaged part of one’s body is replaced.
sample: → The sick child needed a heart transplant to live.

describe: An aquarium is a building where fish and underwater animals are kept.
sample: → We took a trip to the aquarium and saw a scary shark.

describe: If something is arbitrary, it is not based on any plan or system, so it seems random.
sample: → The classroom had many arbitrary rules that made me confused.

describe: An autobiography is a true story of a person’s life written by that person.
sample: → I read an autobiography about my favorite entertainer.

describe: A convention is behavior that is considered to be common or polite.
sample: → In the US, a popular convention is to shake hands when you meet someone.

describe: If someone is gracious, then they are kind and helpful to those who need it.
sample: → The operator was gracious enough to help me find his number.

describe: To improve something means to make it better.
sample: → He studied hard to improve his test scores from the previous year.

describe: To insulate something means to protect it from heat, cold, or noise.
sample: → People can conserve energy by insulating their houses.

describe: To intrigue means to cause an interest in something or someone.
sample: → Her mysterious past intrigued her new friend.

describe: Longevity is the ability to live for a long time.
sample: → Sea turtles have an amazing longevity.

describe: To misplace something means to lose it.
sample: → I misplaced my wallet, and I didn’t find it until a week later.

describe: When children are naughty, they behave badly or do not do what they are told.
sample: → The boy had to go to his room because he was being naughty.

describe: A norm is a way of behaving that is considered normal in a particular society.
sample: → Wearing a heavy coat all summer is not considered a norm in the desert.

describe: An orangutan is a large ape with red and brown hair and long arms.
sample: → Orangutans use their long arms to swing from trees.

describe: To overload something means to put more things into it than it is meant to hold.
sample: → If you overload the truck, it might crash.

describe: Philanthropy is the act of helping others, without wanting anything in return.
sample: → The wealthy business owner is well known for his acts of philanthropy.

describe: To probe into something means to ask questions to discover facts about it.
sample: → The bank probed into his financial history to see if he qualified for a loan.

describe: A recipient of something is the person who receives it.
sample: → I was the recipient of four phone calls today.

describe: A reptile is a cold-blooded animal that lays eggs and has skin covered with scales.
sample: → Lizards are my favorite type of reptile.

describe: To thrive means to do well and be successful, healthy, or strong.
sample: → He may be an old man, but he continues to thrive.

describe: When something is ultimate, it is the final result or aim of a long series of events.
sample: → By trying hard in school, I will reach my ultimate goal of becoming a doctor.

describe: If something is antique, it is very old and rare, and therefore valuable.
sample: → My grandmother’s antique rocking chair is worth a lot of money.

describe: An applicant is someone who writes a request to be considered for a job or prize.
sample: → Lots of applicants came into the store when the job position became available.

describe: An artifact is an old object made by humans that is historically interesting.
sample: → We studied artifacts from an ancient Chinese settlement.

describe: When something is authentic, it is not false or a copy of the original.
sample: → We ate authentic Italian food on our vacation to Rome.

describe: The chronology of a series of past events is when they happened.
sample: → We learned the chronology of World War II in history class.

describe: A diplomat is a representative of a country who works with another country.
sample: → The Spanish diplomat discussed trade issues with officials in Peru.

describe: An epic is a long book, poem, or movie about a period of time or a great event.
sample: → The poet wrote an epic about the great discoveries of the past thousand years.

describe: An excerpt is a short piece of writing or music taken from a larger piece.
sample: → I didn’t listen to the entire symphony online, but I did play an excerpt.

describe: A fossil is the hard remains of a prehistoric animal or plant.
sample: → The expert arranged the fossils to build the skeleton of the dinosaur.

describe: To humiliate someone means to make them feel ashamed and embarrassed.
sample: → I was humiliated when I tripped and fell down in front of the whole school.

describe: When a poem is considered lyric, it is written in a simple and direct style.
sample: → I enjoy reading and creating my own lyric poetry.

describe: Majesty is supreme greatness or authority.
sample: → You should address the king and queen as your majesty.

describe: The monarch of a country is the king, queen, emperor, or empress.
sample: → The monarch lived in a beautiful palace with a grand gate.

describe: To precede something means to come before it.
sample: → The hurricane was preceded by a moment of still wind and clear sky.

describe: When someone is punctual, they do something or arrive at the right time.
sample: → My mother hates being late. She is the most punctual person I know.

describe: To recruit people means to select them to join or work for an organization.
sample: → We successfully recruited someone to be the new manager.

describe: A refund is money given back to a person when an item is returned to a store.
sample: → I asked for a refund because the shoes I bought were too tight.

describe: A register is an official list or record of people or things.
sample: → At a wedding there is register for all of the guests to sign.

describe: Renown is the quality of being well known due to having done good things.
sample: → Michael is a singer of great renown in New Zealand.

describe: A tusk is a long, curved, pointed tooth of an elephant, boar, or walrus.
sample: → Sadly, some people hunt elephants and remove their tusks to sell them.

describe: A burden is a serious or difficult responsibility.
sample: → Children who do not behave are a burden to their parents.

describe: To compromise is to agree to something that is not exactly what you want.
sample: → We both compromised about the game we decided to play.

describe: To craft something is to make it using skill.
sample: → She crafted the bookcase out of solid pine wood and then painted it.

describe: A crook is someone who is not honest or who commits crimes.
sample: → The manager was arrested by the police for being a crook.

describe: Currency is the form of money used in a certain place.
sample: → Elizabeth had to exchange her dollars for foreign currency.

describe: An enigma is someone or something that is mysterious or hard to understand.
sample: → The theft of the paintings is an enigma to the investigators.

describe: When people or things are fragile, they are not strong and can be damaged easily.
sample: → The fragile glassware was carefully packed into boxes.

describe: A hybrid is a mixture of different things or styles.
sample: → In Greek mythology, a centaur is a hybrid of a man and a horse.

describe: Innocence is a lack of experience of difficult or complex things in life.
sample: → Everyone who met her found her innocence to be charming.

describe: To merge two things is to combine them into one whole thing.
sample: → The storm clouds merged into one large menacing cloud that filled the sky.

describe: When something is moderate, it is not too big or too small in size or amount.
sample: → It takes a moderate amount of patience to be around small children all day.

describe: To overwhelm is to exist in such a large amount that someone cannot deal with it.
sample: → The amount of homework her teacher assigned has overwhelmed her.

describe: A perception of a situation is a way of thinking about it or understanding it.
sample: → Since he couldn’t see, his perception of life was much different than mine.

describe: A reunion is the meeting of people or things that have been separated.
sample: → Every summer we have a family reunion at the lake.

describe: To rig something means to dishonestly arrange it.
sample: → The bad politician rigged the election so that he would win.

describe: A shiver is a shaking movement the body makes when someone is cold or scared.
sample: → I got shivers on my way home because it was so cold.

describe: When someone is sociable, they are friendly.
sample: → Many of my good friends are sociable, but I am shy.

describe: When someone is talkative, they talk a lot.
sample: → My aunt is very talkative whenever she is on the phone.

describe: To tow something is to pull it.
sample: → The truck was towing a trailer behind it.

describe: To tramp is to put your feet down in a loud, heavy way as you walk.
sample: → The baby tramped across the floor as he was learning to walk.

describe: To alleviate pain or suffering means to make it less intense or severe.
sample: → She needed something to alleviate the pain in her back.

describe: Astrology is the study of the stars in the belief that they influence people’s lives.
sample: → Jack, who studies astrology, believes that the stars can predict the future.

describe: To differentiate things or people is to show the difference between them.
sample: → It was hard to differentiate between the identical twins.

describe: To disrupt something or someone is to prevent them from working.
sample: → The loud crash disrupted the class lecture.

describe: An equation is a math operation to determine the value of something.
sample: → I used the Pythagorean theorem to solve the equation.

describe: To err means to make a mistake.
sample: → The pilot erred in his estimate of the time it would take to make the trip.

describe: When something is erroneous, it is incorrect or only partly correct.
sample: → The child held the erroneous belief that time machines were real.

describe: If people or things are frantic, they behave in a wild way because they are frightened.
sample: → The cat became frantic when I tried to give it a bath.

describe: The hull of a boat or tank is the main body of it.
sample: → Afterthe wreckatsea, the ship’s hull was the last part to sink.

describe: When an action is inadvertent, it is done without realizing what you are doing.
sample: → She made an inadvertent error when she knocked over the nail polish.

describe: To improvise something is to do it with whatever is available or without planning.
sample: → There was no meat for the pizza, so we improvised with what was in the fridge.

describe: The latitude of a place is its distance from the equator.
sample: → The device was able to tell the traveler his exact latitude.

describe: A mariner is a sailor.
sample: → The old mariner used his telescope to find the shore.

describe: A multitude of things or people is a very large number of them.
sample: → A multitude of people were waiting at the airport.

describe: A nuisance is a person or thing that is annoying or causes a lot of problems.
sample: → The teenager considered her noisy little brothers to be quite a nuisance.

describe: The permanence of something is its ability to last forever.
sample: → Poor results will threaten the permanence of the new teaching system.

describe: To revolve around something is to keep it as the main feature or focus.
sample: → My life revolves around sports.

describe: To soothe means to calm someone who is angry or upset.
sample: → The mother soothed her crying baby by rocking him in her arms.

describe: If someone is stranded, they are prevented from leaving a place.
sample: → When the plane left, my sister and I were stranded in China.

describe: When something is volatile, it is likely to change suddenly and unexpectedly.
sample: → The volatile volcano might explode at any moment.

describe: When something is arduous, it demands great effort or labor.
sample: → The explorers began their arduous hike up the steep mountain.

describe: To attain something means to gain or achieve it, often after a lot of effort.
sample: → In two more years, I will attain my high school diploma.

describe: To coexist with something means to exist with it in the same time and place.
sample: → Our pets coexist at our home with little or no problems.

describe: To conceive something means to be able to imagine or believe it.
sample: → The child could not conceive the actual size of the Earth.

describe: When something or someone is dubious, they are not considered honest.
sample: → The police thought that the man’s description of the crime was dubious.

describe: An ego is a person’s sense of their own worth.
sample: → Kelly’s ego made her think that she was some kind of a superhero.

describe: Elastic is a rubber that stretches when it is pulled.
sample: → He attached the elastic bungee to his legs before he jumped off the platform.

describe: An endeavor is an attempt to do something, especially something new or original.
sample: → The company’s new advertising endeavor ended in a horrible failure.

describe: To engrave means to cut a design or words into the surface of something.
sample: → The couple engraved their names onto the old pine tree.

describe: To excavate means to dig on land and remove dirt to look for something.
sample: → The team wishes to excavate the site in hopes of finding fossils.

describe: When something is jagged, it has a tough, uneven shape or edge.
sample: → The swimmer was hurt when he fell on the jagged rocks.

describe: A locale is a small area or place where something specific happens.
sample: → The spa was the perfect locale for my mother to relax and enjoy her vacation.

describe: A mold is a hollow container that is used to make certain shapes.
sample: → Using a cupcake mold will ensure that they come out just right.

describe: When something is outright, it is open and direct.
sample: → Everyone knew that the boy’s story was an outright lie.

describe: The periphery of an area, place, or thing is the edge of it.
sample: → A beautiful floral pattern is on the periphery of the stationery.

describe: Plaster is a smooth paste that gets hard when it dries.
sample: → He used plaster to fill in the cracks in the old walls.

describe: A shovel is a tool with a long handle that is used for digging.
sample: → The boy grabbed his shovel and got all of the snow off of the sidewalk.

describe: When something is skeletal, it relates to bones in the body.
sample: → We studied the skeletal system in anatomy class.

describe: If something is terrestrial, it relates to Earth.
sample: → There are billions of terrestrial life forms.

describe: When something or someone is vicious, they are violent and cruel.
sample: → The vicious dog tried to bite the small child.

describe: If something or someone is absurd, they are ridiculous.
sample: → That group of people making animal noises sounds completely absurd.

describe: Anemia is a blood condition that causes a person to be pale and tired.
sample: → When she first developed anemia, she became tired often.

describe: The aristocracy is the highest class of people in certain societies.
sample: → Most members of the aristocracy were very well-fed.

describe: An aristocrat is a person who is of the highest class in certain societies.
sample: → The aristocrat did not need a job because his family was wealthy.

describe: Attire is nice or special clothing.
sample: → Everyone wore their best attire to the president’s daughter’s wedding.

describe: A craze is a brief and popular activity or object.
sample: → Wearing bright red socks was a craze when I was in high school.

describe: To enlarge something means to make it bigger.
sample: → The classrooms were enlarged over the summer to make room for more students.

describe: An excess is an amount of something that is more than needed or wanted.
sample: → Because it never got cold that winter, many stores had an excess of coats.

describe: If something is feminine, then it has qualities that are commonly related to women.
sample: → Many of the older people thought his long hair made him look too feminine.

describe: A hallmark is a unique characteristic of something.
sample: → Different types of pasta and tomato sauces are hallmarks of Italian food.

describe: A pad is a thick piece of soft material used to protect or clean things.
sample: → Football players wear shoulder pads to keep them safe.

describe: If something is predominant, then it is the most important, common or strongest.
sample: → Before cars were invented, horses were the predominant method of travel.

describe: If someone or something is reputable, then they have a good reputation.
sample: → The service from the less than reputable company made her angry.

describe: Rouge is a red powder or cream used as makeup on the cheeks or lips.
sample: → Even when she didn’t wear rouge, her cheeks appeared red.

describe: To signify means to be a symbol of something.
sample: → A red octagon is used to signify to stop.

describe: A strap is a thin long piece of fabric used to fasten, carry, or hold something.
sample: → She put the strap of her purse over her shoulder and walked out of the door.

describe: A tangle is something or many things twisted together.
sample: → The laces of his shoes were in such a tangle that he could not untie them.

describe: Vanity is excessive pride or love of one’s own appearance or things one has done.
sample: → Her vanity won’t allow her to pass a mirror without looking at herself.

describe: To vie for something means to compete against others for it.
sample: → The three boys vied for the prize in the chemistry contest.

describe: If something or someone is vulgar, then they are rude or lacking in style.
sample: → Her vulgar behavior got her into trouble with her parents.

describe: An attic is a room just below a house’s roof.
sample: → There were two windows in their attic.

describe: A chunk is a thick, solid piece of something.
sample: → When they broke open the rock, they saw it was filled with chunks of gold.

describe: If something is civic, then it is related to a town or city, especially its government.
sample: → Most of the important civic buildings are located downtown.

describe: A descent is a movement downwards.
sample: → During the space shuttle’s descent, the Earth became larger and larger.

describe: A din is loud, unpleasant, and extended noise.
sample: → The din of the rusty machinery made the factory a horrible place to work.

describe: To dissatisfy someone means to fail to please them.
sample: → He was dissatisfied with his meal.

describe: A fuss is excited or annoyed behavior that is not useful in any way.
sample: → The child made an awful fuss because she didn’t want to go to bed.

describe: If food is gourmet, then it is nicer and more expensive than regular food.
sample: → In order to get a gourmet meal, you have to eat at an expensive restaurant.

describe: If something happens hence, then it happens as a result of something.
sample: → John forgot the key. Hence, we couldn’t open the door.

describe: If something is intrinsic, then it is related to the basic nature of that thing.
sample: → Paper money has no intrinsic value. It is useful simply because society says it is.

describe: A kettle is a large metal pot used for boiling liquids or cooking food.
sample: → The soup was being cooked in a large kettle.

describe: A ministry is a government department.
sample: → The Ministry of Trade is responsible for taxing imports and exports.

describe: An ordeal is a bad experience.
sample: → Driving in the snowstorm was an ordeal she’d never forget.

describe: If someone is outspoken, then they are not afraid to say what they think.
sample: → She was an outspoken critic about the new banking laws.

describe: To overwork someone means to make them tired with too much work.
sample: → After working for three weeks with only one day of rest, Judy was overworked.

describe: If something is particular, then it is a single, important part of a group of things.
sample: → The dress shop didn’t have the particular dress she was looking for.

describe: If something is pungent, then it tastes or smells strong and sharp.
sample: → The garlic made the soup taste so pungent that the chef wouldn’t serve it.

describe: To snore means to make a loud noise each time a sleeping person breathes.
sample: → It was impossible to get to sleep because my husband snored.

describe: If something is done soundly, then it is done in the best or most complete way.
sample: → The nearest opponent was ten meters behind. She won the race soundly.

describe: A superintendent is a person who runs a certain department or building.
sample: → The superintendent decided to close the schools because of the weather.

describe: To alternate means to switch back and forth between two things.
sample: → The best exercise alternates muscle and heart strengthening.

describe: If someone is apologetic, they are sorry about something.
sample: → The boy felt apologetic after losing his sister’s favorite toy.

describe: If something or someone is benign, they do not hurt anyone.
sample: → Many spiders look scary, but most are actually benign.

describe: To char means to burn something so that it turns black.
sample: → While Frank went inside to get the mustard, he accidentally charred the hotdogs.

describe: To clarify means to make something easier to understand by explaining it.
sample: → Drew tried to clarify all the functions of Michelle’s new computer.

describe: When someone’s actions are dogged, they try hard to continue something.
sample: → Her dad bought her a new jacket after her dogged requests for one.

describe: Distress is the feeling of being upset or worried.
sample: → Failing a class caused the student a lot of distress.

describe: To ensue means to happen after something.
sample: → After a few minutes of lightening, thunder ensued.

describe: To gasp means to make a noise by quickly breathing in when surprised.
sample: → John always gasps when watching a scary movie.

describe: To negotiate means to try to make an agreement through discussion.
sample: → Mario and Joe took a long time negotiating the contract between the companies.

describe: An overdose is an instance of taking or having too much of something.
sample: → John’s skin was burned from an overdose of sunshine.

describe: Persuasion is the act of making someone do or believe something.
sample: → The persuasion of his argument convinced the customer to buy the laptop.

describe: A relay is a race in which teams of runners or swimmers race against each other.
sample: → Jerry was the fastest on his team, so he ran the last part of the relay.

describe: Reluctance is a feeling of not wanting to do something.
sample: → Jesse took out the trash with great reluctance.

describe: To restate something means to say it again or in a different way.
sample: → Mrs. Jones restated the test question to the class.

describe: Sesame is an herb that is grown for its small seeds and its oil.
sample: → I used the buns with the sesame seeds on them.

describe: To sip something means to drink a small amount at a time.
sample: → Liza relaxed on the beach, sipping fruit juice through a straw.

describe: The verge is the point at which something is about to happen.
sample: → Joan was on the verge of leaving her house when the phone rang.

describe: If someone is wary, they are cautious or mistrusting.
sample: → She was wary of going to school because she hadn’t done her homework.

describe: To waver is to be unable to decide between two choices.
sample: → I wavered between eating the apple or the cake for a snack.

describe: If something goes ashore, it goes from water to the land.
sample: → After a long day of fishing, Glen pulled his boat ashore, so it wouldn’t float away.

describe: To contradict means to state the opposite of what someone else has.
sample: → Ken was always fighting with his little sister because she kept contradicting him.

describe: A counterpart is something that is very similar to something else in what it does.
sample: → Our manager will meet our rival company’s counterpart later today.

describe: When something or someone is devoid of a thing, they are missing it.
sample: → The movie was devoid of any violence, so it was a perfect movie for the family.

describe: To diverge is to become different or to follow a different direction.
sample: → The road diverged into two paths that led to our houses.

describe: To elude means to avoid being caught by something.
sample: → The rabbit eluded the wolf by hiding in a bush.

describe: An embryo is a human or animal that is still growing inside its mother.
sample: → Some doctors say that what a mother eats has a big effect on her embryo.

describe: To fend off something means to push it away and avoid it.
sample: → Dave spent all night fending off bugs instead of sleeping.

describe: When something is fictitious, it is made up and not real.
sample: → The author said that the characters in her book were completely fictitious.

describe: A gazette is a newspaper.
sample: → Alice wants to write for a gazette when she’s older.

describe: If something is homogeneous, it is made up of things which are all the same.
sample: → All of the houses on Victor’s block were boring and homogenous.

describe: To obstruct something means to get in its way.
sample: → The car broke down on the road and obstructed traffic for hours.

describe: To plunge means to move down into something very quickly.
sample: → The water in the pool was very cold, but the boy plunged in anyway.

describe: To prolong means to make something last for a longer time.
sample: → Sandy walked slowly across the beach, trying to prolong her lunch break.

describe: To publicize is to make something get a lot of attention.
sample: → The company publicized the job positions in the newspaper.

describe: If something is sparse, there is not very much of it in a big area.
sample: → Rob spent Saturday in his garden, clearing out the sparse weeds.

describe: A surplus is an extra amount of something.
sample: → The store sold their surplus items on sale.

describe: To theorize means to develop ideas about something.
sample: → They enjoyed theorizing about how things worked.

describe: To verify means to find out if something is true.
sample: → Julian called the movie theater to verify that the movie started at nine.

describe: If something or someone is vigorous, they use a lot of energy.
sample: → Henry uses vigorous exercise to keep himself in shape.

describe: An altar is a table used in churches.
sample: → The altar had many lit candles on it.

describe: Arthritis is an illness causing pain and swelling in a person’s joints.
sample: → Agatha couldn’t play the piano anymore because of her arthritis.

describe: Botany is the study of plants.
sample: → Gardens are the best places for botany.

describe: If something or someone is credible, they can be believed or trusted.
sample: → Dick gave a credible reason for being late and didn’t get in any trouble.

describe: If someone is deceased, they are dead.
sample: → We visited the graves of our deceased grandparents.

describe: Deception is the act of lying or tricking someone.
sample: → The magic looked very real, but it was only deception.

describe: To decipher writing is to figure out what it says.
sample: → My teacher complained that she couldn’t decipher my essay.

describe: Dung is solid waste material produced by animals.
sample: → There was cow dung all over the field.

describe: Dusk is the time in the evening when it begins to get dark.
sample: → After dusk, Hannah would catch fireflies in the park.

describe: To gratify someone means to please them.
sample: → Bonnie was gratified after receiving her gift from her parents.

describe: To hone something is to improve it and make it very good.
sample: → Lisa honed her chess skills by hours and hours of practice.

describe: To mash something is to crush it so that it is soft.
sample: → We mashed the hard potatoes and served them for dinner.

describe: If something is ornate, it is decorated with a lot of fancy things.
sample: → Kim’s prom dress was very expensive since it was so ornate.

describe: Pneumonia is a dangerous illness causing the lungs to fill with liquid.
sample: → Elaine got pneumonia after playing outside in the rain without a coat.

describe: When someone is psychic, they know what will happen or what people think.
sample: → I think my grandmother has psychic abilities because she can predict anything.

describe: If someone is psychotic, they have a very serious mental illness.
sample: → The psychotic patient believed he saw things that weren’t real.

describe: The scope of something is how many people or things it relates to.
sample: → Modern history has a wide scope.

describe: If something or someone is sinister, they are evil.
sample: → Bad guys in most movies have sinister laughs.

describe: Strife is disagreement or fighting between people or groups.
sample: → There was a lot of strife between Jim and Lisa about what TV show to watch.

describe: If something is therapeutic, it helps to cure a disease or makes you healthier.
sample: → After a stressful day of working, Phoebe would take a therapeutic bath.

describe: If something is congested, it is full or blocked.
sample: → Tom didn’t get home until after dark because the road was so congested.

describe: A courier is someone who takes and delivers mail or packages.
sample: → Before trains, most couriers used horses to travel.

describe: To deform something means to change it from its correct or original shape.
sample: → The computer program deformed the building’s picture into an unreal sight.

describe: Etiquette is the group of rules about how to be polite.
sample: → When in Asian countries, bowing is a form of etiquette.

describe: If something is exclusive, it is expensive and only for rich people.
sample: → The golf course was so exclusive that most people hadn’t even heard of it.

describe: Freight is a set of items carried on a train, boat, or airplane.
sample: → Trade ships only carried valuable freight like silk and spices.

describe: A garment is a piece of clothing.
sample: → The business man had all of his garments cleaned before the important meeting.

describe: Insomnia is a condition in which a person has difficulty sleeping.
sample: → Nate’s insomnia prevented him from getting enough rest.

describe: Intuitive is knowing about something without naturally having support or proof.
sample: → Rhonda had an intuitive feeling that Shane wasn’t coming to school today.

describe: If something is liable to happen, it is very likely that it will happen.
sample: → During the summer months, hikers in the forest are liable to see deer and elk.

describe: To obsess about something means to think about it all of the time.
sample: → After watching the Star Wars movies, Ike obsessed about becoming a Jedi.

describe: When something is overboard, it is over the side of a boat and in the water.
sample: → Tom and Gary slipped on the wet floor and fell overboard.

describe: A premium is a payment that is higher than average.
sample: → Tony paid for premium gas because it made his car run the best.

describe: A privilege is a special right given to only a certain person or group of people.
sample: → Only the best employee had the privilege of parking in that spot.

describe: To propel something means to push or move it somewhere.
sample: → The strong wind propelled the leaf through the air and across the street.

describe: To socialize is to have a good time with people.
sample: → I like to socialize with my classmates after school.

describe: To suppress something means to prevent it from happening.
sample: → She suppressed her urge to scream because she didn’t want to be noticed.

describe: A tram is a vehicle like a streetcar that runs on electricity above ground.
sample: → I took the tram to Eighth Avenue.

describe: To unsettle someone means to make them anxious or worried.
sample: → The dark clouds in the sky unsettled Beth.

describe: To warp means to become bent into the wrong shape.
sample: → The woman put the clock above the fireplace, and the heat warped it.

describe: An artery is a tube that takes blood from the heart to the rest of the body.
sample: → Eating healthily keeps your arteries clean, so blood can flow with ease.

describe: Deterioration is the act of becoming worse.
sample: → The lack of care led to the deterioration of the house.

describe: If something or someone is elusive, they are hard to find.
sample: → The elusive fish only came out at night.

describe: To forage means to look around for food.
sample: → Many animals hide food in the fall since little can be foraged in winter.

describe: To impede something means to keep it from moving or going forward.
sample: → The barrier impeded our ability to get closer to the building.

describe: To induce something means to make it happen.
sample: → Running without good shoes may induce leg pain.

describe: If two things are inseparable, they can’t be separated.
sample: → Denise and Diana have been inseparable since they first met.

describe: If something is invalid, it is not correct.
sample: → The way to winning debates is to avoid invalid arguments.

describe: To magnify something means to make it look bigger than it really is.
sample: → Astronomers use telescopes to magnify far-away stars.

describe: The mainstream is a group of ideas that are considered normal and accepted.
sample: → Before punk rock music became part of the mainstream, only a few people liked it.

describe: A microbe is a very small living thing that often makes people sick.
sample: → The first step in curing a disease is finding the microbe that causes the disease.

describe: If something is negligible, it is extremely small and not important.
sample: → The amount she owed was negligible. It was less than ten cents.

describe: Paralysis is the loss of the ability to move all or part of your body.
sample: → His paralysis meant that he had to use a wheelchair to get around.

describe: A pest is an animal or insect that hurts plants or food.
sample: → Many farmers put up scarecrows to keep pests off of their corn.

describe: To prevail means to be accepted or very common.
sample: → Unfortunately, injustice still prevails in the country’s court system.

describe: Respiration is the act of breathing.
sample: → Artificial respiration is the best thing to do if someone stops breathing.

describe: To rupture means to tear or burst open.
sample: → Sarah put too much water into the balloon, and it ruptured.

describe: If something or someone is savage, they are very violent or cruel.
sample: → Wild animals are very savage when defending their babies.

describe: To stun someone means to make them unable to speak due to surprise or shock.
sample: → Tim fell off the swing and was too stunned to cry.

describe: If one is susceptible to something like disease, they are easily harmed by it.

describe: To accumulate something is to collect a lot of it over time.

describe: An avalanche is a large amount of snow, ice, and rock falling off a mountain.
sample: → The avalanche destroyed the mountain village.

sample: → Her consistency in archery meant that our team had a chance to win.

describe: Convection is the flow of hot air through gas or liquid.
sample: → The weather changed because of convection in the atmosphere.

describe: To discharge someone is to allow them to leave from a place, usually a hospital.
sample: → I was discharged from the hospital after three days.

sample: → All people are mortal.

sample: → He thought that seeing a black cat in the street was an omen of bad luck.

describe: When something is poignant, it causes a very strong feeling of sadness.
sample: → The girls cried at the end of the poignant movie.

describe: A ranger is a person who protects the forest or parks.

describe: Rubble is piles of broken stone and wood created after a building is destroyed.
sample: → There was rubble all over the city after the earthquake.

describe: To seclude someone means to keep them away from other people.
sample: → She was secluded on an island for over a year.

describe: If something moves sideways, then it moves to or from the side.

sample: → I sobbed when my youngest daughter got married.

describe: A speck is a very small mark or amount.

describe: An upbringing is the way that someone is taught to behave by their parents.
sample: → He had a strict upbringing and was never allowed to watch television.

describe: To advocate a plan or idea is to support or suggest it in public.

describe: To authorize something means to give permission for it.
sample: → The mayor authorized the construction of a new statue in the park.

describe: A civilian is someone who is not in the military.

describe: A commodity is something that can be bought or sold.

describe: A conquest is an event by which one country takes over another country.

describe: To disclose something means to tell it to someone else.

describe: The dynamics of a situation are the way that parts of it affect each other.
sample: → A good psychologist needs to know a lot about the dynamics of brain disorders.

describe: To enroll in something is to put one’s name on a list as a member of a group.
sample: → The students had to enroll in the class one semester in advance.

describe: When someone is envious, they want something that another person has.
sample: → They were envious of their neighbor’s front yard.

describe: Euphoria is a feeling of extreme happiness.
sample: → The athlete felt euphoria after he won the important game.

describe: When something is festive, it is happy and related to a party or celebration.
sample: → Dean’s favorite part of Christmas is the festive clothing that people wear.

describe: When someone is jolly, they are cheerful and happy.
sample: → My grandmother’s jolly attitude always made me smile.

describe: Lentils are very small beans that people cook and eat.
sample: → Danni made her special soup with lentils when her husband was sick.

describe: To marshal a group means to assemble them in order.

describe: Morale is the amount of hope that people have during a difficult situation.

describe: A prophecy is a prediction about what will happen in the future.
sample: → Some people believe that prophecies are actually true.

describe: A sage is someone who is very wise.
sample: → Hal always visited the local sage for help with love.

describe: A senate is a part of the government in some countries.

describe: A sentiment is an opinion based on your feelings.

describe: Unrest is a state of anger about something among the people in a place.

describe: To adorn something means to make it more beautiful by decorating it.
sample: → Small glass beads adorned the vase.

describe: Bliss is a state of complete happiness.
sample: → Every time he sees his girlfriend, he feels a sense of bliss.

describe: A butler is the most important male servant in a wealthy house.

describe: A cramp is a strong pain caused by a muscle after a lot of physical use.

describe: When a building is dilapidated, it is old and in bad condition.

describe: To evoke a memory or emotion means to make it occur.

describe: A farewell is an instance of saying goodbye or a way to say it.

describe: Filth is a large amount of dirt or dirty things that disgust you.
sample: → There was tons of filth and trash on the shore of the river.

describe: A flaw is a mistake in something that causes it to be less effective or correct.
sample: → We discovered a major flaw in the metal chain.

describe: To grin means to smile broadly.
sample: → That joke makes me grin every time I hear it.

describe: Housekeeping is the maintenance of a house or an establishment like a hotel.

describe: A mound of something is a large pile of it.

describe: When a body part is numb, it does not have any feeling.
sample: → After holding my hand under the icy water, my fingers went numb.

describe: When people are reckless, they act in an unsafe way.

describe: Slate is a dark grey rock that can easily be split into layers.

describe: A stool is a seat with legs but no support for a person’s arms and back.

describe: A testament to something shows that it exists or is true.
sample: → The beautiful performance was a testament to the singer’s natural talents.

describe: Timber is wood that is used for building houses and making furniture.

describe: A valve is a device attached to a pipe that controls the flow of liquid or air.

describe: To certify something means to confirm that its results are true.

describe: To collaborate means to work together on something.
sample: → When they collaborated, they managed to finish their chores early.

describe: To compile things means to collect a variety of them into a group.

describe: To counteract something means to act against it in order to reduce or stop it.

describe: To curb something means to prevent it from happening or increasing.

describe: To diagnose someone means to identify the medical condition they have.

describe: To enact something means to make it into a law.

describe: A federation is a group of states or businesses working for a common cause.
sample: → The United Nations is a federation designed to prevent war, disease, and famine.

describe: If something is gross, then it is disgusting.
sample: → The food was so gross that the dog couldn’t eat it without feeling sick.

describe: If something is humane, then it is good and kind.
sample: → Helping build homes for poor people is very humane.

describe: If someone is needy, they are very poor.

describe: To pledge means to make a promise to do something.

describe: To prohibit something means to not allow it.

describe: A rash is an infected area of the skin with redness, bumps, itching, or dryness.

describe: To transmit something means to pass it from one person or place to another.

describe: Camouflage is something used to hide people and things.

describe: To contemplate something means to think about it.

describe: To contend with something means to struggle to overcome it.

describe: A cot is a small portable bed.

describe: A frontier is a border between two regions or countries.

describe: Marrow is the soft substance in the center of bones.

describe: An outfit is a set of clothes worn together, often for a certain job or event.

describe: A paw is an animal’s foot that has claws or soft bottoms.

describe: If something or someone is splendid, then they are very good.

describe: A torch is a stick with one end on fire that can be carried in order to give light.

describe: A tract is a large area of land.

describe: A vigil is a period of watchful attention at night fora specific purpose.

describe: If someone is weary, then they are tired.

describe: To replenish something means to make it full or complete again.

describe: When something is sterile, it is completely clean and free from germs.

describe: A monastery is a building in which monks live.

describe: A nursery is a room where babies and children sleep, play, or are cared for.

describe: If something is outstretched, then it is extended to its full length.

describe: A parcel is a package of things to be carried or mailed somewhere.

describe: A profile is an outline of a face, usually as seen from the side.

describe: If someone is vivacious, they are talkative and cheerful.

describe: If something is winding, then it follows a twisting course.

describe: A constellation is a group of stars with a recognizable shape.

describe: A novelty is something that is new, original, or strange.

describe: To pertain to something means to be related or connected to it.

describe: If something is primal, then it is very basic or related to the origin of something.

describe: A seizure is sudden illness in which the body loses control and shakes.

describe: A utensil is a common tool or container.

describe: An adhesive is a substance used for sticking things together.

describe: If something is adverse, then it is harmful.

describe: To dump something means to throw it away or get rid of it.

describe: If something is eternal, then it lasts forever.

describe: Inclusion is the act of including someone or something in a group.

describe: If something is intermediate, then it is in the middle of two levels, places, or times.

describe: A mentor is a person with experience or knowledge who advises someone.

describe: A phoenix is an imaginary bird that burned to ashes and was reborn.

describe: Photosynthesis is the process in which plants change sunlight and air.

describe: Pollen is the tiny yellow powder made in the flowers of plants.

describe: To regain something means to get it back.

describe: A swarm is a group of flying insects.

describe: Texture is the quality of something that can be known by its touch.

describe: If something is vibrant, then it is bright and full of color.

describe: To abolish something means to put an end to it, such as a system or law.

describe: To amend something means to change it to improve or make it accurate.
sample: → The countries were in agreement that the treaty needed to be amended.

describe: To aspire means to have a strong desire to achieve or do something.

describe: To censor information means to remove it if it is rude or rebellious.
