sample: → The company charter explained that all employees had to pay a tax.

describe: A constitution is a document of principles for a government.
sample: → The country’s constitution said a prime minister could only serve three terms.

describe: When a place is cosmopolitan, it is full of people from many different places.
sample: → There are dozens of different types of restaurants in a cosmopolitan city.

describe: To disseminate information or knowledge means to distribute it.
sample: → The organization disseminates information about the dangers of smoking.

describe: To flatter people means to praise them in an effort to please them.
sample: → He was just flattering me when he said that my new dress looked gorgeous.

describe: When someone is infamous, they are well known for something bad.
sample: → That news channel is infamous for presenting biased information.

describe: If one is lame, they cannot walk properly due to an injury to the leg or foot.
sample: → The terrible accident left many people dead and several others lame.

describe: To limp means to walk with difficulty because someone’s leg or foot is hurt.
sample: → After the injury, the player limped off of the field.

describe: An outburst is a sudden, strong expression of an emotion.
sample: → There was an outburst of cheers when the comedian took the stage.

describe: When a behavior is pathological, it is extreme, unacceptable, and uncontrollable.
sample: → The pathological liar could not even tell the truth about unimportant matters.

describe: When something is phenomenal, it is unusually great.
sample: → The child’s ability to play the piano is nothing short of phenomenal.

describe: A poll is a survey in which people give their opinions about important things.
sample: →  The poll showed that many people support the plan to stop gang violence.

describe: Remorse is a strong feeling of sadness and regret.
sample: → When I realized what I did, I felt remorse for my actions.

describe: Secrecy is the behavior of keeping things secret.
sample: → The secrecy of the big organization made the government nervous.

describe: To tackle something means to deal with it in a determined and efficient way.
sample: → Such social problems need to be tackled right away.

describe: A trance is a a state where people seem asleep and have no control of themselves.
sample: → The woman’s powerful eyes often put men in a trance.

describe: A coward is a person who lacks courage to do risky or dangerous things.
sample: → A firefighter cannot be a coward. They have to be able to act quickly.

describe: To delete something means to remove or erase written material.
sample: → Several lines had been deleted from her speech.

describe: If something is firsthand, then it is from an original source.
sample: → If you want firsthand knowledge, ask someone who saw it.

describe: If someone is earnest, then they are honest.
sample: → The child was very earnest when she told her mother how she broke the dish.

describe: If something is ethnic, then it is related to a group with a similar culture.
sample: → Many sections of the city are home to different ethnic communities.

describe: To exclude someone means to not accept them into a group.
sample: → Carol was excluded from the contest because her friend was a judge.

describe: If someone is fluent in a language, then they are able to speak it very well.
sample: → She was so fluent in German that you’d have thought she was from Germany.

describe: If something is imperial, then it is of, or related to an empire.
sample: → These old imperial coins were once used in the Roman Empire.

describe: If something is inclusive, then it is open to all groups and people in society.
sample: → A more inclusive event would have allowed children to attend.

describe: A legislature is the section of a government that makes laws.
sample: → The senator had served ten years in the national legislature.

describe: If something is linguistic, then it is concerned with language.
sample: → A linguistic way of studying culture focuses on words within that culture.

describe: If someone is monolingual, then they speak only one language.
sample: → In today’s global economy, being monolingual limits your opportunities.

describe: Nationality is an identity based on the nation from which you come.
sample: → His nationality is German, but he speaks French, Spanish, and Korean.

describe: A patriot is someone who loves, supports, and defends their country.
sample: → Every year young patriots join their countries’ militaries.

describe: To prosecute someone means to take legal action against them.
sample: → They were prosecuted for fishing in the river without a permit.

describe: If something is racial, then it is related to a race or races.
sample: → The differences between racial groups are physical characteristics and culture.

describe: If something is solemn, then it is serious and honest.
sample: → The professor preferred a solemn relationship between him and his students.

describe: Solidarity is a union formed from common responsibilities or interests.
sample: → All the citizens came together in a show of solidarity to create change.

describe: Tact is the ability to avoid offending people when dealing with problems.
sample: → Since both sides would not agree, it required someone with tact to make peace.

describe: To undermine someone means to betray or weaken their efforts or authority.
sample: → The documents helped to undermine the workers’ trust in their bosses’ honesty.

describe: To allocate something means to put it aside for a certain purpose or person.
sample: → The government allocated $100 million to aid the disaster relief effort.

describe: When food is appetizing, it looks and smells very good.
sample: → The appetizing plate of cookies was gone in half an hour.

describe: A blizzard is a severe snow storm with strong winds.
sample: → We did not dare to go outside during the terrible blizzard.

describe: A cavity is a hole or space in something.
sample: → There was a small cavity in the wall of the cave where an animal lived.

describe: If something moves clockwise, it moves in a circle in the same direction as a clock.
sample: → Turn the screw clockwise to tighten it.

describe: When circles or rings are concentric, they have the same center.
sample: → The target was a series of concentric circles.

describe: Courtesy is the excellence of manners or social conduct.
sample: → Jenna always behaves with great courtesy when people visit her home.

describe: When food is crisp, it is hard or has a hard surface in a way that is pleasant.
sample: → My favorite snack is a bag of crisp, delicious potato chips.

describe: Discord is disagreement or fighting between people.
sample: → There was much discord between the experts on the talk show.

describe: When something is frigid, it is extremely cold.
sample: → We decided not to go on the hike because the weather was too frigid.

describe: To generate something means to cause it to develop or begin.
sample: → The mayor promised to generate new jobs and programs to help the poor.

describe: When something is glacial, it relates to large masses of ice that move slowly.
sample: → Penguins thrive in the glacial regions of Antarctica.

describe: An interchange of ideas between people is a discussion of each person’s idea.
sample: → There was an interchange of ideas between the groups.

describe: A locker is a small cabinet with a lock where people store their possessions.
sample: → I keep my school books in my locker.

describe: When something is multicultural, it relates to many different cultures.
sample: → Everyone was welcomed to attend the multicultural celebration.

describe: An omission is something that has been left out or not done.
sample: → Mike was upset because of the omission of his name during the ceremony.

describe: To oversee something means to make sure that it is being done properly.
sample: → His job was to oversee the progress of the construction project.

describe: To pierce something means to make a hole in it using a sharp object.
sample: → The arrow pierced the target in the very center.

describe: To replicate something is to do it in the exact same way as someone before.
sample: → I would love to replicate my father’s achievements in school.

describe: When something is wavy, it is not straight but has a series of curves.
sample: → The child drew wavy lines all over the piece of paper.

describe: To abide by something, like a rule, means to obey it.
sample: → If you want to play the game with us, you must be willing to abide by our rules.

describe: Conversion is the act of changing something into a different state or form.
sample: → The city discussed the conversion of the parking lot into a skateboard park.

describe: To cram things means to put them into a place that can barely contain them.
sample: → He crammed all of his shirts into the top drawer of the dresser.

describe: To defer means to arrange for an action to happen at a later time.
sample: → The girl was very sleepy, so she chose to defer her bath until morning.

describe: To export products means to sell them to other countries.
sample: → The United States exports many cereals and grains.

describe: Fumes are unhealthy smoke and gases that are made by fires or chemicals.
sample: → The engine put unpleasant, black fumes into the air.

describe: When something is habitual, it is a behavior that a person usually does or has.
sample: → The man was a habitual liar who was incapable of being honest with the police.

describe: To justify something means to show or prove that it is necessary.
sample: → The government tried to justify its decision to bring the country into a war.

describe: Output is the amount of something that a person or thing produces.
sample: → The boss hired more workers to increase the factory’s output of products.

describe: Overpopulation is the state of having too many people in an area.
sample: → The organization is concerned with overpopulation of the world.

describe: A patent is a right to be the only person allowed to make or sell a new product.
sample: → He quickly established a patent for his brilliant invention.

describe: To penalize someone means to punish him or her.
sample: → The team was penalized when they broke the rules.

describe: Petroleum is a liquid natural resource from which many fuels are made.
sample: → The petroleum at that factory is used to make gasoline.

describe: A prototype is a new machine that is not ready to be made in large quantities.
sample: → He introduced his prototype to the motorcycle company.

describe: A scrap of something is a small amount of it.
sample: → Chris liked to use many scraps of paper when thinking up ideas.

describe: A sector is a part of a country’s economy in a specific type of industry.
sample: → We learned about just a few of the factories within the manufacturing sector.

describe: To subscribe to something is to agree or to concur with it.
sample: → She subscribed to the view that musical education should be kept in schools.

describe: To subsist means to have the food, water, and money needed to stay alive.
sample: → Some people are forced to subsist on only a few dollars a month.

describe: To suspend something means to delay or stop it from happening for a while.
sample: → The oil company suspended production until it was sure the factory was safe.

describe: A synthesis is a combination of different ideas or styles.
sample: → The band’s music was a synthesis of many different musical genres.

describe: An acrobat is a person who entertains people by doing amazing physical things.
sample: → There were acrobats at the circus that did impressive and complicated jumps.

describe: Advocacy is the act of supporting or recommending something.
sample: → Janine’s strong advocacy for the event made people want to attend.

describe: If something is communal, it involves a group of people.
sample: → On the weekends, Theo and his son picked up trash in the communal park.

describe: If something is fluid, it is smooth and moves gracefully.
sample: → Boris was a famous ballet dancer because people admired his fluid movements.

describe: To harmonize means to make different things go well together.
sample: → The sweet and sour flavors of the dish harmonized well and tasted great.

describe: If someone is industrious, they work hard.
sample: → Dennis was very industrious, so he never had problems finding a job.

describe: When someone is inventive, they are good at creating new things.
sample: → The inventive student built a robot to help her with her chores.

describe: If something is judicial, it is related to judges or courts of law.
sample: → The laws changed the way the judicial system was structured.

describe: Mandarin is one of the two main Chinese languages.
sample: → Although John’s parents both spoke Mandarin, he could only speak English.

describe: If something is metropolitan, it relates to a large city.
sample: → All of the metropolitan excitement of New York City made Rufus nervous.

describe: To mimic something means to copy the way it sounds or moves.
sample: → The hunter mimicked a duck’s call and shot the two ducks that called back.

describe: When something is misguided, it is based on bad judgment or wrong beliefs.
sample: → The snake bit Molly during her misguided attempt to grab it.

describe: To rehearse means to practice and prepare for a performance in front of people.
sample: → Vick’s band rehearsed all week before their first show.

describe: To scorn someone means to behave without respect toward them.
sample: → The criminal was scorned by everyone in the community.

describe: If something is sensory, it is related to the senses.
sample: → Iris and Eric preferred the sensory thrill of watching movies in the theater.

describe: If something is staple, it is standard or basic.
sample: → Hamburgers, steaks and hotdogs are staple foods to cook on a grill.

describe: A statute is a law that is official and has been written down.
sample: → The new statute made it illegal to walk dogs in the park.

describe: A veteran is someone who has a lot of experience doing something.
sample: → Hank was the team veteran and had played in more games than anyone else.

describe: A villain is an evil person who breaks the law or hurts others.
sample: → The villain escaped with half of my family’s valuables.

describe: A vine is a plant that has long, twisting stems and climbs upward.
sample: → The branches of the trees were covered with vines.

describe: To constrain something means to limit its development.
sample: → Jim cannot join us because he is constrained by previous plans.

describe: A depot is a bus or train station.
sample: → He waited for his mother to arrive at the depot.

describe: To emulate people means to imitate them because they are greatly admired.
sample: → As a small boy, he always tried to emulate his big brother.

describe: The forefinger is the finger between one’s thumb and middle finger.
sample: → He shouted, “ There it is!” and pointed with his forefinger.

describe: The guts are all the organs inside a person or animal.
sample: → The doctor can tell you every process that happens in one’s guts.

describe: When something is inherent, it is a natural part of something else.
sample: → Sweating is an inherent bodily function when exercising.

describe: To intimidate means to frighten others.
sample: → My dad intimidates my friends whenever they visit.

describe: A janitor is a person who makes repairs and takes care of a building.
sample: → The school janitor cleaned up the messy cafeteria.

describe: When something is moist, it is slightly wet.
sample: → The ground is still moist from the rain last night.

describe: Nope is an informal way of saying “ no.”
sample: → He asked if I had any money, and I had to say, “Nope. ”

describe: To prod means to push someone or something with a finger or pointed object.
sample: → The bully prodded me in the chest with his finger.

describe: A ransom is a sum of money paid to a kidnapper to set the person free.
sample: → He kidnapped the prince and demanded $1 million as ransom.

describe: To restrain someone or something means to use physical strength to stop them.
sample: → Mike restrained Allen from reaching the door.

describe: Saliva is the watery liquid in people’s mouths that helps in digestion.
sample: → The baby could not keep the saliva from dripping out of its mouth.

describe: To spit means to force liquid from one’s mouth.
sample: → He emerged from the pool and spit water from his mouth.

describe: To sprint means to run very fast over a short distance.
sample: → The kids didn’t want to be late to class, so they sprinted to the bus stop.

describe: A stunt is something that is done in order to get attention or publicity.
sample: → The man jumped over the cars as a promotional stunt.

describe: When people are tolerant, they are approved of because they accept others.
sample: → The tolerant leader thought that everyone was equal regardless of race.

describe: A vampire is a fictional monster that sleeps in a coffin and sucks people’s blood.
sample: → The vampire snuck up on the woman and bit her in the neck.

describe: To yawn means to open one’s mouth wide and breathe in air.
sample: → The child yawned and stretched her arms before bed for the night.

describe: An analogy is a connection made between things to show that they are similar.
sample: → The doctor made an analogy between the human heart and a water pump.

describe: A person's ancestry is the series of people from whom a person descended.
sample: → We studied our ancestry and found out that we are related to royalty.

describe: An archer is a person who uses a bow and arrows.
sample: → The expert archer hit the target every time.

describe: A conspiracy is a secret plan made by a group of people to do something illegal.
sample: → Some people think that there was a conspiracy to kill American president John Kennedy.

describe: A deputy is the second-highest-ranking person in a business or government.
sample: → While the sheriff was ill, the deputy took over his duties.

describe: An earl is a nobleman from Britain.
sample: → The Earl of Canterbury lived in a huge mansion.

describe: When something is fragrant, it has a pleasant smell.
sample: → The girl picked delicious berries and fragrant flowers.

describe: A funnel is an object with a wide top and a narrow bottom for pouring liquids.
sample: → The worker used a funnel when he poured the oil into the engine.

describe: If something is hereditary, it is a trait passed onto children from their parents.
sample: → The hereditary disease affected three generations of children.

describe: A hymn is a religious song that often praises a god.
sample: → The book was filled with hymns that the worshippers sang.

describe: To invert something means to turn it upside down.
sample: → He inverted the bicycle to make repairs on the wheels.

describe: Prey is the animals that are hunted and eaten by another creature.
sample: → The lion ran as fast as he could to catch his prey.

describe: A procession is a group of people who walk or drive in a line during a public event.
sample: → The procession all celebrated when they reached the end.

describe: A prophet is a person chosen by a god to give the god’s message to people.
sample: → Harold believed that he was one of the prophets of his god.

describe: When something is sarcastic, it is the opposite of what is actually meant.
sample: → She hurt her mother’s feelings with her constant sarcastic remarks.

describe: Seasoning is a mix of salt, herbs, and spices that improves the taste of food.
sample: → This steak tastes bland. Maybe I’ll add some seasoning to it.

describe: Sodium is an element that can be used to make substances such as salt.
sample: → Sodium and chloride combine to make table salt.

describe: A tyranny is a cruel and unfair government in which one person has power.
sample: → His tyranny was impossible to live under.

describe: A tyrant is someone who treats people in a cruel, harsh, and unfair way.
sample: → Our boss is a tyrant. He makes us work long hours for little pay.

describe: Vinegar is a strong liquid made from sour wine that is used in cooking.
sample: → Be careful because too much vinegar will ruin the recipe.

describe: If something is adjoining, it is next to or joined with a building, or room.
sample: → I couldn’t sleep because the people in the adjoining room were loud.

describe: To allege something is to say that it is true without offering proof.
sample: → The little girl had alleged that her older brother hid her favorite doll.

describe: An arch is a curved opening formed under a structure such as a bridge or doorway.
sample: → The arch of the bridge was not high enough for the tall boat to pass underneath.

describe: To assemble means to get together in one place.
sample: → The parents assembled to discuss ways to improve their children’s education.

describe: A casualty is a person killed or injured in a war or an accident.
sample: → The only casualty in the car accident was a woman who broke her arm.

describe: To erect something means to build it.
sample: → The king erected two towers on the north and south sides of his castle.

describe: If something is foul, then it is not pleasant or enjoyable.
sample: → He wouldn’t let his dog drink from the water because it had a foul smell.

describe: A hectare is a unit of measure equal to 10,000 square meters.
sample: → His family farm covered many hectares.

describe: To heighten an emotion means to increase the intensity of it.
sample: → The pleasant music heightened their enjoyment of the wonderful dinner.

describe: Hospitality is friendly behavior and entertainment given to guests or strangers.
sample: → The travelers were amazed at the hospitality given them by the hotel’s staff.

describe: A mansion is a large and expensive home.
sample: → The mansion had thirty bedrooms, two kitchens, and a pool.

describe: To outnumber a group means to have a greater number than it.
sample: → The girls outnumbered the boys at the school by four to one.

describe: If someone is overjoyed, then they are extremely happy.
sample: → He was overjoyed by the news of his promotion.

describe: A pasture is an area of land covered with grass for animals to use as food.
sample: → The sheep were taken to a pasture where there was more grass.

describe: A petition is a written request asking an authority to do something.
sample: → The citizens all signed a petition asking the mayor to repair the sidewalks.

describe: To renovate a building means to repair it or build new structures on it.
sample: → The old fire station was renovated into an apartment building.

describe: To revise something means to change or update it to make it better.
sample: → When the editor discovered certain facts were wrong, he revised the book.

describe: A slab is a large, thick, flat piece of stone, concrete, metal, or wood.
sample: → I looked at various slabs of stone to decorate my house.

describe: A terrace is an open area that is connected to a house or an apartment.
sample: → In the afternoons, she liked to sit on the terrace and check her email.

describe: Turf is a section of grass and the dirt in which it grows.
sample: → After the game, the turf looked ragged.

describe: If something is analogous to another thing, then it is like it in certain ways.
sample: → The relationship with his teacher was analogous to that of a son and mother.

describe: Binoculars are a device used for seeing things that are far away.
sample: → He could see the ship on the horizon only if he used his binoculars.

describe: The bulk of something is its great size.
sample: → The large elephant moved its bulk with legs as strong as tree trunks.

describe: If something comprises something else, it consists of or is made up of it.
sample: → Our school’s football team is mostly comprised with seniors.

describe: To depict something means to show or portray it, often using art.
sample: → The statue’s face depicted the general’s determination and courage.

describe: If something is dual, then it is made up of two parts.
sample: → The room had a dual function. It was a living room, but at night it was a bedroom.

describe: Fahrenheit temperature is a scale where water freezes at 32° and boils at 212°.
sample: → When the temperature dropped to 32° Fahrenheit, it started snowing.

describe: To fulfill something means to achieve or finish it.
sample: → The professor did not fulfill his promise not to miss a single class.

describe: A grove is a small group of trees.
sample: → All the trees in this grove are apple trees.

describe: Ore is the raw form of rock or material from which a valuable metal is taken.
sample: → The factory melted the ore and used it to make iron products.

describe: The outback is the wild inland region of Australia where very few people live.
sample: → Many Australian farmers use the outback to raise cattle.

describe: To outweigh something means to exceed it in value, amount, or importance.
sample: → Finding a warm place to sleep outweighed the need to find something to eat.

describe: A paradox is a true statement or real event that seems illogical.
sample: → The paradox of her work was that the less she worked, the more she got done.

describe: A pier is a structure that extends into a body of water.
sample: → If you want to catch bigger fish, then go to the far end of the pier.

describe: A shortcut is a route that is shorter than the main route.
sample: → We got to the house first because we took a shortcut through the forest.

describe: A tariff is a tax or fee paid on certain imports or exports.
sample: → Our tariff on imported wool makes foreign wool more expensive.

describe: A thermometer is a device that measures temperature.
sample: → The thermometer outside the window indicated that it was a hot day today.

describe: To tilt something means to tip it into a sloping position.
sample: → She tilted her glass and almost spilled some of the wine inside.

describe: If a statement is vice versa, then its two main ideas are switched with one another.
sample: → Students learn from their teachers, and vice versa.

describe: The whereabouts of someone or something is the place where they are.
sample: → The police looked for the lost dog, but its whereabouts were still unknown.

describe: Amber is a hard, yellowish material that comes from trees.
sample: → The necklace was made from pieces of amber.

describe: Charcoal is a black material that is used as fuel for fire.
sample: → There was burnt charcoal left on the ground from an old fire.

describe: A columnist is a writer who creates articles about a particular subject.
sample: → The columnist won praise for his articles about life on the farm.

describe: When someone is courteous, they are polite and respectful.
sample: → The mother asked her family to be courteous to their guests.

describe: Credentials are the proof of someone’s experience or ability to do something.
sample: → The mechanic hung his credentials on his office wall.

describe: A cricket is an insect that makes loud noises, usually at night.
sample: → In the country, we could see the stars and hear the crickets at night.

describe: A delta is flat area where a river splits into smaller rivers that flow into the sea.
sample: → The archeologists found many ancient materials in the delta of the Nile River.

describe: Detergent is soap that is used to clean clothes or dishes.
sample: → My brother added too much detergent to the wash, and bubbles got all over the floor.

describe: A euphemism is a term that is used in place of a mean or unpleasant word.
sample: → “Window maintenance officer” is a euphemism for a window washer.

describe: To expire is to no longer be effective because its use has come to an end.
sample: → The man’s driver’s license was going to expire in two days.

describe: Granite is a very hard type of rock that is often black or pink.
sample: → The kitchen counter was made of granite.

describe: Gravel is a combination of small stones mixed with sand.
sample: → The ground around the swing set was covered with gravel.

describe: To haunt is to cause problems or negative thoughts over a long period of time.
sample: → His thoughts about his scary dream haunted him for weeks.

describe: When someone is liberal, they accept different ideas and people.
sample: → My grandparents aren’t as liberal as my parents.

describe: A maze is a system of paths that is complicated and easy to get lost in.
sample: → We got lost in the maze in the garden.

describe: Moss is a small green or yellow plant that grows on wet dirt, rocks, or tree trunks.
sample: → Be careful not to slip on the moss that’s covering those rocks.

describe: A pebble is a small, round stone.
sample: → We threw pebbles into the lake to make the water splash.

describe: When a bird pecks, it bites or hits something with its beak.
sample: → The birds pecked at the seeds on the ground.

describe: A reservoir is a place for storing water for a town to use.
sample: → If it doesn’t rain soon, the reservoir is going to dry up completely.

describe: A streak is a long, thin mark that is easy to see.
sample: → Her hair was brown except for a streak which she dyed blonde.
